body: The company will sell its remaining 24,100,400 treasury shares on the Indonesia Stock Exchange between 6 Oct 2025 and 5 Oct 2026. This follows a 2022 buy‑back of 27.9 million shares and a partial resale of 3,799,600 shares in late 2023, leaving the current treasury balance for the upcoming offering.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Resumes Trading of PT Koka Indonesia Tbk After Suspension Over Controlling Shareholder Breach
body: BEI lifted the suspension of PT Koka Indonesia Tbk’s shares on 26 September 2025, with the stock trading flat at Rp184 after a period of strong gains (84% month‑on‑month, 124.6% six‑month, 183% YTD). The company clarified that the proposed acquisition of a 63.5% stake by Ningbo Lixing Enterprise Management Co., Ltd remains a non‑binding plan pending regulatory approval and does not yet constitute a change of control.

title: PT Pakai Donk Nusantara launches QRIS acquirer service in partnership with PT Rintis Sejahtera and PT Penyelesaian Transaksi Elektronik Nasional
body: The Jakarta launch announced that PT Pakai Donk Nusantara, a Category 1 payment service provider licensed by Bank Indonesia, has received official QRIS acquirer approval and will offer merchants faster settlement, broad integration and security. The service, developed with PT Rintis Sejahtera and PT Penyelesaian Transaksi Elektronik Nasional, aims to expand digital payment inclusion for UMKM and the wider Indonesian market.

title: Deputy Agriculture Minister Urges Regions to Finish Irrigation Projects Amid Rp12 Trillion Central Funding
body: Deputy Agriculture Minister Sudaryono urged provincial and district leaders not to divert irrigation budgets and to accelerate completion of irrigation projects, citing President Prabowo Subianto’s new policy that consolidates authority across all government levels and the allocation of Rp12 trillion to resolve nationwide irrigation issues. He highlighted that 80,000 irrigation points are slated for improvement next year and stressed the need for joint efforts to ensure water flow and food security.

title: BGN to Ban Factory-Made Foods in Free Meal Program, Shift to Local Suppliers Amid Food Poisoning Concerns
body: BGN announced it will stop sourcing manufactured food from conglomerate-owned factories for its free meal program, instead relying on local micro, small, and medium enterprises and allowing packaged milk only when no local dairy farms are available. The agency warned MBG kitchen operators not to serve factory-made products, citing recent food‑poisoning incidents linked to MBG packages and a case where chicken was stored for days before being served.

title: Indonesia Parliament Approves Freeze on Tobacco Excise Tariffs for 2026
body: Indonesia’s parliament backed Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa’s decision not to raise tobacco excise tariffs in 2026, citing industry pressures, job risks and state revenue concerns. Commission XI chairman Mukhamad Misbakhun urged a comprehensive review of the tobacco tariff framework to curb illegal trade, sustain revenue and protect livelihoods in the sector.

title: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia TBK Achieves 99.1% Digital Transaction Share, Expands Digital Ecosystem with Brimo and AgentBrilink
body: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia TBK (Bri) reports that digital banking accounts for 99.1% of its total transactions, with 702,000 e‑channel units including 10,650 ATMs, 9,007 CRM units, and 682,370 merchants. By August 2025, Brimo users grew 20.35% YoY to 43.9 million, while AgentBrilink reached over 1 million agents in 66,691 villages, processing Rp1.14522 trillion in 734 million transactions.

title: Waskita Karya Advances Jakarta-Cikampek South Toll Road to 90% Completion, Targeting Mid-2026 Finish
body: Waskita Karya reports that the 31.25‑km Jakarta‑Cikampek South toll segment is 90.11% complete as of September 2025, with the full 62‑km project expected to finish by mid‑2026. The company highlights BIM technology, reduced travel time from Jakarta to Bandung to 45 minutes, and potential economic benefits such as job creation and tourism access.

title: Kalbe Farma Divests 5.5 Million Shares of Enseval Putera Megatrading at Rp2,400 Each, Reducing Ownership to 91.98%
body: Kalbe Farma sold 5.5 million shares of Enseval Putera Megatrading at Rp2,400 per share, a price 80 points (3.44%) above the September 25, 2025 closing of Rp2,320. The divestiture lowered Kalbe's stake to 2.491 billion shares (91.98%) and caused a 0.2% dilution, with no material impact on the company’s operations or financial condition.

title: Prajogo Pangestu Sells 84.64 Million Shares of Barito Renewables Energy at Rp8.247 Each, Raising Rp698.03 Billion
body: Prajogo Pangestu sold 84.64 million shares of Barito Renewables Energy through Green Energy Pte Ltd on 24 September 2025 at Rp8.247 per share, a 7.59% discount to the 22 September closing price of Rp8.925, generating Rp698.03 billion. After the sale, Nancy Pangestu remains the largest shareholder with 29.32 million shares (21.92%), and the divestment is part of a strategy to increase the company’s free float, following a prior sale of 163.83 million shares between 11 August and 15 September 2025.

title: IHSG Expected to Strengthen This Week Amid Fed Rate Cut Optimism and EU Trade Sentiment
body: The Indonesia Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 8,099 last Friday, up 0.6% from the previous week, even as foreign investors recorded a net sell‑off of Rp 1 trillion; analysts from PT Indo Premier Sekuritas point to fiscal discipline under the new finance minister and a 2026 cigarette tax moratorium as key drivers, recommending gradual accumulation in banking, consumer, and export commodity stocks, with short‑term bullish picks such as PT Hm Sampoerna Tbk (target Rp 3,470) and PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk (target Rp 1,490).

title: Indonesia Property Sector Expected to Remain Positive Through 2025 Amid Interest Rate Cuts and VAT Incentives
body: Analysts Liza Camelia, Ismail Fakhri, and Harry Su project continued growth in the property market through 2025, citing Bank Indonesia’s 4.75% bi‑rate cut, extended VAT‑incentive periods, and KPR interest subsidies that boost pre‑sales and liquidity. They recommend buying shares of CTRA, BSDE, SMRA, PWON, and PT Sentul City Tbk with target prices ranging from Rp 480 to Rp 1,600 per share.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange monitors unusual price movements in five listed companies
body: The BSE flagged unusual market activity for PT Boston Furniture Industries Tbk, PT Caturkarda Depo Bangunan Tbk, PT Wismilak Inti Makmur Tbk, PT Era Graharealty Tbk, and PT Metro Healthcare Indonesia Tbk, noting that PT Wismilak Inti Makmur surged 25.82% last week and 105% YTD, while PT Caturkarda Depo Bangunan rose 41.53% last week and 67.84% YTD, and other stocks showed significant YTD gains. On Monday’s open, PT Wismilak Inti Makmur fell 6.84% to Rp1,430, PT Caturkarda Depo Bangunan rose 10.18% to Rp368, and PT Sofa and PT IPAC gained 9.76% and 9.62% respectively, prompting the BSE to urge investors to review company disclosures and corporate action plans pending RUPS approval.

title: Ristia Bintang Mahkotasejati to Manage Hotel Indigo Ubud Following Tiara Hotel Bali Indonesia’s Agreement with IHG Hotels & Resorts
body: Tiara Hotel Bali Indonesia signed a hotel management agreement with IHG Hotels & Resorts on 22 September 2025, appointing Ristia Bintang Mahkotasejati as the operator of Hotel Indigo Ubud. The 5‑star resort, located on 1.3 hectares in Gianyar, Bali, began foundation work in 2025 and is slated to open in 2028, with the partnership expected to generate positive long‑term recurring income for the company.

title: United Tractors Announces Interim Dividend of Rp2.05 Trillion for FY 2025
body: United Tractors will distribute an interim dividend of Rp2.05 trillion, equivalent to about 25% of its net profit of Rp8.13 trillion as of June 30, 2025, giving shareholders Rp567 per share. The dividend will be recorded on October 9, 2025, with payment scheduled for October 24, 2025.

title: Asri Karya Lestari Reports First Semester 2025 Loss of Rp19.94 Billion, Revenue Up 7.66%
body: Asri Karya Lestari posted a net loss of Rp19.94 billion for the first semester of 2025, a 447.8% increase from the Rp3.64 billion loss in the same period last year, while revenue rose 7.66% to Rp115.02 billion. Gross profit fell 82.2% to Rp4.08 billion, and the company’s equity declined to Rp467.9 billion from Rp487.85 billion, with total liabilities rising to Rp88.2 billion.

title: Jora Divests 135.24 Million Shares of menn teknologi, Reducing Holdings to 22.54%
body: Jora sold 135.24 million shares of menn teknologi in four staged transactions between 22‑25 September 2025, with BNI Sekuritas facilitating the sales, leaving the company with 323.25 million shares (22.54%) and a 9.43% dilution from the pre‑sale level. Despite the divestment, the share price rose 11 points to Rp57 in the past six months, though it fell 22 points (27.85%) in the five days leading up to 22 September 2025.

title: Penfabric Sdn Berhad completes voluntary tender offer, acquiring 14.16 million shares of Century Textile for Rp5.66 billion
body: Penfabric Sdn Berhad's voluntary tender offer for Century Textile resulted in the acquisition of 14,162,054 shares at Rp400 per share, totaling Rp5.66 billion, representing only 19.61% of the public float, while the remaining 58.05 million retail shares were not tendered. The offer was part of Penfabric's plan to delist Century Textile and convert it from a public to a private company.

title: Caraka reksa optima sells 10.015 million Petrosea shares for Rp61.84 billion on 25 September 2025, following a prior sale of 37.35 million shares for Rp138.94 billion on 3 September 2025
body: Caraka reksa optima, owned by Haji Robert & Happy Hapsoro, divested 10.015 million Petrosea shares on 25 September 2025, reducing its holding to 26.71 % and generating Rp61.84 billion. The earlier sale of 37.35 million shares on 3 September 2025 yielded Rp138.94 billion, leaving the company with 28.80 % of Petrosea.

title: Triputra Agro Persada receives Rp335.8 billion in interim dividend from controlled subsidiaries
body: Triputra Agro Persada received a tactical interim dividend of Rp335.8 billion from its controlled subsidiaries, filling its cash on 25 September 2025. Contributions included ebl Rp21.45 billion, dlj Rp45.15 billion, sawa Rp27.3 billion, pta Rp10 billion, npn Rp22.8 billion, ywa Rp64.44 billion, aapa Rp32.1 billion, gbsm Rp507 billion, and flti Rp40.26 billion.

title: Yentoro, CEO of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk, increases stake in JAST to 4.07%
body: Yentoro purchased an additional 600,000 shares of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk at Rp97–Rp99 per share, raising his holding to 44.01 million shares (4.07%) from 43.4 million shares (4.01%). JAST shares closed up 4.17%, reaching Rp100.

title: PT Tirta Mahakam Resources Tbk Holds 2025 AGM, Appoints New President Director and Approves Shift to Shipping Industry
body: At its 25 September 2025 AGM, PT Tirta Mahakam Resources Tbk approved the appointment of Tham Arvin Setyanto as president director, replacing the late Djohan Surja Putra, and confirmed a management board effective until 2027. The company also approved a feasibility study for a strategic shift from plywood to maritime transport, secured a ship purchase financed by a loan from PT Harita Jayaraya, and noted that its shares have been suspended for nine months due to inactivity since 2020.

title: PT Multi Medika Internasional Tbk (mmix) to Issue 1:1 Bonus Shares of 2.4 Billion Shares
body: PT Multi Medika Internasional Tbk (mmix) will propose a 1:1 bonus share issuance of 2.4 billion shares, valued at Rp 60 billion in agio, to be approved on 15 Oct 2025 with a cum‑date of 23 Oct 2025. The company, now a FMCG player with products ranging from bamboo tissue to personal care, aims for Rp 1 trillion revenue in 2026 with a 28 % gross margin while expanding its distribution network and market share.

title: Triniti Properti Sells 6,500 Shares of PT Triniti Garam Properti to PT Sequoia Tumbuh Sejahtera
body: Triniti Properti TBK sold 6,500 shares of PT Triniti Garam Properti (TGP), worth Rp325 million, to PT Sequoia Tumbuh Sejahtera, representing 65% of TGP, to focus operations on ongoing projects. Management states the transaction is not material, an affiliate deal, or a conflict of interest, and will not significantly affect operations, legal, financial condition, or business continuity.

title: Indonesia’s DPR XI pushes to raise public float to 30–40% to improve market liquidity
body: The DPR XI commission, led by Mukhamad Misbakhun, is advocating raising the minimum free‑float requirement to 30–40% to improve liquidity and credibility, while OJK is reviewing a 7.5% floor for IPOs and 47 of 907 issuers currently fall short. MSCI analyst Michael Yeoh counters that low free‑float levels are not necessarily problematic, citing global benchmarks.

title: PT Infiniti Wahana sells 1.5 million shares of PT Steady Safe TBK, reducing its stake from 41.6% to 41.35%
body: On Monday, PT Infiniti Wahana sold 1.5 million shares of PT Steady Safe TBK in two transactions (500,000 shares at Rp199 and 1,000,000 shares at Rp242), lowering its ownership from 255.89 million shares (41.6%) to 254.38 million shares (41.35%). The sale coincided with a 5.03% drop in Safe’s share price to Rp189, and the stock has fallen 24.46% to Rp189 by Friday.

title: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk Reports 830 BBTUD Gas Sales in First Eight Months of 2025, Below Target but Transmission Surpasses Forecast
body: The company sold 830 BBTUD of gas in the first eight months of 2025, a 2% decline from the same period last year and 4–13% below its 2025 target range of 873–958 BBTUD. However, transmission volumes reached 1,627 mmscfd, up 8% YoY and 13% above the 2025 target of 1,435 mmscfd, while upstream sales fell 21% to 15,844 boepd, 8% below the projected 17,227 boepd.

title: Silicon Valley Connection divests 10 million shares of Wira Global Solusi for Rp2 billion
body: Silicon Valley Connection sold 10,000,000 shares of Wira Global Solusi at Rp200 each, reducing its stake from 8.5% to 7.5%. The transaction, valued at Rp2 billion, was intended for direct equity investment, while Wira Global Solusi shares fell 5.98% to Rp220 on Friday.

title: Tower Bersama to Sell 350.33 Million Treasury Shares to Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte Ltd in 2025 Buyback
body: Tower Bersama will sell 350,330,400 treasury shares (350.33 million) to Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte Ltd between October 6 and December 31, 2025. The sale price will be based on the higher of the previous day's closing price or the 90‑day average discounted up to 7.5%.

title: Meijani Wibowo Buys 3.44 Million Shares of Medikaloka Hermina at Rp1,840 Each, Raising Stake to 1.97%
body: Meijani Wibowo purchased 3,440,600 shares of Medikaloka Hermina on September 25, 2025 at Rp1,840 per share, a 12.19% premium over the closing price of Rp1,640. The transaction increased his stake from 1.95% to 1.97%, costing him Rp6.33 billion.

title: Sejahteraraya Secures Rp407.90 Billion 10-Year Loan Facility with Mixed Fixed and Floating Rates
body: Sejahteraraya has obtained a Rp407.90 billion loan facility from multi‑infrastructure lenders, featuring an 8.5% fixed rate for the first five years followed by a floating rate thereafter, and includes structuring, facility, and commitment fees. The proceeds will be used to refinance its 2022 bond series maturing on 7 October 2025, with the transaction expected to have a neutral impact on the company’s financial condition while supporting its strategic and operational plans.

title: Solusi Bangun Indonesia reports Q1 2025 net profit of Rp266.52 billion, up 62.98% YoY
body: The company posted a net profit of Rp266.52 billion, a 62.98% increase from the same period last year, lifting basic and diluted earnings per share to Rp30 from Rp18. Revenue fell 8.3% to Rp4.97 trillion, while gross profit rose 7.29% to Rp1.03 trillion.

title: Prabowo Announces Nationwide Red White Village Cooperative and Housing Expansion
body: President Prabowo Subianto declared that every Indonesian villager will automatically join the newly established Red White Village Cooperative, covering 80,000 villages, and outlined plans to lower basic‑necessity prices through supply‑chain reforms, cooperative supermarkets, and subsidies for rice, cooking oil, LPG, fertilizer, and solar power. He also announced an acceleration of the public housing program, with 350,000 financing recipients and the distribution of 25,000 houses to ease the burden on citizens.

title: Jakarta Accelerates Mass Transit Integration with New Hub and Station Mergers
body: Jakarta’s provincial government and the Ministry of Transportation have agreed to fast‑track the development of a transit‑oriented hub at Dukuh Atas, linking LRT, MRT, commuter rail and airport train, and to merge Karet station with BNI City station to improve passenger transfers. The plan also includes progress on the MRT extension from Bundaran HI Kota and the Kelapa Gading–Manggarai LRT line, with the ministry pledging ongoing coordination with central authorities to deliver a more connected rail network.

title: Indonesia Prepares New Rules to Tackle Rising Illegal Cigarette Trade
body: Indonesia is preparing new regulations to curb the circulation of illegal cigarettes, which rose from 3.03% of total volume in 2019 to a 6.9% increase in 2023, largely machine‑rolled clove varieties. The move comes amid concerns that illicit trade is hurting domestic production, causing idle machines and layoffs, while the finance ministry plans to expand tobacco industry zones and attract illegal producers to legal, tax‑paying operations without raising excise taxes in 2026.

title: Indonesia’s trade minister says EU’s deforestation rules will be softened after signing the Indonesia‑EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, which could double Indonesia’s exports to the bloc.
body: The signing of the Indonesia‑EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU‑CEPA) has led the European Union to soften its deforestation regulation stance, according to Indonesia’s trade minister Budi Santoso. The deal, which removes up to 98% of tariffs and eliminates most trade barriers, could double Indonesia’s exports to the EU, boosting trade to $18 billion between January and July 2025, a 4.34% rise from the same period last year.

title: Indonesia Secures New Trade Agreements with Canada and the European Union to Expand Export Opportunities
body: Indonesia’s trade minister Budi Santoso announced the signing of the Indonesia‑Canada Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (ICA‑CEPA) and the Indonesia‑European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU‑CEPA), which together aim to boost Indonesian exports—$3.5 billion to Canada and $30 billion to the EU in 2024—by granting preferential tariff treatment to over 6,500 Indonesian tariff lines and targeting a 2.5‑fold increase in EU exports over the next five years.

title: Indonesia Bursa Monitors Unusual Activity in Cahayaputra Asa Keramik, Lenox Pasifik Investama, and Multitrend Indo Shares
body: Indonesia’s Bursa Efek Indonesia is monitoring unusual market activity in PT Cahayaputra Asa Keramik Tbk., PT Lenox Pasifik Investama Tbk., and PT Multitrend Indo Tbk., noting that a UMA announcement does not automatically indicate a market violation and that the UMA status became effective on Tuesday. While the stocks had shown recent gains—Cakk up 8.11% in a week and 50.38% in a month, Lpps surged 82.61% in a week and 205.45% in a year, and Baby fell 0.65% in a week but rose 46.15% over a year—their post-UMAs movements varied, with Cakk up 5%, Lpps down 5.95%, and Baby unchanged at Rp304, and the exchange noted recent monthly registration reports and a press release for Baby, which had previously entered a UMA on 25 June 2025.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold quietly increases its stake in Merdeka Resources to 56.5% through a 6.89‑million‑share purchase on September 26, 2025.
body: The transaction, facilitated by Indo Premier Sekuritas, raised Merdeka Copper Gold’s holdings to 9.14 billion shares (56.5%) from 9.13 billion, a 0.04% increase, while Indo Premier and Mandiri Sekuritas bought Merdeka Resources shares worth Rp345.5 billion and Rp165.8 billion respectively. Merdeka Resources is set to enter production soon, with gold projects in Pani, Pohuwato, and Gorontalo expected to commercialize in Q1 2026.

title: Ashmore Plans Gradual Transfer of 3.2 Million Treasury Shares to Employee Ownership Program
body: Ashmore intends to transfer 3.2 million treasury shares, effective from 9 November 2025 to 9 October 2026, after obtaining shareholder approval at the AGM on 5 November 2025. The shares will be allocated under a management and employee share ownership program (M/ESOP) to incentivize key employees, with pricing and payment terms to be set by the board.

title: Ancara Logistics Acquires 100% of Ancara Transshipment Service, Plans Infrastructure Expansion
body: Ancara Logistics, together with its subsidiary Mahakam Coal Terminal, has acquired all 362.49 million shares of Ancara Transshipment Service for Rp29.71 billion, including 51% from Graha Adika Niaga (Rp15.15 billion) and 49% from Solomed Capital Pte Ltd (Rp14.56 billion). The company will use the acquisition to build a new ISP facility on 34 hectares of land along the Mahakam River to boost logistics capacity and support future growth.

title: Kharisma Nusantara Acquires 8.06% Stake in Humpuss Maritim Through 1.45 Billion Share Purchase
body: Kharisma Nusantara bought 1.45 billion shares of Humpuss Maritim, equating to an 8.06% ownership and a transaction value of roughly Rp191.92 billion, while Humpuss Transportasi Kimia sold 1.182 billion shares, 6.55% of its equity, raising about Rp156.02 billion. After the deals, Humpuss Maritim’s shareholder structure is 76.50% Humpuss Intermoda Transportasi, 8.06% Kharisma Nusantara, and 16.95% public.

title: Medco Energi to Allocate Rp815 Billion for 3-Month Share Buyback
body: Medco Energi has earmarked Rp815 billion (≈USD 50 million) for a three‑month buyback of 407 million shares (1.62% of paid‑up capital) from 8 September to 8 December 2025, using non‑IPO, non‑loan funds and ensuring the total does not exceed 20% of the company’s shares. The buyback aims to boost shareholder value, improve return on equity, provide capital flexibility, and efficiently return excess cash without affecting operations.

title: Rudi Reksa Sutantra Reduces Ownership in PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk., Holding 50.16% of ATLA Shares After Sales
body: On September 24–25, 2025, Rudi Reksa Sutantra sold 5,785,600 ATLA shares at Rp67 and 25,820,000 shares at Rp70, reducing his stake to 3.10 billion shares, or 50.16% of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk. Previously he owned 3.14 billion shares, or 50.67%.

title: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium plans to acquire a mining permit from PT Aneka Tambang Tbk to secure raw materials for its 2030 downstream strategy
body: During a meeting with the DPR VI committee, Melati Sarnita explained that PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium is in due‑diligence to purchase an IUP near PT Borneo Alumina Indonesia, aiming to integrate and raise aluminium production from 275,000 tonnes to 1 million tonnes by 2031. The company also operates a 275,000‑tonne smelter in Kuala Tanjung and is selecting technology while assessing PLN’s electricity capacity in North Sumatra.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sells 10 million shares of Dada at Rp165, reducing its controlling stake to 58.57%
body: On September 26, 2025, PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia divested 10 million shares of Dada at Rp165 per share, cutting its controlling stake in PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. to 58.57% from 58.7%, while Dada shares fell 9.63% to Rp122 on the day of the sale, marking a 25.15% decline since Friday but a yearly rally of about 115 points (1,642.86%) from Rp7 to Rp122.

title: Unggul Indah Cahaya Tbk and Unic to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp215 per Share for FY 2025
body: Unggul Indah Cahaya Tbk will distribute an interim dividend of Rp215 per share for the FY 2025, totaling Rp82.416.243.045, following board approval on September 26, 2025. The dividend will be paid on October 21, 2025, after a series of cum/ex dates, and Unic shares rose 1.25% to Rp8,100 per share on the day of announcement.

title: Fairfax-Owned PT Asuransi Multi Artha Guna Tbk Restructures Board, Announces Resignation of Independent Commissioner
body: During an extraordinary general meeting, PT Asuransi Multi Artha Guna Tbk, owned by Fairfax Company, approved a board restructuring that led to the resignation of independent commissioner Firdaus Djaelani, and established a new board composition effective until the 2026 annual general meeting.

title: Astra International’s Saka Industrial Arjaya Finalizes Acquisition of 83.67% of Mega Manunggal Property, Becoming New Controller
body: On 30 September 2025, Astra International, through its subsidiary Saka Industrial Arjaya, completed the purchase of 83.67% of Mega Manunggal Property for Rp3.34 trillion, making it the new controlling shareholder. The transaction, governed by a conditional share purchase agreement dated 21 July 2025, involved Sia, Suwarna Arta Mandiri, Bridge Leed Limited, and other minority shareholders.

title: Merdeka Gold Aggressively Builds Stake in Merdeka Resources Through Silent Purchase of 101.08 Million Shares
body: On September 29, 2025, Merdeka Gold quietly acquired 101,079,000 shares of Merdeka Resources, valued at Rp367.92 billion based on the September 26 trading price of Rp3,640, increasing its holding to 9.24 billion shares (57.13 %) from 9.14 billion shares (56.50 %). The transaction was facilitated by Indo Premier Sekuritas and was conducted without detailed disclosure.

title: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium Accelerates Downstream Development with New Smelters and Global Partnerships
body: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium is expanding its downstream aluminium operations by upgrading the Kuala Tanjung smelter, building a second smelter and alumina refinery in West Kalimantan, and planning a new smelter. Its subsidiary Mind ID is pursuing international collaborations, including a heads‑of‑agreement with Vitol and a strategic partnership with Tiberius and Panasonic to support low‑carbon aluminium and job creation ahead of Indonesia Emas 2045.

title: PT Mitra Murni Perkasa Balikpapan Targets Full-Scale Nickel Matte Production in Q1 2026 Amid Market Volatility
body: PT Mitra Murni Perkasa Balikpapan (MMP) is expected to reach full-scale production of 21,000 tons of nickel per year, yielding 27,000–28,000 tons of nickel matte, by the first quarter of 2026 after commissioning the smelter in late 2025. Despite current nickel price declines driven by supply glut and EV demand slowdown, MMP’s low‑cost, low‑carbon operations and flexible output between ferronickel and nickel matte position it to adapt to shifting market conditions.

title: PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk Reports Strong Operational Gains Amid Revenue Decline, Highlights 78% Rise in Nickel Ore Production and 33% EBITDA Growth in Q2 2025
body: MBMA posted first‑half 2025 revenue of USD 628 million, a 32 % drop YoY, while EBITDA fell 8 % to USD 77 million but rose 33 % YoY in Q2 after adjusting for HGNM effects. The company increased nickel ore output to 6.9 million wet metric tonnes (up 78 %) and achieved a 33 % YoY rise in adjusted EBITDA, with ongoing HPAL and other strategic projects progressing toward mid‑2026 commissioning.

title: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk’s Pani Gold Project Nears Production, Targeting First Gold in Early 2026
body: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk, through its subsidiary EMAS, reports the Pani Gold Project in Gorontalo is 75% complete and expects to start mining in late 2025, with first gold anticipated in February or March 2026. The project is projected to produce 145,000 troy ounces annually at a cash cost of about USD 800/oz, potentially boosting MDKA’s 2026 gold revenue to USD 533 million and lowering average cash costs to roughly USD 950/oz.

title: PT Indominco Mandiri Targets 7.30 Million Tons of Coal Production in 2025 Amid Reserve Depletion and Upcoming Contract Expiry
body: PT Indominco Mandiri, a subsidiary of PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk, plans to raise its 2025 coal output to 7.30 million tons—up from the 6.9 million‑ton target—while managing depleting reserves in East Kutai, Kutai Kartanegara, and Bontang East Kalimantan and preparing for the 2028 expiry of its coal contract, with a strategy to convert its PKB2B license into a special mining business license to continue underground projects.

title: Indonesia Urges Regulatory Breakthrough to Streamline Telecom Licensing and Boost Digital Economy Growth
body: Indonesia’s telecom sector, with 345 million mobile subscribers and 17 million fixed broadband users, faces stagnant revenue and fragmented licensing that hampers infrastructure efficiency and innovation. A proposed fluid‑licence model would allow telecom groups to share licences across subsidiaries, potentially saving billions in capital and operating costs and accelerating the country’s digital economy, projected to rise from $90 billion in 2024 to over $110 billion in 2025.

title: PT Bumi Resources Tbk. Announces Second Tranche of Sustainable Bonds to Raise IDR 721.61 Billion for Acquisition of Wolfram Limited
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk. will issue a second tranche of sustainable bonds totaling IDR 721.61 billion, comprising a 3‑year, 8 % coupon series of IDR 149.33 billion and a 5‑year, 9.25 % coupon series of IDR 572.28 billion, with quarterly coupon payments beginning December 24 2025 and principal repayments on September 24 2028 and 2030. Net proceeds, after issuance costs, will finance the acquisition of Australia‑based Wolfram Limited for IDR 344.12 billion, provide an IDR 98.75 billion loan to WFL for capital expenditures and exploration, and cover Bumi’s working‑capital needs, while the bonds will be listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on September 25 2025 under a full‑commitment underwriting by PT Mandiri Sekuritas, PT Trimegah Sekuritas Tbk., PT BCA Sekuritas, PT Indo Premier Sekuritas, PT BRI Danareksa Sekuritas, PT Korea Investment & Sekuritas Indonesia, with PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk. as trustee.

title: Danantara CEO Explores European Food and Healthcare Investment Opportunities, Allocating 20% of Capital Overseas
body: Rosan Roeslani, CEO of Daya Anagata Nusantara Investment Management Agency, announced that Danantara plans to invest 20% of its USD7 billion capital overseas, targeting Europe’s food and healthcare sectors, while the remaining 80% will focus on domestic strategic projects. With a five‑fold leverage, Danantara could generate up to USD35 billion in annual investment potential, totaling USD175 billion over five years, and has attracted interest from one of the world’s largest food companies.

title: Indonesia Targets 20% Annual EU Investment Growth After Signing Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement
body: Indonesia’s investment downstreaming minister, Rosan Roeslani, announced a goal of 18–20% annual growth in EU investment after signing the Indonesia‑EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement. The pact is projected to raise bilateral trade by up to US$60 billion and lift Indonesia’s EU exports by over 50% within 3–4 years.

title: Indonesia Eyes 2025 Growth Boosted by Rp30 Trillion Stimulus and Broad Economic Package
body: Coordinating Minister Airlangga Hartarto said that positive government spending, steady investment, and a Rp30 trillion (about $2 billion) stimulus disbursed in the fourth quarter will support Indonesia’s 2025 growth. Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa also unveiled an eight‑program 2025 package that includes internships for university graduates, income‑tax relief for tourism workers, food aid, housing assistance, wage support, and platforms for SMEs and gig‑economy workers.

title: Indonesia's Finance Minister Aims to Cut State-Owned Enterprise Compensation Payments to One Month
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa announced that compensation payments to state-owned enterprises will be shortened from three months to one month to avoid cash‑flow disruptions, with the 2025 budget allocating Rp496.8 trillion for subsidies and disbursements already reaching Rp218 trillion (43.7 %). He also said Rp55 trillion in arrears for the 2025 fiscal year will be settled in October, while all 2024 payments have been completed.

title: Aneka Tambang injects USD159.64 million (Rp2.63 trillion) into Feni Haltim, giving Antam a 40% stake worth Rp3.12 trillion and Hongkong CBL Ltd a 60% stake worth Rp4.69 trillion to fund the RKEF plant in Buli, Maluku Utara
body: Aneka Tambang injected USD159.64 million (Rp2.63 trillion) into Feni Haltim, with Antam acquiring 312,760,000 shares (40%) valued at Rp3.12 trillion and Hongkong CBL Ltd acquiring 469,140,000 shares (60%) valued at Rp4.69 trillion. The capital injection supports the construction of a rotary kiln electric furnace plant and industrial area in Buli, Maluku Utara, part of Indonesia’s nickel downstream strategy.

title: Indonesia's Plan to Raise Foreign Currency Deposit Rates Faces Criticism Over Lack of Productive Dollar Assets
body: The Indonesian government’s proposal to lift foreign‑currency deposit rates has drawn criticism from economists who warn that higher dollar yields will only increase domestic dollar liabilities without creating productive dollar assets, potentially worsening the rupiah’s weakness. Experts suggest issuing dollar‑denominated bonds from state‑owned enterprises such as Pertamina and PLN or expanding export financing and overseas branches to absorb the inflow and support the currency.

title: Gold Prices Reach Record Highs Amid Antam Surge and Forecasts for 2025
body: Gold spot prices fell 0.66% to US$3,808.35 per troy ounce after earlier reaching a record high of US$3,849.46, while Antam's gold price climbed to Rp2,234,000 per gram with a buyback at Rp2,081,000. Sutopo Widodo, president commissioner of HFX International, forecasts spot prices could hit US$4,000 by end‑2025 and Antam could trade between Rp2.3‑2.4 million per gram, recommending short‑term investors take partial profits and long‑term holders maintain exposure.

title: Indonesian corporate bond market heats up as issuers tap falling rates, with PT Indah Kiat Pulp Paper Tbk launching a Rp5.26 trillion debt package
body: PT Indah Kiat Pulp Paper Tbk plans to issue three debt instruments totaling Rp5.26 trillion, including a Rp3.94 trillion perpetual bond, a Rp1.10 trillion perpetual sukuk, and a US$12.51 million USD perpetual bond, using proceeds mainly to refinance rupiah debt and fund working capital. Other issuers such as PT Sumber Global Energy Tbk, PT Bank Jatim Tbk, PT Bank Victoria International Tbk, and PT Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia Tbk are also active, reflecting a trend of lower borrowing costs amid Bank Indonesia’s rate cuts.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Reopens Trading for Three Suspended Stocks, All Decline on First Day
body: The Bursa Efek Indonesia lifted the trading suspension on PT Pelangi Indah Canindo Tbk., PT Bank Permata Tbk., and PT Vktr Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk. on Wednesday, but the stocks fell sharply—BNLI dropped 8.40% to Rp5,450, PICO fell 7.43% to Rp324, and VKTR slipped 3.45% to Rp224.

title: Alexander Ramlie divests 20 million shares of Amman Mineral Internasional and later repurchases 229.89 million shares in a two‑day transaction
body: On September 19, 2025, Alexander Ramlie sold 20 million shares of Amman Mineral Internasional at Rp7.675 per share, raising Rp153.5 billion and slightly diluting his stake to 0.435 percent. He then repurchased 229.89 million shares on August 28 and September 1, 2025, paying Rp7.794–8.074 per share and spending Rp1.85 trillion, bringing his holdings back to 335.3 million shares.

title: morris capital indonesia to acquire 57% stake in pipa, injecting Rp 3 trillion to expand utilities and infrastructure
body: morris capital indonesia is set to acquire a 57% stake in pipa, injecting Rp 3 trillion in assets to pivot the company toward utilities and infrastructure. The deal, now 95% through due diligence, will give morris capital indonesia majority control, while pt multi makmur lemindo tbk will assume new control and pipa has already signed MOUs with foreign partners to develop HDPE pipe products.

title: Emitens Reports First Semester 2025 Loss of Rp65.55 Billion, Down 779% from Same Period Last Year
body: Emitens posted a net loss of Rp65.55 billion for the first half of 2025, a 779.27% decline from the Rp9.65 billion profit reported in the same period last year, while net income rose modestly to Rp1.18 trillion. Total liabilities surged to Rp6.12 trillion and equity fell to Rp1.47 trillion, reflecting a significant deterioration in financial position.

title: Merdeka Resources Executes USD 120 Million Loan Facility with Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining, Extending Maturity to 2029 and Setting Interest at 6.26%
body: Merdeka Resources has entered into a USD 120 million loan agreement with Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining, the third amendment to the original debt agreement dated 26 September 2025, extending the maturity to 31 August 2029 and setting the interest margin at 6.26%. The loan will be used for general corporate purposes, capital expenditures, operations, and working capital, and the transaction is not expected to impact Merdeka Resources’ financial condition.

title: Buma International Grup reports first‑half 2025 loss of USD 74.2 million, a 179% increase from the same period last year
body: Buma International Grup posted a first‑half 2025 loss of USD 74.2 million, up 179.15% from the same period last year, with net income falling 14.59% to USD 730.2 million and total equity shrinking to USD 100.87 million. The company’s gross loss widened to USD 13.69 million, a 118.53% increase over the prior year, while operating expenses rose slightly to USD 43.42 million and financial income fell to USD 2.43 million.

title: Darma Henwa Restructures Board and Management to Accelerate Digital Transformation and Profitability
body: At a special shareholders meeting on 30 September 2025, Darma Henwa approved new directors and commissioners, appointing Joseph Lembayung as director and adding Wisnu Wahyudin Pettalolo, Sorimuda Pulungan, and Agus Suharyono as commissioners, while retiring Ashok Mitra and Kanaka Puradiredja. The changes aim to strengthen the organization, accelerate digital and mining practices, and support the company’s transition from a challenging phase to profitability and future expansion.

title: Erwin Senjaya Hartanto Sells 5 Million Shares of PT Wira Global Solusi Tbk, Reducing Stake to 1.49% Amid Improved Q2 2025 Financials
body: Erwin Senjaya Hartanto sold 5,000,000 shares of PT Wira Global Solusi Tbk at Rp190 each, cutting his ownership from 1.97% to 1.49% as the company reports a revenue decline to Rp15.15 billion but higher gross profit (Rp6.39 billion) and operating profit (Rp2.77 billion) for the six months ended 30 June 2025, while net profit attributable to the parent rose to Rp2.93 billion. Total liabilities climbed to Rp17.97 billion and assets to Rp93.63 billion during the same period.

title: Director Febyan Increases Shareholding in PT Indonesia Pondasi Raya Tbk on September 26 and 29, 2025
body: Febyan, the CEO of PT Indonesia Pondasi Raya Tbk, bought 451,900 shares on September 26 and 305,900 shares on September 29, 2025, raising his stake to 53 million shares (2.646%). Earlier purchases on September 23–24 and September 16–18 added to his total holdings, bringing his ownership to 2.609%.

title: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk. reports $1.6 billion net profit for first half 2025, driven by accounting gains from Aster Chemicals acquisition
body: The company recorded a net profit of USD1.6 billion through June 2025, largely due to a bargain purchase gain from the April 2025 acquisition of Aster Chemicals Energy Pte. Ltd., which also raised consolidated assets to USD10.7 billion. Additionally, PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk. went public with a 15‑times oversubscription, and Aster Chemicals is investing USD125 million in new floating‑raft facilities near the Bukom refinery.

title: Djajadi Djaja sells 350,145,665 shares of PT Wicaksana Overseas International Tbk. to DKSH Holding AG, boosting the latter’s stake to 95.51%
body: On Tuesday, Djajadi Djaja divested all 350,145,665 shares (14.63% of outstanding shares) of PT Wicaksana Overseas International Tbk. for Rp10 per share, totaling Rp3.5 billion, with DKSH Holding AG’s ownership rising to 2,286,096,532 shares (95.51%) and the public non‑warkat holding falling to 107,613,816 shares (4.49%). The shares remain suspended with a special notation at Rp123 and are listed on the full‑call auction due to FCA criteria 5, 6, and 7.

title: PT Semen Baturaja Tbk reports strong first‑half 2025 performance with 21% sales growth and 952% net profit increase
body: In a live online presentation, PT Semen Baturaja Tbk (SMBR) announced a 21% rise in sales volume and a 952% jump in net profit for semester I 2025, driven by an 8% demand increase in South Sumatra and cost‑efficiency measures, while national cement demand contracted by about 2%. The company attributes its success to internal efficiency, synergy with its holding SIG, and technology‑driven cost leadership, positioning it to close 2025 with solid results and support Indonesia’s infrastructure development.

title: PT Mandom Indonesia Tbk says no new material information beyond Kalon Holdings' acquisition talks, while TCID shares show strong volatility
body: PT Mandom Indonesia Tbk confirmed that, apart from the disclosed negotiation with Kalon Holdings Co., Ltd. to acquire Mandom Corporation, it has no other material information or planned corporate actions affecting TCID, whose shares have risen 36.4% month‑to‑date, 118.5% over six months and 57.8% year‑to‑date but fell 3.13% to Rp3,410 on the day. Kalon Holdings has offered to buy at least 25,285,200 MCJ shares (56.02% of MCJ’s capital), which would give it indirect control of TCID through MCJ’s 65.23% stake.

title: PT Sepatu Bata Tbk Resigns Rajeev Kaziz and Appoints Amitav Nandy and Shaibal Sinha as New President Director and President Commissioner
body: At an extraordinary general meeting, PT Sepatu Bata Tbk approved the resignation of Rajeev Kaziz effective July 25 2025, and elected Amitav Nandy as president director and Shaibal Sinha as president commissioner, effective immediately after the meeting.

title: Mahogany Global Investment Pte Ltd cuts its stake in Wahana Interfood by selling 17.55 million shares in September 2025
body: Mahogany sold 17.55 million Wahana Interfood shares in four transactions from 24 to 29 September 2025, totaling roughly Rp10.53 billion. The sale reduced its holding to 57.86 % (526.28 million shares), diluting the pre‑transaction stake by 3.26 %.

title: Humpuss Kimia Divests All Shares of Humpuss Maritim Internasional, Kharisma Nusantara Timur Acquires 8.06% Stake
body: Humpuss Kimia sold 1,182,013,700 shares of Humpuss Maritim Internasional at Rp50 each, raising Rp59.10 billion and reducing its holding from 6.55% to zero. Kharisma Nusantara Timur, assisted by KB Valbury Sekuritas, purchased 1.45 billion shares, acquiring an 8.06% stake in the company.

title: sarana mitra luas tbk expands into mining via joint operation with local partners
body: sarana mitra luas tbk (smil) has entered the mining sector through a joint operation with partners under sarana cipta minergi, targeting an initial production of about 200,000 metric tons per month of coal with potential to reach 500,000 metric tons. smil will supply heavy equipment and expects recurring income that could reach hundreds of billions of rupiah per month, influencing the company’s 2026 financial performance.

title: Indonesia to Build New Airport and Seaport in Merauke to Boost Food Security
body: Indonesia’s transport minister announced plans to construct a new airport and seaport in Merauke, South Papua, to support the Merauke Food Estate and national food self‑sufficiency. The project, led by state‑owned Agrinas Palma Nusantara, aims to transform Merauke into a logistics hub and create jobs, with construction expected to start next year.

title: Indonesia Launches 1.4 GHz Spectrum Auction for Broadband Wireless Access Services on October 13, 2025
body: The Ministry of Communication and Digital Affairs announced that the price‑bidding stage of the 1.4 GHz spectrum auction will begin on October 13, 2025 via an e‑auction system, after PT EKA MAS REPUBLIK, PT TELEMEDIA KOMUNIKASI PRATAMA, and PT TELKOM INDONESIA TBK were declared eligible. The auction aims to expand affordable internet coverage by allocating 80 MHz across three regions, with service provision commitments serving as a basis for post‑auction monitoring.

title: Foreign investors increase stakes in PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) as the bank shows resilience in a volatile market
body: Blackrock, JP Morgan, and Vanguard Group have increased their holdings in PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), with Blackrock buying back 231 million shares in 2025, Vanguard holding 3.31 billion shares by Q3 2025, and JP Morgan adding 905 million shares in the July‑September period. Despite a 2.31 % drop to Rp 3,810 after the Pertamina Dumai incident, BBRI has risen 1.87 % over the last three months, and analysts view the stock as undervalued with a target price of Rp 4,030–4,220, recommending an accumulative buy.

title: Doid's First Half 2025 Financials Hit by Operational Disruptions, but Recovery Path Remains Open
body: Doid reported a 15% year‑over‑year revenue decline to US$730 million in H1 2025, with EBITDA falling to US$64 million (11% margin) and a net loss of US$80 million, driven by a 23% drop in overburden removal and a 10% drop in coal production amid extreme weather and safety‑related shutdowns. Analysts say the company’s recovery plan has begun to show progress, and while a return to profitability remains realistic, focus should remain on operational efficiency, cost control and cautious expansion.

title: Samudera Indonesia injects Rp500 billion into subsidiary to fund shipyard expansion in Madura
body: Samudera Indonesia injected Rp500 billion into its subsidiary Galangan Samudera Madura, with the funds earmarked for building shipyard facilities, jetty, floating area, workshops, hangars, and waste management in Madura, East Java. The capital injection, sourced from sukuk ijarah tahap ii, is structured as a mudharabah profit‑sharing loan with a projected return equal to the guarantee institution’s interest rate plus a financial margin.

title: Manggung Polahraya Media Reports 2025 Loss of Rp2.37 Billion, Net Loss per Share Drops to Rp0.62
body: The company posted a net loss of Rp2.37 billion for 2025, a reduction from Rp4.89 billion a year earlier, while revenue surged 132.65% to Rp25.29 billion. Operating expenses rose, and the loss per share fell to Rp0.62 from Rp1.31, with total assets declining to Rp181.48 billion.

title: PT Telemedia Komunikasi Pratama, a subsidiary of PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk, clears administrative evaluation for 1.4 GHz radio frequency band access service auction in 2025
body: PT Telemedia Komunikasi Pratama, operating under the Surge brand, has passed the administrative evaluation for the 1.4 GHz radio frequency band access service auction, joining PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk and another company to advance to the e‑auction price bidding stage scheduled for October 13, 2025. The Ministry of Communication and Digital Affairs announced that only three of seven applicants met the criteria, while PT Indosat Tbk and PT Xlsmart Telecom Sejahtera Tbk withdrew their applications.

title: bank julius baer & co. ltd acquires over 5% stake in bank capital indonesia for Rp301.29 billion
body: On 30 September 2025, bank julius baer & co. ltd purchased 1.995.302.489 shares of bank capital indonesia at Rp151 per share, valuing the transaction at Rp301.29 billion. The deal, facilitated by pacific sekuritas indonesia, victoria sekuritas indonesia, and bank hsbc indonesia, was conducted in a silent transaction and also saw bank julius baer & co. ltd acquire 10% of capital global investama shares, diluting the remaining stake to 63.70%.

title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi plans a Rp2 trillion bond and sukuk issuance to fund working capital
body: The company will issue Rp1.35 trillion of conventional bonds in two series (Series A: Rp1.16 trillion at 8.50% for 5 years; Series B: Rp187.64 billion at 9.00% for 7 years) and Rp650 billion of sukuk wakalah in two series (Series A: Rp137.64 billion targeting an 8.50% return for 5 years; Series B: Rp512.36 billion targeting a 9.00% return for 7 years), with quarterly interest/payments and principal due at maturity. Proceeds, after issuance costs, will be used for working capital of Multi Tambangjaya Utama, and the offering is scheduled for public subscription on 20‑21 Oct 2025 with listing on the IDX on 27 Oct 2025.

title: Merdeka Copper raises its holding in Merdeka Resources to 57.19% after a silent purchase, prompting a 38.9% stock jump
body: On September 30, 2025, Merdeka Copper acquired an additional 11.0799 million shares of Merdeka Resources through Indo Premier Sekuritas, increasing its stake to 9.25 billion shares (57.19% ownership). Following the transaction, Merdeka Resources' share price rose 38.88% to Rp4,000, up 1,120 points from its IPO level of roughly Rp2,880.

title: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk partners with Halal Indonesia International Industry Expo 2025, driving UMKM financing and cashless promotions
body: PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk served as the banking partner for the Halal Indonesia International Industry Expo 2025 held Sep 25‑28 in Tangerang, attracting over 25,000 visitors and generating sales of Rp7.7 billion with investment commitments of Rp7.2 trillion. The bank offered cashless promos—including up to 20% cashback for F&B merchants and 10% for non‑F&B via QRIS—supporting showcased UMKM such as Roka Collection and Urban Factor, while total transaction value at the event reached Rp77 billion.

title: PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk's controlling shareholder Rudi Reksa Sutantra increases stake to 50.17% after buying 1 million shares
body: On 26 September 2025, Rudi Reksa Sutantra purchased 1 million ATLA shares at Rp71 each, costing Rp71 million and raising his ownership to 3.11 billion shares (50.17%). Following the transaction, ATLA shares closed up 18.92% at Rp 88.

title: Matrix Company Limited reduces stake in PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk, selling 6.83 million shares for about Rp5.2 bn
body: Matrix Company Limited sold 6,827,940 shares of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk at Rp764 per share, generating roughly Rp5.2 billion and lowering its ownership to 32.23% of the outstanding shares. The transaction, aimed at meeting Indonesia’s free‑float requirements, coincided with the stock rising 9.32% to close at Rp880.

title: Bank Raya Indonesia Tbk reports 300% YoY increase in QRIS transactions and 64.5% rise in net profit for the first half of 2025
body: In the first half of 2025, Bank Raya Indonesia Tbk's QRIS transactions surged 300% YoY to 3.3 million with transaction volume up 94% YoY to IDR 13.8 billion, driven by its new "saku bisnis" features that speed up fund disbursement and expand QRIS usage. The bank also posted a net profit of IDR 32.93 billion for Q2 2025, a 64.5% YoY increase, alongside digital loan growth of 64.8% YoY to IDR 13.42 trillion and outstanding digital loans rising 79.2% YoY to IDR 2.62 trillion.

title: PT Steady Safe Tbk’s controlling shareholder PT Infiniti Wahana reduces its stake by selling 1 million shares, lowering ownership to 40.66%
body: PT Infiniti Wahana sold 1,000,000 shares of PT Steady Safe Tbk on 24 September 2025 at IDR 212‑232 per share, valuing the transaction at about IDR 226.4 million and decreasing its holding from 40.82% (251,114,213 shares) to 40.66% (250,114,213 shares). The stock fell 4.9% to IDR 194 on the same day, after a 4.3% gain over the past month but declines of 6.73% over six months and 6.3% year‑to‑date.

title: pt hillcon equity management sells 16.2 million hill shares for approx. Rp4.2 billion, reducing its stake
body: pt hillcon equity management, the controlling shareholder of pt hillcon tbk., sold 16.2 million hill shares at Rp260 each, valued at about Rp4.2 billion. The transaction, following an earlier sale of 205 million shares at the same price, cut its holding from 7.58 billion to 7.57 billion shares, while hill's stock remained flat at Rp204.

title: pt abadimukti gunalestari trims its holding in pt perdana gapuraprima tbk. after selling 81.89 million shares and repurchasing 44.7 million shares in late September 2025
body: Between 23–26 September 2025, pt abadimukti gunalestari sold 81.89 million pt perdana gapuraprima tbk. shares at Rp123‑Rp147 and bought back about 44.7 million shares at Rp125‑Rp130, reducing its stake to 2.33 billion shares (54.62%). The stock closed at Rp130, down 10.9% from 1 September but up 64.5% over six months and 51.1% year‑to‑date.

title: Ubs Ag London Buy Shares of PT Bumi Resources Tbk
body: Ubs Ag London, an insider, bought 421,364,400 shares of PT Bumi Resources Tbk, increasing ownership from 25,805,133,255 to 26,226,497,655. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically oil-gas-coal, with a price of 119. The purpose is undisclosed.

title: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk Buy Shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk, an insider, bought 34,241,030,000 shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk, increasing its holding from 49,135,335,640 to 49,477,745,940. The transaction occurred in the consumer-cyclicals sector, specifically media-entertainment. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

title: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk Buy Shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk bought 23,358,970 shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk, increasing ownership to 49,711,335,640 shares. The transaction was for investment purposes, with prices ranging from 340 to 360.

title: Kundy Wijaya Sell Shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa
body: Kundy Wijaya sold 6,000,000 shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa Tbk at a price of 42, reducing their ownership from 106,453,700 to 100,453,700 shares. The transaction type was a sell, with the purpose of divestment.

title: PT Sirius Surya Sentosa Sell Shares of PT Pakuan Tbk
body: PT Sirius Surya Sentosa sold 2,427,184 shares of PT Pakuan Tbk, reducing its holdings from 732,655,000 to 730,227,816. The transaction aims to rebalance composition and increase liquidity.

title: Rudi Reksa Sutantra Sell Shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia
body: Rudi Reksa Sutantra, an insider, sold 31,605,600 shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk, reducing his holding from 3,141,125,000 to 3,109,519,400. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically alternative-energy. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

title: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk Buy Shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk bought 233589700 PT Surya Citra Media Tbk shares, increasing its holding from 49477745940 to 49711335640. The transaction aims to invest. The buy occurred at various prices between 340 and 360.

title: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama Sell Shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk
body: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama sold 1,670,000,000 shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk, reducing its holding from 23,129,426,194 to 21,459,426,194. The transaction type was a sell, with a purpose of Repurchase Agreement (Repo) at a price of 650.

title: Commissioner Paulus Totok Lusida Sells 135 Million Shares of Bintraco Dharma, Reducing Stake to 2.67%
body: On 23 September 2025, Bintraco Dharma’s commissioner Paulus Totok Lusida divested 135 million shares at Rp140 each, a price 7.89 % below the closing price of Rp152, raising Rp18.90 billion. The sale cut his holdings from 535 million shares (3.57 %) to 400 million shares (2.67 %).

title: ICN News Magazine Highlights MB Indonesia’s New MB-HDS533 Coal Crusher at Mining Indonesia Expo 2025
body: ICN News, a leading publication for Indonesian coal and nickel mining companies, featured MB Indonesia on its front cover for the second consecutive year and showcased the company’s new MB-HDS533 coal crusher, which offers cost‑effective alternatives to static and mobile crushers and can produce 100‑300 tons of coal per hour depending on the model. The magazine continues to serve as a key advertising platform for supporting firms in the mining sector.

title: Indonesia’s Palm Oil Association Urges EU to Exclude Smallholders from Deforestation Regulation Amid CEPA Signing
body: The Indonesian palm oil association (gapki) has called on the European Union to exempt smallholders from its deforestation regulation, arguing that their limited plantation size and reliance on large companies make them vulnerable to the rule. Gapki also welcomed the second one‑year delay of the regulation until 2026, citing the need for smallholders to resolve land‑legality issues and improve governance before the EU’s non‑tariff barrier takes effect.

title: Indonesia's Ministry of Manpower Calls for Fair, Non-Discriminatory Hiring Practices
body: The Ministry of Manpower urged companies, including state-owned enterprises, to conduct recruitment objectively and without irrelevant requirements such as height, weight, or excessive personal data, and issued Circular Letter M/6/HK.04/V/2025 to enforce competency-based hiring. Employers are prohibited from setting unrelated job qualifications unless justified, and age restrictions may only apply if directly related to job performance.

title: PT Freeport Indonesia Halts Production to Focus on Evacuation of Trapped Miners
body: PT Freeport Indonesia has suspended production at its Grasberg block cave mine since September 8 to concentrate on rescuing five trapped miners, after two were found dead following a landslide. Despite the halt, the company says its production targets remain on track as it continues to process stockpiled concentrate into cathodes and gold bars.

title: Indonesia's Environment Minister Reports Normal Radiation Levels in Clove Export Inspection, Despite Initial Cesium-137 Contamination Concerns
body: Environment Minister Hanif Faisol Nurofiq announced that preliminary tests on clove products from PT NJS showed radiation levels within natural background limits, though a full on‑site inspection will still be conducted. The FDA had previously blocked shipments of the clove and shrimp products from PT NJS and PT Bahari Makmur Sejati, and government agencies are decontaminating affected sites and preparing temporary storage for cesium‑137 waste.

title: Indonesia Supports Local Restaurants' Global Expansion to Boost Cultural Diplomacy and Economic Growth
body: Indonesia’s Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, Teuku Riefky Harsya, announced government backing for local restaurants, notably Restoran Sederhana, to expand abroad and promote Indonesian cuisine in markets such as Germany and Australia. The initiative aligns with President Prabowo Subianto’s directive to grow the creative economy, create jobs, attract investment, and strengthen GDP, with support from ministries on database development, capacity‑building, and intellectual property protection.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Suspends Trading of Three Shares Amid Volatility
body: Bursa Efek Indonesia temporarily halted trading of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk., PT Solar First Asia Tbk., and PT Esta Multi Usaha Tbk. on Friday to protect investors amid sharp price swings, while Esta rose 30.1% to Rp164 and has surged 160.3% in a month, and VKTR and Boston Furniture Industries Tbk. face a second suspension that could last up to a week and may place them on the special monitoring board.

title: Bali Towerindo injects Rp100 billion loan into subsidiary Paramitra Intimega for operational use
body: On 1 October 2025, Bali Towerindo, holding a 99.9% stake in Paramitra Intimega, injected a Rp100 billion loan into the subsidiary for operational use. The company states the transaction, an affiliate arrangement, will not adversely affect its operations, legal status, financial condition, or business continuity.

title: Triple B Continues Negotiations to Acquire 45% of Harta Djaya Karya, with Potential Mandatory Tender Offer Pending
body: Triple B (bisnis berkah bersama and triple berkah bersama) is still negotiating a takeover of Harta Djaya Karya, with due diligence underway and no business strategy disclosed yet. If the acquisition completes, Triple B will launch a mandatory tender offer, while Harta Djaya Karya remains a public company and its ultimate beneficial owners are Noprian Fadli and Agustin Widyawati.

title: PT Folago Global Nusantara TBK Expands with Eight Top Artists, Strengthening Its Position as Southeast Asia’s Largest Multi‑Channel Network
body: PT Folago Global Nusantara TBK, formerly PT Aviana Sinar Abadi TBK, has rebranded and attracted eight leading artists—including Baim Wong, Ruben Onsu, and Demian Aditya—to its ecosystem, positioning the company as the region’s largest multi‑channel network. The artists will serve as content creators and strategic shareholders, boosting brand equity and potentially accelerating revenue growth in digital entertainment and social commerce for the company, including its listed entity IRSX.

title: Urban Jakarta Propertindo Reports First-Quarter 2025 Loss of Rp986M Amid Revenue Collapse
body: In Q1 2025, Urban Jakarta Propertindo (boncos) posted revenue of Rp6.5 billion, down 81.9% from the same period last year, and a net loss of Rp986 million, a sharp reversal from a Rp4.77 billion loss previously. Total equity remained at Rp2.05 trillion while liabilities rose to Rp2.12 trillion, leaving assets at Rp4.17 trillion.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold completes Rp374.12 billion affiliate transaction with MTS, PETS, GSM, and PIN
body: Merdeka Copper Gold reported a Rp374.12 billion affiliate transaction involving its subsidiaries merdeka teknis servis, puncak emas tani sejahtera, gorontalo sejahtera mining, and pani industri nusantara. The transaction, valued at Rp197.19 billion for services to MTS, Rp91.72 billion to GSM, and Rp85.2 billion to PIN, aims to support the development of the Pani gold project and is deemed fair by the public appraisal firm Iskandar & Rekan.

title: Alexander Ramlie Divests 10.38 Million Shares of Amman Mineral Internasional, Raising Rp72.63 Billion
body: Alexander Ramlie sold 10,381,500 shares of Amman Mineral Internasional in two tranches—8,881,500 shares at Rp6.959 and 1,500,000 shares at Rp7.225—generating Rp72.63 billion and reducing his holding to 0.42%. Prior to this, he had sold 20 million shares at Rp7.675, raising Rp153.5 billion and diluting his stake to 0.435%.

title: Merdeka Gold Resources Executes USD 56.6 Million Transaction with Subsidiaries Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera and Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining
body: On 30 September 2025, Merdeka Gold Resources signed a USD 56.6 million deal with its entities Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera and Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining, making the transaction 22% of the company’s equity and thus material. The agreement gives GSM access to facilities for PETS, with usage fees plus a 10% margin, and is expected to improve operational efficiency of the Pani gold project without materially affecting the company’s financial condition.

title: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd divests 963.99 million shares of Barito Renewables Energy in three stages, raising Rp2.22 trillion
body: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd sold 86.59 million shares at Rp8.725‑9.075 each, followed by 77.40 million shares at Rp8.725 and 9.19 million shares at Rp9.075, and earlier sold 84.64 million shares at Rp8.247, totaling Rp2.22 trillion in proceeds. The divestment, supported by Citibank NA, Bank HSBC Indonesia, and Bank DBS Indonesia, reduced Barito Renewables Energy’s holdings to 28.45 billion shares (21.27 %) and increased the free float, as stated by Corporate Secretary Agus Sandy Widyanto.

title: Priscilla Vikananda and Axel Tobias Joel Sell All GPSo Shares, Ending Holdings
body: Priscilla Vikananda divested her 14,987,500 GPSo shares on 30 September 2025 and earlier sold 22,997,500 shares on 12 September 2025 for Rp6.16 billion. Axel Tobias Joel liquidated his 17,440,132 GPSo shares on 27 August 2025 for Rp5.37 billion, leaving both directors with zero holdings in GPSo as part of portfolio diversification.

title: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Sets Extraordinary General Meeting for Oct. 27, 2025 to Approve Vessel Acquisition and Business Changes
body: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk (cbre) has confirmed an extraordinary general meeting on Oct. 27, 2025, following a delay, to approve the purchase of a pipe‑laying & lifting vessel, issue a promissory note, and amend its business activities and articles of association. The meeting follows cbre’s recent $100 million acquisition of the vessel from Hilong Shipping Holding, a subsidiary of Hilong Holding Limited, and comes amid a 408.2 % month‑to‑month share price rise and a 3,163 % year‑to‑date gain.

title: PT Pinago Utama Tbk to Pay Interim Cash Dividend of Rp130 per Share for FY 2025
body: PT Pinago Utama Tbk announced it will distribute an interim cash dividend of Rp101.56 billion, equivalent to Rp130 per share, based on net profit of Rp151.03 billion as of June 30 2025, yielding about 5.35% at a share price of Rp2,430. The dividend will be paid on October 14 2025 with ex‑dividend dates on October 13 and 15.

title: pt exploitasi energi indonesia tbk says temporary suspension of pt abe jaya perkasa does not affect its operations
body: pt exploitasi energi indonesia tbk says the temporary suspension of its subsidiary pt abe jaya perkasa, issued on 18 September 2025 for failing to place a reclamation bond under Ministerial Regulation No. 26/2018, does not affect its operations because the subsidiary has not yet begun production. cnko shares rose 1.09% to Rp97, marking a 169.4% six‑month gain from Rp36 and a 304% yearly rise from Rp24.

title: Alsok Co., Ltd. Buys 4.5% Stake in PT Shield Service TBK (SOSS)
body: Alsok Co., Ltd. acquired a 4.5% stake in PT Shield Service TBK (SOSS) by buying 36,002,829 shares at Rp590 each, valuing the transaction at Rp21.24 billion. Following the purchase, SOSS shares fell 4.49% to Rp850, marking a 16.2% decline over the past month and an 83.1% drop in the last six months.

title: PT Graha Layar Prima Tbk Reports Strong Q2 2025 Earnings and Outlines 2026 Expansion Strategy
body: PT Graha Layar Prima Tbk posted Q2 2025 revenue of Rp614.77 billion, slightly down 0.46% YoY, while operating profit surged 157% to Rp85.79 billion and full-year profit rose 155% to Rp25.22 billion; the company plans to expand new cinemas, upgrade to laser projectors, and strengthen F&B and exclusive CGV content to drive growth in 2026.

title: Lis Herijati Resigns as COO of PT Bank Maspion Indonesia TBK, Board to Discuss at Upcoming AGM
body: Lis Herijati has submitted her resignation as operational director of PT Bank Maspion Indonesia TBK, which has been received by corporate secretary Bmas, Kasemsri Charoensiddhi. The resignation will be reviewed and decided at the next general meeting of shareholders, potentially leading to a board restructuring.

title: PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk Director Ket Cung Divests Shares, Reducing Holdings to 1.79%
body: Director Ket Cung sold 399,000 shares of PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk at Rp104 each and had previously sold 83.45 million shares at Rp125 each for about Rp10.4 billion, reducing his stake to 78.3 million shares (1.7896%). The company’s shares fell 4.04% to Rp95 on Thursday, after a 63.7% monthly gain, 90% six‑month rise, and a 72.7% year‑to‑date decline.

title: Kundy Wijaya Sell Shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa Tbk
body: Kundy Wijaya sold 50,000 shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa Tbk, reducing their holding from 100,453,700 to 100,403,700. The transaction was a divestment at a price of 41. This sell transaction indicates a minor adjustment in Kundy Wijaya's ownership stake.

title: Bapak Hapsoro Sell Shares of PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk
body: Bapak Hapsoro, an insider, sold 325,000,000 shares of PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk, reducing his holdings from 1,145,671,125 to 820,671,125. The transaction occurred in two parts, both at a price of 450. The purpose of the sale is not disclosed.

title: PT Kalbe Farma Tbk Sell Shares of PT Enseval Putera Megatrading Tbk
body: PT Kalbe Farma Tbk, an insider, sold 5,500,000 shares of PT Enseval Putera Megatrading Tbk, reducing its holding from 2,496,785,795 to 2,491,285,795. The transaction occurred in the consumer-non-cyclicals sector, specifically in food-staples-retailing. The purpose of the transaction was not disclosed.

title: Indonesia Aims to Boost Durian Export Profits by Shipping Directly to China
body: Indonesia’s Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Sudaryono, announced plans to export durians straight to China, potentially raising profit margins from 10% to 30%, and also intends to export surplus chicken eggs to the Chinese market. In 2024, Indonesia exported 600 tons of durians worth about US$1.8 million, while China imported a record 15.6 billion kilograms of durians valued near US$7 billion.

title: Indonesia Summons Private Gas Stations Over Delayed Pertamina Fuel Deal
body: The Energy Mineral Resources Ministry has summoned operators of private gas stations, including Shell, Vivo, British Petroleum, and Exxon Mobil, to discuss the delayed purchase of base fuel from Pertamina. Earlier, Minister Bahlil Lahadalia announced that these stations had agreed to buy additional fuel stocks through Pertamina’s import scheme, but no purchases have yet been made, a measure intended to address shortages affecting the stations.

title: Indonesia Wins WTO Ruling Against EU Countervailing Duties on Stainless Steel
body: The WTO panel ruled that most EU countervailing duties on Indonesian stainless steel were inconsistent with WTO rules, prompting Indonesia to call for their removal and promising to monitor implementation. The decision follows Indonesia’s complaint filed in February 2023 and could improve market access for its stainless steel exports to the EU.

title: Indonesia Finance Minister Reaffirms Commitment to Curb Illegal Cigarettes and Support Small Producers
body: Indonesia's Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa visited a small tobacco industry zone in Kudus, Central Java, to reaffirm the government's commitment to curb illegal cigarette production and distribution while offering legal pathways and financial support for small producers. He emphasized that enforcement will be tightened through the Customs Excise Office, that illegal operations will be transitioned into formal industry zones, and that the goal is a fair market where both large and small businesses thrive and taxes are paid.

title: PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama Reduces Its Holding in PT Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Tbk to 31.55% After Selling 202.38 Million Shares
body: On October 1 2025, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama sold 166,666,700 shares of PT Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Tbk at Rp480 each, and on September 19 2025 it sold 35,714,300 shares at Rp420 each, reducing its stake from 32.25% to 31.55% (7.5 billion shares).

title: PT Minna Padi Investama Sekuritas Tbk Approves Rights Issue of 2.2 Billion Shares
body: In an extraordinary general meeting, PT Minna Padi Investama Sekuritas Tbk. approved a rights issue of up to 2,261,449,305 new shares at a nominal value of Rp25.00, representing a capital increase of 2.2 billion shares. The meeting granted the board authority to determine the final share count, pricing, schedule, and use of proceeds, with 43.13% of voting shares represented at the meeting.

title: Astra International Declares Interim Dividend of Rp3.96 Trillion, Equating to Rp98 per Share
body: Astra International announced an interim dividend of Rp3.96 trillion, based on 25.55% of first‑semester 2025 net profit of Rp15.51 trillion, with a payout of Rp98 per share scheduled for October 31, 2025. The company’s financial snapshot as of June 30, 2025 shows net profit of Rp15.51 trillion, retained earnings of Rp205.22 trillion, equity of Rp278.75 trillion, and total assets of Rp487.79 trillion.

title: OJK finds no IT infrastructure issues at bca amid panca global sekuritas fund theft investigation
body: The Financial Services Authority (ojk) investigated bca and panca global sekuritas and found no errors in bca’s IT systems, while coordinating with banks to block accounts and strengthen KYC and security. Panca global sekuritas has reportedly returned the stolen funds to affected customers, though the actual loss amount remains disputed.

title: Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Targets MSCI Small‑Cap Inclusion Amid Market Cap and Free Float Challenges
body: Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk (CBRE) aims to qualify for the MSCI Small‑Cap index, but its free‑float market cap of only Rp912 billion (USD 57 million) falls far below the USD 161 million threshold; the company plans a rights issue of up to 48 billion shares and a USD 100 million vessel acquisition to boost its market cap to Rp12.9 trillion, which would require the share price to climb to roughly Rp3,000. The company also pledges to maintain liquidity and price stability while pursuing aggressive expansion to attract investors and potentially enable future dividends.

title: Mirae Asset Sekuritas Indonesia Names Ivonne Kaharu as COO to Strengthen Customer Service
body: Mirae Asset Sekuritas Indonesia has appointed Ivonne Kaharu, who brings over 23 years of experience and previously served as head finance and CFO, as its new Chief Operating Officer. The company also opened a new branch office in Mangga Dua on October 1, 2025, to provide comprehensive client services and enhance its investment platform experience.

title: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk Receives IDAA Rating with Stable Outlook
body: Indonesia's credit rating agency has assigned PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk an IDAA rating with a stable outlook, underscoring its position as a leading petrochemical player with strong liquidity and financial flexibility. The rating notes a moderate capital structure and sensitivity to industry cycles, while 2026 is expected to bring margin gains from new projects and acquisitions such as Aster Chemicals Energy Pte Ltd and Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals, though risks include raw‑material price pressure, demand downturns, and debt‑dependent expansion.

title: pt bank oke indonesia tbk. approves treasury share transfer and capital reduction in extraordinary general meeting
body: During an extraordinary general meeting, pt bank oke indonesia tbk. shareholders approved the transfer of treasury shares via a buyback mechanism that reduced the company's paid‑up capital from Rp1.703 trillion to Rp1.68 trillion, decreasing the share count from 17,037,792,274 to 16,892,391,185. Director efdinal alamsyah of dnar stated that the capital reduction would not affect the company's operational, legal, financial condition, or business continuity.

title: Indonesia’s Bursa Efek Indonesia lifts FCA status for four stocks after a week of suspension, noting post‑removal price swings remain extreme
body: Indonesia’s Bursa Efek Indonesia lifted the FCA status for pt hassana boga sejahtera tbk., pt md pictures tbk., pt cakra buana resources energi tbk., and pt golden power tbk. after a week of suspension, noting that while volatility eased, Friday trading saw two stocks hit auto‑rejection upper and two hit lower, with saham uang up 24.84% to Rp1,005, saham polu up 19.89% to Rp16,875, saham nayz down 10% to Rp171, and saham film down 12.75% to Rp5,475.

title: PT Sariguna Primatirta Tbk’s Cleo Reports Strong First‑Half Sales Growth and Expands Production Capacity
body: Cleo, the bottled water arm of PT Sariguna Primatirta Tbk, posted first‑half sales of Rp1.37 trillion, up 5.4% year‑on‑year, with July sales rising 10% YoY thanks to a new factory now fully operational and a robust general‑trade distribution model. The company is adding three new plants in Pekanbaru, Pontianak and Palu, and launching product innovations such as a 1‑liter bottle, to support continued growth and brand loyalty.

title: PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk Surges to Rp150 per Share Amid Rumors of Vanguard Group Interest
body: Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk jumped from below Rp50 in early August to Rp150 on 2 October 2025, sparking rumors that the Vanguard Group may consider investing after a planned partial release of ownership could boost liquidity. Analysts caution investors to focus on long‑term strategy, noting the company’s undervalued commercial property assets in Jakarta’s Golden Triangle and government support, while acknowledging that the target valuation of Rp230,000 per share and a USD100 billion market cap remain volatile.

title: PT Harum Energy TBK Announces 2025-2026 Share Buyback Program Using Internal Cash
body: PT Harum Energy TBK will repurchase up to 751,793,346 shares (5.56% of paid‑up capital) at a nominal value of Rp20 per share, allocating Rp837 billion from internal cash for the buyback, which will run from 6 October 2025 to 2 January 2026. The company states the program will not materially affect its operations.

title: PT RMK Energy TBK Reports 20% Divestment by Controlling Shareholder PT RMK Investama, Selling 875 Million Shares at Rp890 per Share
body: PT RMK Energy TBK disclosed that its controlling shareholder PT RMK Investama divested 875 million shares—about 20% of the company—on 29 and 30 September 2025 at an average price of Rp890 per share, totaling Rp778.75 billion, well below the September 29 closing price of Rp1,535. The sale, executed to realize gains and increase public ownership, involved buyers such as PT Magna Investasi Sejahtera, PT Global Multi Investasi, PT Alpha Investasi Asia, PT Artha Dana Indonesia, and PT Mitra Investasi Gemilang, with no change in control reported.

title: PT Harta Djaya Karya Tbk Reports New Shares Issued Through Staggered Series I Warrant Exercise in September‑October 2025
body: PT Harta Djaya Karya Tbk issued new shares as holders exercised Series I warrants from September 17 to October 1, 2025, raising the total shares outstanding to 1,918,260,935 and reducing the remaining warrants to 479,239,065. The monthly registration report shows the number of shareholders rose from 2,346 in late July to 3,808 by the end of August 2025.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange lifts trading suspensions for four companies, triggering sharp gains in Haji Isam’s stocks
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced that trading suspensions for PT Indonesia Pondasi Raya Tbk., PT Jhonlin Agro Raya Tbk., PT Era Graharealty Tbk., and PT Estika Tata Tiara Tbk. were lifted on Friday, leading to significant price increases for Haji Isam’s shares: Jarr rose 9.88% to Rp4,670, IPAC jumped 9.49% to Rp300, IDPR climbed 15.21% to Rp500, and BEEF gained 14.52% to Rp710. BEI cautioned investors to monitor disclosure and assess risk before making investment decisions.

title: Indonesia Shrimp Contamination with Cesium-137 Sparks US FDA Red List and Price Decline
