body: A shrimp consignment processed at an industrial estate near Jakarta was found contaminated with cesium‑137, prompting the US FDA to add the product to its red list and causing a 35% drop in shrimp prices in several regions. Indonesia, the world’s fifth‑largest shrimp exporter with 215,000 tonnes shipped in 2024 valued at about $1.7 billion, faces potential job losses as the incident raises safety concerns for its shrimp industry.

title: Waskita Karya Secures Rp415.44 Billion Contract to Rehabilitate Banten Irrigation Network
body: Waskita Karya has won a Rp415.44 billion contract to rehabilitate the main irrigation network in Banten province, covering Packages I, III and IV, with work slated to finish between September and December 2025. The project aims to improve water delivery efficiency, reduce leakage, and support food self‑sufficiency for local farmers.

title: Trimegah Sekuritas to Issue Rp500 Billion Bonds as Part of Sustainable Bonds II Program
body: Trimegah Sekuritas will offer Rp500 billion in bonds—comprising Rp90 billion fully guaranteed and Rp410 billion best‑effort guaranteed—across two series with 6.75% and 8.25% coupons, maturing in 2026 and 2028. The proceeds will be allocated 70% to repurchase agreements and 30% to margin financing for broker Boy Thohir.

title: Alexander Ramlie divests 45 million shares of Amman Mineral Internasional, raising Rp310.5 billion
body: On 29 September 2025, Alexander Ramlie sold 45 million shares of Amman Mineral Internasional at Rp6,900 per share, generating Rp310.5 billion and reducing his stake to 0.358 % from 0.42 %. Prior to that, he had sold 10.38 million shares in two tranches on 26 and 30 September 2025, raising Rp72.63 billion.

title: First Resources Ltd Completes Mandatory Tender Offer for Austindo Shares, Gaining 95.92% Control
body: First Resources Ltd finalized a mandatory tender offer for 207,649,166 Austindo shares at Rp1,813 per share, paying Rp288.69 billion and raising its stake to 95.92% of Austindo’s fully paid capital. The acquisition, completed between 26 August and 24 September 2025, follows a prior purchase of 3.05 billion shares through Ciliandra Perkasa and is expected to enable integrated palm‑oil operations and long‑term value creation.

title: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd Sells 963.99 Million Shares of Barito Renewables Energy, Reducing Stake to 21.27%
body: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd divested 963.99 million shares of Barito Renewables Energy in three stages between 29 September and 1 October 2025, cutting its holding from 29.32% to 21.27% and boosting the free float. The sale, facilitated by HSBC Indonesia, DBS Indonesia, and Citibank NA, generated Rp758.7 bn for the first tranche and Rp83.39 bn for the second, with the remaining 877.40 million shares sold without detailed pricing.

title: Chandra Daya Investasi completes Rp8.2 trillion transaction involving loans, new shares, and acquisitions with BPN and subsidiaries
body: On 1 October 2025, Chandra Daya Investasi executed a Rp8.2 trillion transaction that included a Rp1 trillion loan to BPN, issuance of 18,138,724 new csi shares and 18,027,795 new mim shares, and acquisition of csi and mim shares from BPN for Rp2.68 trillion. The transaction fully repaid BPN’s loan and settled all obligations, with the deals involving Chandra Shipping International, Marina Indah Maritim, Buana Primatama Niaga, and PT Chandra Samudera Port.

title: Indonesia Strengthens Quality Assurance for Fishery Exports to Saudi Arabia Ahead of Hajj Season
body: Indonesia’s Ministry of Maritime Affairs Fisheries has confirmed that its fishery products destined for Saudi Arabia meet strict safety and quality standards, with 63 processing units approved for export and a 2025 production target of 24.58 million tonnes. The ministry is collaborating with Saudi food‑drug authorities, the Indonesian embassy in Riyadh, and Hajj/Umrah bodies to secure supply for the estimated 221,000 pilgrims and the Indonesian diaspora.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Unveils Plan to Build 3 Million Homes and Launch 26,000 Subsidized Units in Indonesia
body: At a mass signing ceremony in Cileungsi, Bogor, President Prabowo Subianto pledged to guarantee decent housing for all Indonesians and announced a target of three million homes, while launching 26,000 subsidized units. He outlined eight policy measures—including a 5% land acquisition tax exemption, free building permits, VAT coverage for homes under 2 billion rupiah, a reserve requirement cut from 5% to 4%, and an increase in the annual subsidized mortgage quota from 220,000 to 350,000 units—to expand affordable housing access for low‑income groups.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Halts Trading of Six Shares Amid Rapid Price Surges
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange temporarily suspended trading of six companies—PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk., PT Petrosea Tbk., PT Koka Indonesia Tbk., PT Asri Karya Lestari Tbk., PT Estika Tata Tiara Tbk., and PT Timah Tbk—after several stocks, notably Buva and Koka, experienced extreme price surges (up to 1,193.10% YTD for Buva and 503% YTD for Koka). The halt applies to both the regular and cash markets, giving market participants time to reassess investment decisions.

title: Barito Renewables Completes Retrofit of Salak Geothermal Units, Adding 7.7 MW to Total Capacity
body: Barito Renewables, through its subsidiary Star Energy Geothermal, finished a retrofit on units 4, 5, and 6 of the Salak geothermal plant, adding 7.7 MW—exceeding the expected 7.2 MW—and investing USD 22.5 million, bringing the company’s total installed capacity to 910.3 MW. The company also operates a 78.75 MW wind plant via Barito Wind and plans further geothermal expansion to exceed 100 MW with a total investment of USD 365 million, aiming to support Indonesia’s clean energy transition and create jobs.

title: Foreign investors accumulate shares of Prima Multi Usaha, boosting confidence in its telecom distribution prospects
body: Foreign investors bought 11.79 million shares of Prima Multi Usaha in the last month, with JP Morgan Sekuritas Indonesia contributing 3.34 million shares, signaling positive sentiment. The company raised Rp208.8 billion in its IPO, plans to strengthen working capital, expand distribution, and enhance partner services across Indonesia.

title: Jasuindo Maintains Strong Outlook for Security Document Business Amid Growing Domestic and Export Demand
body: Jasuindo reports that its security document segment, including e‑KTP, e‑passport and passport components, accounted for Rp588 billion (88.22 %) of first‑half 2025 sales and that exports now represent 20.5 % of total revenue, while the company expands into RFID, security printing and brand protection to sustain growth.

title: Bank Mandiri Enhances Livin' Merchant App with Real‑Time Cash Withdrawal and Expanded Features to Support UMKM
body: Bank Mandiri has added a real‑time cash withdrawal option with automated voice notifications to its Livin' Merchant app, alongside Qris payment, POS, and in‑app purchasing features, to better serve small businesses. The platform now boasts nearly 3 million users, a 35% YoY growth, and a 166% YoY increase in total transaction value.

title: bank tabungan negara to leverage new interest‑subsidy rules to expand housing credit for UMKM developers
body: Under Permenkeu 65/2025, bank tabungan negara will receive a 5% annual interest subsidy for supply‑side housing credit and offer 10% and 5.5% subsidies to borrowers with Rp10‑100M and Rp100‑500M loans respectively, aiming to boost housing supply and stimulate the broader construction ecosystem. The bank estimates that about 500,000 existing borrowers could be targeted, potentially adding significant new credit volume to its subsidized mortgage portfolio next year.

title: Jasa Marga, Persada Utama Infra, Adhi Karya, and Hutama Karya Infra Form Consortium to Build Bogor–Serpong Toll via Parung
body: Jasa Marga, Persada Utama Infra, Adhi Karya, and Hutama Karya Infra formed the BSIS consortium, holding 26%, 52%, 12%, and 10% respectively, to construct the Bogor–Serpong toll road via Parung. The project, signed by the Ministry of Public Works, aims to enhance connectivity and stimulate economic growth in the Jakarta metropolitan area.

title: Radana Bhaskara Finance Reports 79% Decline in Q1 2025 Earnings to Rp2.17 Billion
body: Radana Bhaskara Finance posted a Q1 2025 profit of Rp2.17 billion, a 79% drop from Rp10.45 billion in the same period last year, while revenue rose 12% to Rp202.34 billion. Total expenses climbed to Rp197.89 billion, and net equity increased to Rp574.58 billion, though liabilities rose to Rp3.01 trillion.

title: Geoprima Plans Majority Share Divestment to New Investor Amid Market Volatility
body: Geoprima announced plans to divest its majority stake to a new investor within three months, with CEO Karnadi Margaka still holding 52.49% of shares as of September 29, 2025. Despite a 692.79% share price rally last year and a recent suspension following acquisition rumors, the company is focusing on operational efficiencies and expanding into renewable energy consulting and infrastructure projects to sustain long‑term growth.

title: Surge’s Wi‑Fi 7 Launch in Bali Sparks Speculation Over Huawei’s Strategic Involvement
body: On 3 October 2025, pt solusi sinergi digital tbk launched Wi‑Fi 7 in Bali with Huawei as the technology partner, prompting analysts to speculate that Huawei may be testing a deeper stake in Surge, the Indonesian subsidiary of pt integrasi jaringan ekosistem. The move has driven up trading volume for the Wi‑Fi shares, with analysts citing support levels at 2410 and 2750 and targets of 3460 and 3900 for the remainder of 2025.

title: Kendy Wijaya Divests 3.5 Million Shares of kkes, Reducing Stake to 5.73%
body: pt kusuma kemindo sentosa tbk reported that Kendy Wijaya sold 1,502,300 shares of kkes on Oct 1 and 2, 2025, for a total of Rp135.09 million, reducing his stake from 5.96% to 5.73% (85,891,000 shares). After the divestment, kkes shares fell 7.89% to Rp35 at Friday’s close.

title: Amir Sunarko of PT SLJ Global Tbk Cuts Shareholding, Prompting a 14.47% Stock Price Decline
body: Amir Sunarko sold 25,141,600 shares at Rp98–Rp99 and bought 27,522,936 shares at Rp109, reducing his stake to 4.59% from 4.61%. The transactions coincided with a 14.47% drop in PT SLJ Global Tbk shares to Rp130 on Friday.

title: October 2025 predicted to be a warm month for dividend‑loving investors as several top issuers and palm sector stocks prepare interim dividend payouts.
body: Companies such as pt astra international tbk., pt united tractors tbk., pt astra agro lestari tbk., pt pinago utama tbk., and pt cisadane sawit raya tbk. have announced interim dividend schedules, with yields exceeding 4%, making October a golden opportunity for dividend hunters.

title: bank raya wins katadata green initiatives awards 2025 for inclusive finance and coastal conservation
body: bank raya, a digital bank under bri group, received the katadata green initiatives awards 2025 for inclusive finance and coastal conservation, and reported a rise in sustainable credit disbursement from Rp1.88 trillion to Rp2.23 trillion by June 2025, alongside operational savings of 8.47% in water use, 0.47 ton of paper waste reduction, and 29.04% fuel consumption cut. The bank also launched the mission vgnz program aksi tanam 1000 kebaikan, engaging over 3,500 customers to plant 3,500 mangrove trees in the pantura green belt program at mangunharjo, semarang, jawa tengah, while calculating its operational carbon footprint.

title: PT Teladan Prima Agro Tbk Announces Interim 2025 Dividend of Rp15.5 per Share
body: PT Teladan Prima Agro Tbk will distribute an interim dividend for FY 2025 totaling Rp200.67 billion (Rp15.5 per share), approved by the board on 2 October 2025. The ex‑dividend dates are 13–14 October for the regular market and 15–16 October for the cash market, with payment on 23 October, while the stock rose 3.65% to Rp710 at Friday’s close.

title: Menn Teknologi Indonesia TBK Clarifies Share Sale by Jora Nilam Judge Amid Lack of Disclosure
body: Jora Nilam Judge sold 135.24 million shares of Menn Teknologi Indonesia TBK in four staged transactions in September 2025, but the company has not received any disclosure of the sale’s background, price, or counterparties, and no shares were absorbed in the mandatory tender offer. The company’s management transition to a new controlling shareholder is still pending approval, while the shares traded up 5.56 % to Rp57 on Friday.

title: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd divests 481.22 million shares of Barito Renewables Energy at Rp8,650 each, raising Rp4.16 trillion
body: The divestment, completed on 2 October 2025, reduced Green Era’s stake in Barito Renewables Energy to 30.76 billion shares (22.99%) from 31.24 billion shares (23.35%) and was aimed at increasing free float and liquidity.

title: Indonesian Minister Urges Consistent 8-Hour Workday for Freight Truck Drivers to Improve Safety and Welfare
body: Coordinating Minister of Infrastructure and Regional Development Agus Harimurti Yudhoyono called for consistent enforcement of an 8‑hour workday for freight truck drivers, citing weak regulation enforcement and the high number of traffic accidents involving freight vehicles. He highlighted the government's intent to improve drivers' welfare and welcomed input from driver associations to create a safer, more humane logistics ecosystem.

title: PT Timah to Operate Six Confiscated Tin Smelters in Bangka Belitung Starting 2026
body: PT Timah will begin operating six confiscated tin smelters in Bangka Belitung in early 2026 after inspection by President Prabowo Subianto, aiming to boost regional tin production and support Indonesia’s downstream processing strategy. The handover of the assets, valued at $422 million, was part of a broader crackdown on illegal mining and a move to strengthen state control over the tin industry.

title: Indonesia Telecoms Shift to Pricing Discipline Boosts ARPU Ahead of Q4
body: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison halted its low‑priced IM3 starter packs on 1 October, while Telkomsel XL Axiata cleared sub‑Rp35k inventory, signalling a sector‑wide move toward monetisation that is expected to lift ARPU. cgs international maintains an overweight rating, noting the sector trades at ~4.6× forward EV/EBITDA versus a 5.4× five‑year average, and highlights ESG transparency gaps that could affect investor interest.

title: CDI Group Expands Solar Power Portfolio to 11 MWp, Targeting 9,855 Tons CO2 Reduction by 2025
body: CDI Group’s subsidiary Krakatau Chandra Energi added a 4.7 MWp ground‑mounted solar plant in Cilegon, Banten, bringing the group’s total installed solar capacity to 11 MWp, expected to be operational by November 2025. The expansion is projected to cut annual CO₂ emissions by 9,855 tCO₂eq, equivalent to the carbon uptake of over 469,000 trees, and supports Indonesia’s renewable energy transition.

title: Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia Reduces Energy Mega Persada Holdings in Silent Sale, Bakrie Kalila Investment Buys Shares
body: Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia sold 1,135,900,000 shares of Energy Mega Persada in a silent transaction on 3 October 2025, reducing its holdings to 4.2 billion shares (16.18 %). Bakrie Kalila Investment acquired 1.59 billion shares (6.13 %) in the deal, with Trimegah Sekuritas raising approximately Rp1.08 trillion and Bakrie Kalila about Rp1.52 trillion at the closing price of Rp955.

title: Dian Swastatika to Issue Rp1.5 Trillion in Bonds and Sukuk
body: Dian Swastatika will raise Rp1.5 trillion through a Rp256.7 bn sustainable bond (fixed 6.875% over 5 years) and a Rp1.24 trn sukuk mudharabah split into two series with profit‑sharing rates equivalent to 6.25% and 6.875% per year, with first coupon payments on 10 Jan 2026 and maturity on 10 Oct 2030. Proceeds will be used to repay bank loans, refinance existing debt, and fund expansion of the SSDP data centre, with the public offering scheduled to begin 6 Oct 2025 and listing on 10 Oct 2025.

title: NTBK Stock Gains Attention Amid Speculation of Acquisition by Chinese EV Truck Giants
body: NTBK has seen a surge in trading volume and investor interest after reports of potential talks with two major Chinese EV truck manufacturers, echoing the rapid rise of techno9 indonesia and prompting speculation of a backdoor listing that could boost its valuation. While the company’s solid fundamentals and low valuation attract strategic investors, analysts caution that the deal’s success depends on the acquirers’ genuine business activity and that liquidity could be affected if the stock enters a full call auction.

title: Adira Finance to Issue Rp2.35 Trillion in Bonds and Sukuk Mudharabah in October 2025
body: Adira Finance will raise Rp2.35 trillion through two series of sustainable bonds (Rp900 bn at 5.5% for 370 days and Rp750 bn at 5.65% for 36 months) and two series of sukuk mudharabah (Rp400 bn at 45.83% share, equivalent 5.5% for 370 days, and Rp300 bn at 47.08% share, equivalent 5.65% for 36 months). Proceeds will fund consumer financing and Sharia‑compliant motor vehicle financing, with the offering scheduled for 15‑16 October 2025 and listing on 22 October 2025.

title: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd Transfers 2 Billion Barito Energy Shares via Custodian Account, Retains Ownership
body: On 22 August 2025, Green Era Energy Pte Ltd moved 2 billion Barito Energy shares between custodian accounts, a transaction that does not change ownership and keeps Green Era as the shareholder. Earlier, Green Era sold 77.4 million shares on 29 September 2025 and 9.19 million shares on 1 October 2025, raising its holding to 31.24 billion shares (23.35%) as of 2 October 2025, up from 29.32 billion shares (21.92%) on 30 September 2025.

title: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua to Raise Rp16.12 Trillion via Right Issue to Fund Kosambi Sukses Expansion
body: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (Pik2) plans a right issue of 1.212.536.300 shares at Rp100 each, with proceeds of Rp16.12 trillion earmarked for a 44.10% stake in Kosambi Sukses and capital for new shares in its subsidiaries Cahaya Inti Sentosa, Karunia Utama Selaras, and Panorama Eka Tunggal. The move aims to strengthen the central business district development and generate recurring revenue from properties such as Hilton Pik2 Jakarta.

title: PT Sentul City Tbk (bksl) Clarifies 2.05 Trillion Rupiah Land Sale to PT Genting Properti Abadi, PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa, and PT Aftanesia Raya
body: PT Sentul City Tbk (bksl) confirmed a 152‑hectare land sale to PT Genting Properti Abadi, PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa, and its subsidiary PT Aftanesia Raya for Rp2.05 trillion, with the sale contract signed and the deed expected by year‑end 2025; proceeds will be used to strengthen the company’s financial position. The shares fell 0.74 % to Rp14 on Thursday, after a 4.36 % monthly rise and a 116 % six‑month gain.

title: PT Astra Otoparts Tbk Announces Interim Cash Dividend of Rp59 per Share for FY 2025
body: The company, part of Grup Astra, will distribute an interim cash dividend of Rp59 per share, totaling Rp284.36 billion, after a board approval on 29 September 2025. With a net profit of Rp938.97 billion and equity of Rp15.84 trillion as of 30 June 2025, the dividend yields about 2.52 %.

title: PT Bank CIMB Niaga Tbk Celebrates 70th Anniversary, Highlights Digital Innovation and Upcoming Syariah Spin-Off
body: PT Bank CIMB Niaga Tbk marked its 70th birthday with a celebration themed "kejar mimpi", emphasizing its commitment to digital innovation, a net promoter score of 57, and four pillars of CSR—education, health and welfare, economic empowerment, and environment. The bank also announced a non‑interest credit program for selected UMKM and the planned spin‑off of its syariah unit into PT Bank CIMB Niaga Syariah, which will operate independently by 4 May 2026 after receiving OJK approval, with UUS of Rp70 trillion.

title: PT Saka Industrial Arjaya Completes Majority Acquisition of PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk.
body: PT Saka Industrial Arjaya has finalized a majority acquisition of PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk., acquiring 83.67% of its shares at Rp580.6 per share and triggering a mandatory tender offer under Indonesian capital market regulations. The deal expands Astra Property’s industrial and logistics portfolio, adding 13 strategically located warehouses totalling 546,000 m² of rentable space and positioning the company to capitalize on growing demand from e‑commerce, FMCG, and manufacturing sectors.

title: PT Petrosea Tbk Accelerates Expansion with Strategic Acquisitions, Projecting Aggressive EBITDA Growth Through 2026
body: PT Petrosea Tbk announced acquisitions of HBS Group in Papua New Guinea and 51% of Hafar Group in Southeast Asia, expanding its portfolio into gold mining and offshore oil & gas services. The deals are expected to lift revenue growth to 42% CAGR and EBITDA to 70% from 2024‑26, with 2025 revenue projected at USD 991 million (43% YoY) and EBITDA at USD 203 million (91% YoY), and 2026 revenue at USD 1.4 billion (41% YoY) and EBITDA at USD 306 million (51% YoY).

title: Husen Sutakaria increases stake in PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk by buying 6.732 million Heal shares for Rp12.39 billion
body: Husen Sutakaria, the main commissioner of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, purchased 6,732,095 Heal shares at Rp1,840 each, raising his ownership to 379.2 million shares (2.47 %) from 372.5 million shares (2.42 %). The transaction, valued at about Rp12.39 billion, was announced by director Yulisar Khiat, and Heal shares fell 3.61 % to Rp1,600 on Monday.

title: Directors of PT Maxindo Karya Anugerah Tbk increase shareholdings with purchases worth about IDR 2.29 billion
body: On 1 Oct 2025, PT Maxindo Karya Anugerah Tbk’s President Director Sarkoro Handajani and Director Carolina Renata Djaja bought 15.6242 million and 30.2416 million shares respectively at IDR 50 per share, bringing their total purchases to roughly IDR 2.29 billion. Their stakes rose to 0.16 % (15.62 million shares) and 0.66 % (63.7 million shares) of the company, and MAXI shares gained 1.75 % to IDR 58 that day.

title: Indonesia’s State-Owned Power Company PLN Targets Net Zero Emissions by 2060 with Green Enabling Supergrid
body: PT PLN, Indonesia’s state‑owned electricity company, says it will achieve net‑zero carbon emissions by 2060 by building a green enabling supergrid that connects renewable energy sources across the archipelago and retiring coal‑fired plants in favor of NRE‑based facilities, while maintaining energy security, affordability and sustainability.

title: Indonesia Responds to China’s New Aluminum Limit on Swiftlet Nest Exports with Audits and Market Diversification Efforts
body: Indonesia’s agricultural quarantine agency Barantin has launched investigative audits and ICP‑MS aluminum testing on 11 companies facing Chinese export sanctions, after China imposed a 100 mg/kg aluminum cap on swiftlet nest products. The agency is also urging exporters to seek alternative destinations such as the U.S., Australia, and Japan while conducting a long‑term study of aluminum levels in raw nest materials.

title: Indonesia's President Approves Mandatory 10% Ethanol (E10) Fuel Policy to Cut Imports and Emissions
body: President Prabowo Subianto has green‑lit a plan requiring all Indonesian gas stations to supply fuel containing 10% ethanol, a move aimed at reducing fuel imports and carbon emissions. PT Pertamina’s president director Simon Aloysius Mantiri said the company will begin implementing the policy next year, building on its existing Pertamax Green 95 blend that already contains 5% ethanol.

title: Indonesia Grants Cooperatives Legal Access to Mine Sites to Boost Public Welfare
body: The Indonesian government has issued Regulation No. 39/2025, allowing cooperatives to manage mining sites, including coal, under new provisions that authorize the Ministry of Cooperatives to screen and approve permits via an online system. The move aims to increase economic benefits for residents in mining regions and strengthen cooperatives as business entities, complementing the Red‑White Village program.

title: Kadin Urges Optimizing Natural Gas Use Amid Rising Market Prices and Supply Shortages in Indonesia
body: Kadin deputy chairman Saleh Husin highlighted that Indonesian industries receive only about 60% of their natural gas allocation under the HGBT scheme, which is set at $7 per MMBtu, forcing them to purchase the remainder at market rates of $16.77 per MMBtu and threatening competitiveness. The ministry reports a 12.43% rise in investment realization for the gas, electricity, and water sector in 2023, while Indonesia’s energy surplus of 12.6 million TJ is largely exported, with the industrial sector consuming 42.1% of national consumption.

title: US Government Shutdown Halts Indonesia‑US Tariff Negotiations, Indonesia Seeks Waiver for Key Commodities
body: The United States' partial shutdown has paused ongoing tariff talks between Indonesia and the U.S., prompting Indonesia to seek a waiver for palm oil, rubber and cocoa from the 19% import tariff. Meanwhile, the shutdown has left 1.3 million troops unpaid, furloughed 750,000 federal employees and cost the U.S. government an estimated $400 million per day.

title: Bali’s Sanur SEZ to Open Internationally Accredited Fertility Center, Boosting Health Tourism
body: PT Hotel Indonesia Natour announced that a new 6,343‑square‑meter fertility treatment center will open in Sanur SEZ, developed in partnership with HIN and the Malaysian fertility clinic network, offering IVF, obstetrics, gynecology and integrated women’s and pediatric services. The project is part of Sanur SEZ’s broader strategy to attract Rp10.2 trillion in investment and create 18,375 direct and 25,272 indirect jobs, with the zone already generating Rp4.42 trillion and 3,822 jobs in Q1 2025.

title: BEI Flags Unusual Market Activity for Four Stocks Amid Sharp Price Increases
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) identified PT Nusatama Berkah Tbk, PT Perintis Triniti Properti Tbk, PT Rukun Raharja Tbk, and PT Superkrane Mitra Utama Tbk as exhibiting abnormal price movements, prompting protective measures for investors. Other stocks such as NTBK, TRIN, MMLP, RAJA, and SKRN also experienced significant jumps, with NTBK surging 34.43% on Tuesday and TRIN rising 34.82%.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Suspends Trading of Four Shares Amid Rapid Price Increases
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange temporarily halted trading of PT Multipolar Tbk, PT Multi Garam Utama Tbk, PT Asri Karya Lestari Tbk, and PT Koka Indonesia Tbk on 8 October 2025 after their shares—MLPL, FOLK, ASLI, and KOKA—experienced significant cumulative price rises (up to 80.88% in a month for MLPL, 103.95% for FOLK, 340% for ASLI, and 327.08% for KOKA). The suspension, announced by the BSE’s transaction monitoring division, aims to protect investors by cooling down the market after these sharp gains.

title: Indointernet (Indonet) Secures Rp5.5 Trillion Credit Facility from BCA for Refinancing, Edge2 Project, and Corporate Expansion
body: Indointernet (Indonet) and its subsidiary Ekagrata Data Gemilang have obtained a Rp5.5 trillion credit facility from BCA, signed on 6 October 2025, to refinance existing debt, fund the Edge2 data center project, and support general corporate purposes. The facility, backed by company assets and guaranteeing more than 50% of each entity’s net worth, will also provide a Rp39.20 billion letter of credit and bank guarantee package to bolster liquidity and accelerate fiber‑optic network expansion.

title: Kiwoom Securities Indonesia Projects Conservative‑Moderate IHSG Growth for Q4‑2025 and Highlights Seven Stock Picks Across Sectors
body: Kiwoom Securities Indonesia, led by research head Liza Camelia Suryanata, forecasts the Indonesian Composite Index to move conservatively moderate in Q4‑2025 with a year‑end target of 7,850‑8,000, and recommends a diversified set of stocks—JPFA, ICBP, SSMS, AKRA, HGII, IPCC, PGEO, BMRI, BBRI, ANT M, HRTA, and CYBR—based on factors such as stable commodity prices, currency stability, export demand, government projects, renewable energy expansion, and banking sector recovery. The recommendations are presented as informational guidance and not as direct buy or sell advice.

title: Goldman Sachs Raises 2026 Gold Price Forecast to $4,900/oz Amid ETF Demand and Central Bank Purchases
body: Goldman Sachs lifted its December 2026 gold price projection to $4,900 per ounce, citing increased ETF inflows in the West and ongoing central‑bank purchases, while spot gold traded around $3,960/oz and Antam’s bullion price hit a record Rp 2,284,000 per gram. The bank expects central banks to buy about 80 t in 2025 and 70 t in 2026, and anticipates a 100‑basis‑point Fed rate cut by mid‑2026, boosting gold as a hedge.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Places Four PT Companies Under Uma Status Amid Volatile Price Movements
body: The Bursa Efek Indonesia has placed PT Nusatama Berkah Tbk., PT Perintis Triniti Properti Tbk., PT Superkrane Mitra Utama Tbk., and PT Rukun Raharja Tbk. under Uma status due to unusually high price volatility, and after the opening on Wednesday, NTBK surged 34.15% to Rp110 while SKRN fell 9.09% to Rp650 before rebounding 11.19% to Rp795.

title: Indonesia rating agency confirms Merdeka Copper Gold's rating, noting stable prospects but highlighting upside potential if new projects succeed and downside risks from commodity price drops
body: The rating agency affirmed Merdeka Copper Gold's rating, citing its integrated vertical operations, diversified business, and adequate reserves, while noting that the rating could be upgraded if new projects generate higher revenue or EBITDA and could be lowered by lower margins, aggressive debt, or significant commodity price declines. Merdeka Copper Gold operates projects across seven locations in Banyuwangi, Gorontalo, Maluku, Sulawesi, and Central Sulawesi, with major shareholders including saratoga investama sedaya (20.34%), mitra daya mustika (11.88%), garibaldi thohir (7.46%), suwarna arta mandiri (5.51%), and a 54.81% treasury holding.

title: Petrosea Expands into Pakistan with EPC Services for Reko Diq Mining Project
body: Petrosea, through its subsidiary Petrosea Solutions Pakistan Limited, has signed a preliminary agreement with Reko Diq Mining Company Limited to provide EPC services for the world’s largest gold and copper mine in Pakistan, with a contract value of USD 26.2 million (≈Rp432 billion) and a 10‑month completion timeline. The deal marks the company’s expansion into international markets and diversification of its EPC business.

title: pertamina geothermal energy injects Rp396 billion into pge kotamobagu to strengthen geothermal development
body: On 3 October 2025, pertamina geothermal energy injected Rp396 billion into its subsidiary pge kotamobagu, raising the latter’s paid‑up capital to Rp800 billion and giving pertamina a 99% stake. The capital injection, to be paid in three tranches, will fund exploration and accelerate the 280‑MW geothermal project in Kotamobagu, supporting the company’s goal of 1 GW of green energy capacity within 2–3 years.

title: PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk Completes Full Acquisition of PT Chandra Shipping International and PT Marina Indah Maritim After Changing to Domestic Investment Status
body: PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (cdia) has acquired 100% of PT Chandra Shipping International and PT Marina Indah Maritim from PT Buana Primatama Niaga, following a loan agreement and capital injections that raised CSI’s paid‑up capital to Rp 2.85 trillion and MIM’s to Rp 2.33 trillion. Analysts view the move as a strategic expansion that will lower logistics costs, boost fleet utilisation and strengthen recurring income, with a buy recommendation and a target price of Rp 2,800–3,000 per share.

title: Morgan Stanley Capital Indonesia to Announce Next Index Review on November 5, 2025, with Implementation Effective November 25, 2025
body: Research by Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia, Prasetya Gunadi, shows PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk, with a free‑float adjusted market cap of US$3.5 billion and an average daily transaction value of US$12.9 million, is poised for inclusion in the MSCI index, while PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk could move from the MSCI Small Cap Index to the MSCI Global Standard Index if its share price rises above Rp 800. PT Kalbe Farma Tbk risks removal from the MSCI Global Standard Index as its free‑float market cap falls below US$1.2 billion, and recent rebalancing added PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk and PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk to the MSCI Global Standard Index while shifting PT Adaro Energy Indonesia Tbk to the MSCI Small Cap Index.

title: PT Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk Settles Rp 407.9 Billion Obligasi I 2022 Maturing Oct 7, 2025, Prompting Pefindo to Withdraw Its Debt Rating
body: PT Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk has fully paid the Rp 407.9 billion Obligasi I 2022 series due on 7 October 2025, leading Pefindo to remove the bond’s rating. The company previously issued a larger Obligasi I 2022 series with a principal of Rp 950 billion, which had received an effective rating from OJK on 29 September 2022.

title: PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia Assigns IDA+ Rating to PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk
body: PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia confirmed an IDA+ rating for PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk and its sustainable bonds III, IV, and V, citing the company’s vertically integrated operations, diversified business, and adequate mining reserves. The rating is considered stable, but could rise or fall depending on future project performance, EBITDA, debt levels, and commodity price fluctuations, with the company reporting US$854.6 million revenue in the first half of 2025.

title: PT Timah Tbk Shares Surge 148% in October 2025 After Government Transfers Six Smelters, Analysts Maintain Buy Recommendation
body: PT Timah Tbk’s stock jumped 148.62% over the past month, closing at Rp 2,710 on 7 October 2025, after the government transferred six smelters worth Rp 6–7 trillion to the company, boosting production outlook and market share expectations. Analysts from Maybank Sekuritas, Indo Premier Sekuritas, and Infovesta Kapital Advisori project a turnaround in the second half of 2025, with net profit potentially reaching Rp 908 billion by year‑end and a medium‑term target price of Rp 3,000–3,200 per share.

title: Indonesia's IDX suspends trading of PT Estika Tata Tiara Tbk after sharp, unexplained price surge
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange halted trading of PT Estika Tata Tiara Tbk on Monday as the stock rose to Rp715, a 119.3% increase from Rp326 on 8 September 2025 and a 457% gain year‑to‑date from Rp128. Management said it was unaware of any shareholder activity causing the volatility, will coordinate with the IDX and OJK, and highlighted Q2‑2025 sales growth driven by strong demand for beef, chicken and protein products, especially from the government’s free nutritious meal program.

title: Buana Lintas Laut Raises Rp253.54 Billion via Private Placement of 1.4 Billion Shares Executed by Fortune Street Limited
body: The company issued 1.4 billion new shares at Rp180 each, raising Rp253.54 billion, and the shares were listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on October 6, 2025, increasing total shares outstanding to 15.49 billion. Proceeds will be used for fleet development and working capital for Buana Lintas Laut and its wholly‑owned subsidiaries Citrine Maritime, Sapphire Maritime, Nusa Bhakti Jayaraya, Pearl Maritime, and Naga Sinar Maritim, through equity injections or loans as needed.

title: Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc reduces its stake in Sumber Alfaria Trijaya by selling 43.1 million shares for IDR 82.34 billion
body: On 25 September 2025, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc sold 43,124,504 shares of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya at IDR 1,909.4384 per share, generating IDR 82.34 billion, after an earlier purchase of 109,800 shares at IDR 1,865.7923 each. The sale lowered its holding to 3.69 billion shares, representing 8.9048% of the company, down 0.1039 percentage points from before the transaction.

title: Jakarta commercial court approves withdrawal of PKPU petitions against Wijaya Karya Bangunan Gedung, stating no impact on operations
body: On 6 October 2025 the Central Jakarta Commercial Court accepted the withdrawal of PKPU applications filed by Celestia Sinergi Indonesia and Mitra Buana Koorporindo against Wijaya Karya Bangunan Gedung, and the company affirmed that the ruling does not negatively affect its operational, legal or financial condition. The court had previously rejected a PKPU request from Persada Nusantara Steel, which the company also said would not directly affect its operations or finances.

title: PT Astra Graphia Tbk declares interim cash dividend of Rp40.46 billion for FY2025
body: The board approved a cash interim dividend of Rp30 per share, totaling Rp40.46 billion and yielding about 2.54% based on a closing price of Rp1,180, funded by a net profit of Rp106.19 billion and retained earnings of Rp1.74 trillion. The dividend is scheduled with a cum‑date on 15 Oct 2025 (regular market) and 17 Oct 2025 (cash market), and ex‑dates on 16 Oct and 20 Oct respectively.

title: PT Waskita Karya Tbk secures Rp318.54 billion irrigation contract for Komering Sub Phase 3 in South Sumatra
body: PT Waskita Karya Tbk has been awarded a new contract worth Rp318.54 billion to complete the remaining 8,500 ha of the Komering Sub irrigation project (Phase 3) in South Sumatra, bringing the total covered area to 13,500 ha. The project, managed by the Ministry of Public Works and Housing, is intended to support Indonesia's food self‑sufficiency, improve agricultural productivity, and boost local economic welfare.

title: PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk appoints new board after Astra International Tbk subsidiary acquires 83.6% stake
body: Effective 6 October 2025, PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk announced a new board with Ashwin Bhat as President Director and updated directors and commissioners following the acquisition by PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, a subsidiary of PT Astra International Tbk. The acquisition involved the purchase of 5,764,371,329 shares (83.6%) at Rp580 per share, amounting to a transaction value of Rp3.34 trillion.

title: PT LogisticsPlus International Tbk CEO Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko buys 474,500 shares, raising his stake to 1.67 million
body: Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko purchased 230,000 shares at Rp89 and 244,500 shares at Rp90, increasing his holding from 1,197,960 to 1,672,460 shares. The purchase follows LOPI's removal from the FCA monitoring board, with the stock slipping 2.22% to Rp88.

title: PT Panasia Indo Resources Tbk approves delisting after shareholder vote
body: In an extraordinary general meeting, shareholders representing 99.2% of the 3.57 billion outstanding shares voted unanimously to change PT Panasia Indo Resources Tbk (HD​TX) from a public to a private company, initiating delisting procedures. The company, listed since June 1990 at an IPO price of Rp11,750, will close with a final trading price of Rp120 per share.

title: PT Teknologi Karya Digital Nusa Tbk reports controlling shareholder PT Daya Kemilau Nusantara Investama reduces its stake by selling 69.8 million shares at Rp90 each
body: PT Daya Kemilau Nusantara Investama sold a total of 69.8 million TRON shares in two transactions on 24 September and 2 October 2025 at Rp90 per share, generating roughly Rp6.28 billion and lowering its ownership from 65.1% (1.92 billion shares) to 62.73% (1.85 billion shares). Following the sales, TRON shares fell 1.10% to Rp90, remaining flat since early September and down 31.3% year‑to‑date from the January price of Rp131.

title: PT BFI Finance Indonesia Tbk reports partial execution of its Rp500 bn share buyback, spending Rp57.33 bn on 73.6 m shares
body: The company bought 73.6 million shares at an average price of Rp773.1, using Rp57.33 bn of the allocated Rp500 bn program and leaving Rp443.52 bn unspent; the highest daily volume was 18.67 million shares on 1 Oct at Rp764.9 average. BFI’s stock traded around Rp750, down 1.32% month‑over‑month and 19.3% year‑to‑date.

title: Van Eck Associates Corporation Buy Shares of PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk
body: Van Eck Associates Corporation, an institution, bought 50,450,100 shares of PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk, increasing its holding from 7,085,821,900 to 7,136,272,000. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically oil-gas-coal sub-sector, at a price of 838. The purpose of the transaction is not specified.

title: Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc Sell Shares of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya
body: Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc, an institutional holder, sold 43124508 shares of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk, reducing its holding from 3740813211 to 3697688703 shares. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically alternative-energy. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

title: AMM Secures Coal Mining Contract at PT Dizamatra Powerindo in South Sumatra
body: AMM has been awarded a 100 million bank cubic meter coal mining contract at PT Dizamatra Powerindo, with operations slated to begin in early 2026 and a phased production target of 7 million tonnes per year to supply both export markets and PT Priamanaya Energy’s Keban Agung 2 × 135 MW power plant. The contract follows AMM’s recent nickel project agreements with PT Vale Indonesia Tbk and PT Kembar Emas Sultra, underscoring its expanding mining portfolio.

title: PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama Tbk. Announces Share Acquisitions of Two Mineral Mining Companies and Plans Convertible Bond Issue
body: PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama Tbk. (through its subsidiaries PT Adhi Prakarsa Raya and PT Sumber Cahaya Raya) will acquire 240 shares of PT Konutara Sejati and 276 shares of PT Karyatama Konawe Utara, with full payment due by 31 January 2026. The company will also issue mandatory convertible bonds to raise up to 35 billion new shares, financing the acquisitions valued at USD 68.7 million (USD 100.08 million for a 34.5 % stake in PT Karyatama Konawe Utara).

title: PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk Reports First‑Half 2025 Results with Strong Nickel Ore Production Growth Amid Smelter Maintenance
body: For the six months ended June 30, 2025, PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk recorded revenue of USD 628 million, a 32 % decline YoY, and EBITDA of USD 77 million, down 8 % YoY, while nickel ore production rose 78 % to 6.9 million wet metric tonnes and NPI cash costs fell below USD 10,000/tonne. The company attributes the results to expanded mining capacity, scheduled smelter maintenance that will reduce future costs, and ongoing construction of HPAL and feed‑preparation plants to support long‑term competitiveness.

title: Indonesia's Waste-to-Energy Push Spurs Surge in Related Stocks as Patriot Bond Demand Reaches Rp 51.8 Trillion
body: The government’s upcoming revision of Presidential Regulation No. 35/2018 on accelerating waste‑to‑energy plant development, together with the Patriot Bond financing instrument that has already attracted Rp 51.8 trillion, has driven shares of waste‑energy emitters such as PT TBS Energi Utama Tbk, PT Maharaksa Biru Energi Tbk and PT Multi Hanna Kreasindo Tbk to record YTD gains of 239.9 %, 109.8 % and 180 % respectively. Analysts highlight that despite high capital costs, regulatory complexity and limited domestic technology, the sector’s environmental urgency and potential for new entrants across energy, property and logistics could sustain bullish prospects, with a target price of Rp 1,600 per share for Toba.

title: Indonesian Stocks Poised for MSCI Index Inclusion in November 2025 Review
body: The MSCI Global Standard Index review scheduled for 5 November 2025 may add Indonesian issuers such as PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) and PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS), both meeting free‑float, market‑cap and liquidity thresholds, while PT Kalbe Farma Tbk faces potential exclusion and PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk requires a price lift to qualify. Analysts highlight BREN’s strong free‑float market cap of US$3.5 billion and daily trading volume of US$12.9 million, and recommend a buy for BREN with a target price of Rp 10,100–10,650, noting that inclusion could attract foreign capital and improve liquidity.

title: Four Indonesian Blue‑Chip Stocks to Pay Interim Dividends in October 2025
body: Indonesia’s Bursa Efek Indonesia announced that four blue‑chip issuers—ASII, AUTO, UNTR, and TLDN—will distribute interim dividends in October 2025, prompting analysts to recommend buying before the cum date to capture dividends and holding or selling after the ex‑date depending on risk tolerance. ASII, a LQ45 constituent, is highlighted as a short‑term swing trade with a target price of Rp 6,000 and a stop‑loss at Rp 5,775, while AUTO is suggested with a target of Rp 2,470 and UNTR is noted for its support at Rp 25,700 and resistance at Rp 27,500, and TLDN is noted for its support at Rp 670 and resistance at Rp 750.

title: PT Bumi Resources Tbk Completes 99.68% Acquisition of Australian Gold Miner Wolfram Limited, Pledging Full Ownership by November 2025
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk acquired 99.68% of Wolfram Limited shares on October 7, 2025, paying Rp 696,777,347,745 (AUD 6,399,670) and plans to purchase the remaining 0.32% for Rp 2,205,207,230 (AUD 200,335) by the end of October, totaling Rp 698,982,554,975 (AUD 63,500,005) for full ownership. The deal aligns with Bumi’s diversification strategy beyond coal mining and is expected to positively impact shareholder value.

title: SSIA Shares Surge on EV and Green Energy Investments, Outperforming Industry Peers in Q4 2025
body: PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk (SSIA) saw a 54.65% YTD rise in shares, driven by the opening of a Byd factory in Subang Smartpolitan, a Rp3 trillion investment from Djarum, and a 6.05% stake by Barito Group via PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk. Analysts rate SSIA as the leading industrial property developer, recommending a hold with a target price of Rp1,950 per share, while peers such as PT Puradelta Lestari Tbk and PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka Tbk lag behind due to weaker land sales pipelines and higher valuations.

title: Krakatau Steel Accelerates Debt Restructuring Repayment, Cutting Outstanding Debt by 12.5%
body: PT Krakatau Steel Tbk (Kras) has accelerated the repayment of its restructuring debt, settling Rp 248.24 billion (US$159.06 million) with an 80% principal reduction and eliminating interest and penalty debt of Rp 112.93 billion (US$18.75 million). The move trims the company’s restructuring debt to US$174.29 million, a 12.5% cut, and has spurred a 26.32% rise in Kras shares to Rp384 per share, reflecting improved liquidity and a healthier balance sheet.

title: Morgan Stanley Capital International to Release New Index on Nov 5, 2025, Highlighting Indonesian Stocks for MSCI Inclusion
body: The index release on November 5, 2025 (effective November 25) will consider several Indonesian companies—PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk, PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk, PT Kalbe Farma Tbk, and PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk—based on free‑float market cap, liquidity, and price thresholds; PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk’s free‑float adjusted market cap of US$3.5 billion and daily volume of US$12.9 million exceed MSCI minimums, while PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk’s price above Rp800 and daily volume of US$22.1 million also qualify, but PT Kalbe Farma Tbk’s free‑float market cap fell below US$1.2 billion and PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk would need a price rise to Rp1,700–Rp1,800 to become a strong candidate.

title: Krakatau Steel seeks USD500 million support from Andantara to strengthen working capital and boost EBITDA
body: Krakatau Steel is proposing a USD500 million support request from Andantara, with USD250 million to be supplied as a shareholder loan for operational needs such as slab, hot rolled coil, cold rolled coil, and pipe products, and an additional USD500 million to complete restructuring after bank agreements. The company projects the financing will lift EBITDA to USD31.9 million and aims to reinforce its HSM and CRM production lines through cost efficiency and market expansion.

title: Bumi Resources Completes 99.68% Acquisition of Wolfram Limited in Strategic Diversification Move
body: Bumi Resources paid Rp696.77 billion (AUD 63.29 million) for 99.68% of Wolfram Limited on 7 October 2025, with a final payment of Rp2.2 billion (AUD 200.335 k) scheduled for late October to reach 100% ownership, bringing the total transaction to Rp698.98 billion (AUD 63.5 million). The acquisition expands Bumi Resources’ portfolio into strategic and critical minerals, including gold and copper, and is expected to add value to shareholders without materially affecting current operations.

title: PT Pelangi Indah Canindo Tbk’s shares jump 159% in a month as investors eye a possible Chinese acquisition and a halal food‑tray opportunity
body: Shares of PT Pelangi Indah Canindo Tbk (pico) rose 159.85% in the past month, reaching a 24.48% intraday gain to 356 per share, after reporting a 5.02 bn rupiah net profit on 288.90 bn revenue and assets of 690.91 bn rupiah. Analysts note speculation of a Chinese stainless‑steel giant’s acquisition could make pico the only halal‑certified food‑tray producer in Indonesia, a scenario that may drive further valuation growth but carries backdoor‑listing risks.

title: PT Estika Tata Tiara TBK Plans to Expand into Dairy, Buffalo, Live Animal Trade, and Storage Operations
body: PT Estika Tata Tiara TBK, a producer and distributor of processed meat products, announced plans to add new business lines including dairy cattle and water buffalo breeding, wholesale live animal trade, milk and dairy product trade, and storage/warehousing, aiming to strengthen its supply chain and sustain national protein supply. The company will seek shareholder approval at an extraordinary general meeting on November 14, 2025.

title: PT Bumi Citra Investindo to divest 12.7 million shares of BCIP, reducing stake from 38.96% to 38.08%
body: PT Bumi Citra Investindo sold 12,700,000 BCIP shares at prices between Rp114 and Rp127, valuing the transaction at roughly Rp1.47 billion. The sale decreased its holding from 557,147,100 shares (38.96%) to 544,447,100 shares (38.08%) and was aimed at divestment of direct ownership.

title: Multi Artha Pratama reduces Pantai Indah Kapuk block, raising Rp100 billion at Rp15,000 per share
body: On Oct 8 2025, Multi Artha Pratama sold 6.7 million shares of Pantai Indah Kapuk at Rp15,000 each, a 2.43% discount to the closing price, raising Rp100 billion and diluting its block by about 0.04% to 15.01 billion shares (88.84%). The move aims to boost public ownership and improve liquidity.

title: JSI Expands Stake in Leyand Internasional to 51% as Part of Strategic Acquisition
body: JSI has increased its stake in Leyand Internasional to 51%, adding 513,750,900 shares for a 12.95% voting right, as part of a phased acquisition announced on 18 September 2025. The move supports JSI’s expansion into mining, logistics, energy, and silica sand production, with assets rising from below Rp100 billion to over Rp500 billion since 2022 and plans to launch a silica sand plant by early 2027.

title: Emtek Buys 256.98 Million Shares of Surya Citra Media, Increasing Stake to 67.55%
body: Emtek acquired 256,984,200 shares of Surya Citra Media at prices ranging from Rp338 to Rp421 per share, paying a total of Rp102.82 billion. The purchase increased Emtek’s holdings to 49.96 billion shares, or 67.55% of the company, up from 49.71 billion shares (67.20%).

title: PT Timah to Receive Six Smelters and Heavy Equipment from Attorney General’s Office, with Management Planned for 2026
body: PT Timah announced that it will receive six smelters and heavy equipment from the Attorney General’s office, with verification underway and plans to manage and produce at the sites beginning in 2026. The company emphasized adherence to good corporate governance, transparency, and compliance, and stated that ongoing protests have not disrupted its operations.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Flags 57 Issuers for Missing Interim Financial Reports, 52 Receive Rp150 Million Fines
body: Indonesia Stock Exchange recorded 57 issuers that had not filed interim financial statements as of June 30, 2025, with 52 receiving written warning III and a Rp150 million fine, one (urban jakarta) receiving warning II and a Rp50 million fine, and four (wahana, remala, radana, sari boga) receiving warning I. The 52 issuers subject to warning III and the Rp150 million fine include tri banyan tirta, armidian karyatama, berkah beton sadaya, binakarya jaya abadi, borneo olah sarana sukses, bakrie telecom, cahaya bintang medan, cowell development, capri nusa satu properti, dewata freightinternational, jaya bersama indo, eterindo wahanatama, aksara global development, golden plantation, hk metals utama, hotel mandarine regency, saraswati griya lestari, indo pureco pratama, sky energy indonesia, darmi bersaudara, kertas basuki rachmat indonesia, koka indonesia, eureka prima jakarta, limas indonesia makmur, marga abhinaya abadi, multi agro gemilang plantation, mitra komunikasi nusantara, mitra pemuda, sinergi megah internusa, polaris investama, panca mitra multiperdana, pollux properties indonesia, pool advista indonesia, djasa ubersakti, trinitan metals minerals, rimo international lestari, sejahtera bintang abadi textile, siwani makmur, northcliff citranusa indonesia, wilton makmur indonesia, sri rejeki isman, sugih energy, sriwahana adityakarta, tianrong chemicals, indosterling, omni inovasi indonesia, totalindo eka persada, sunindo adipersada, trada alam minera, triwira insanlestari, nusantara inti corpora, dan dosni roha.

title: Irsyad Hanif sells 11 million shares of PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk., reducing stake from 17.93% to 16.91%
body: Irsyad Hanif, a >5% shareholder of PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk., sold 11,000,000 shares at about Rp392 each, totaling Rp4.31 billion, cutting his ownership from 17.93% to 16.91%. The shares traded through CP broker KB Valbury Sekuritas and were recorded by the Central Securities Depository, while the company has not yet issued a statement on the sale.

title: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk to Raise Rp16.7 Trillion via Rights Issue for Capital Strengthening and Expansion
body: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PANI) plans to issue up to 1.21 billion new shares at a nominal value of Rp100 each, potentially raising Rp16.7 trillion to strengthen its capital base and increase equity in subsidiaries such as PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk, PT Agung Sedayu, PT Tunas Mekar Jaya, PT Cahaya Inti Sentosa, PT Karunia Utama Selaras, and PT Panorama Eka Tunggal. The rights issue will be presented at an extraordinary general meeting on October 9, 2025 and will proceed after regulatory approvals.

title: pt asuransi tugu pratama indonesia tbk's 2025 outlook remains solid amid strong investment income and insurance renewal momentum
body: In the first semester of 2025, pt asuransi tugu pratama indonesia tbk reported a net profit of Rp357.5 billion, driven by Rp316.7 billion in investment income that grew 22.9% YoY from a Rp11.4 trillion asset base. Analysts project the company could reach a net profit of Rp700 billion for the full year, supported by insurance renewal momentum and the new psak 117 standard, while its price-to-book ratio of 0.36x suggests a potential upside.

title: Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko Boosts Direct Stake in LOPI to 0.3543% Amid Share Price Gains
body: Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko, director of PT Logisticsplus International Tbk., increased his direct stake in LOPI to 0.3543% by purchasing 2.22 million shares on 7 Oct 2025, while LOPI shares rose 2.3% to Rp89 amid a 53.4% monthly gain. Earlier, 735.15 million shares were transferred to PT Sentra Amanah Ventura at Rp37 on 30 Jun 2025 to support a holding structure.

title: PT Wahana Interfood Nusantara Tbk (Coco) Reports 153.9% Increase in Net Loss for First Half 2025
body: For the first half of 2025, PT Wahana Interfood Nusantara Tbk (Coco) posted a net loss of Rp82.53 billion, up 153.9% from Rp32.48 billion in the same period last year, driven by a 8.9% drop in net sales to Rp73.16 billion and a sharp rise in operating expenses. Total assets fell 13.7% to Rp379.60 billion while equity collapsed 83.1% to Rp16.58 billion, though the stock rallied 13.5% to Rp630 on the day of reporting.

title: Bumi Resources reports July 2026 exploration activities across three mines, spending Rp2.1 million per area
body: Bumi Resources, through its subsidiary PT Kaltim Prima Coal, reported July 2026 exploration at Pit Inul Lignite, Pit Pedayak West, and Pit South Pinang Ext, completing 33 open‑hole and 11 core holes at Inul, 36 open‑hole and 20 core at Pedayak West, and 42 open‑hole and 66 core at South Pinang Ext, with additional drilling planned. The company’s shares fell 1.39% to Rp142 on the day, after a 31.4% monthly rise from Rp108 on 8 September 2025, a 77.5% six‑month gain from Rp80 on 8 April 2025, and a 15.5% yearly increase from Rp123 on 2 January 2025.

title: PT Green Power Group Tbk Announces Resignation Of Independent Commissioner Dedy Bernandus Simanjuntak
body: The Company Received Dedy Bernandus Simanjuntak's Resignation Letter On 8 October 2025, Which Will Be Submitted For Approval At The Upcoming Shareholders' Meeting. Management Stated The Departure Will Not Affect PT Green Power Group Tbk's Operations, Legal Standing, Financial Condition, Or Business Continuity, And Noted His Concurrent Role As Legal Manager At Hengsheng New Energy Material.

title: Green Era Energy Pte Ltd Sells 88.07 Million Barito Renewables Energy Shares At A Discount, Raising Rp827.85 Billion
body: On 6 October 2025, Green Era Energy Pte Ltd Disposed Of 88.07 Million Barito Renewables Energy Shares At Rp9,400 Per Share, About 5.76% Below The Closing Price Of Rp9,975, Generating Proceeds Of Roughly Rp827.85 Billion. The Transaction Reduced Its Stake To 22.92711% (30.67 Billion Shares) From 22.99294% (30.76 Billion Shares) To Increase Free Float And Market Liquidity, According To Corporate Secretary Tukas Agus Sandy Widyanto.

title: Cisarua Mountain Dairy Alias Cimory Announces Rp793.46 Billion Interim Dividend For H1 2025
body: Cimory Will Pay An Interim Dividend Of Rp793.46 Billion, Representing 79.79% Of Its H1 2025 Net Profit Of Rp993.87 Billion, At A Rate Of Rp100 Per Share. The Dividend Is Scheduled For Record On 21 Oct 2025 With Payment On 30 Oct 2025, While The Company Reports Retained Earnings Of Rp2.73 Trillion And Total Equity Of Rp6.55 Trillion.

title: PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk Reviews Financing Alternatives Without Material Corporate Action, While Its Shares Show Strong Recent Gains And A Slight Pullback
body: Director Adrian Hartadi Told The Indonesia Stock Exchange That PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk Is Continuously Evaluating Financing And Business Development Options, Including Possible Debt Issuance, But No Material Corporate Action Has Been Decided Or Disclosed. The Company's Shares Have Surged Over 680% Year‑To‑Date, Hitting The Daily Upper Limit Of Rp9,000 Before Falling 5.6% To Rp8,500.

title: Levoca Enterprise Ltd Divests 14.68 Billion Shares Of Bakrie & Brothers, Reducing Its Stake To 7.62%
body: On October 8 2025, Levoca Enterprise Ltd Sold 14.679337 Billion Shares Of Bakrie & Brothers Through Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia And Uob Kay Hian Sekuritas In A Silent Transaction, Valued At Roughly Rp704.6 Billion Based On A Closing Price Of Rp48. The Sale Lowered Levoca’s Holding To 13.21 Billion Shares (7.62% Of Total), While Uob Kay Hian Private Limited Acquired The Divested Shares, Now Holding 14.68 Billion Shares (8.47%).

title: PT Damai Sejahtera Abadi Tbk Reports Strong 2025 Earnings Growth And Insider Buying, Lifting Ufo Elektronika Shares
body: Ufo Elektronika's Stock Surged About 102% To Rp354 As The Company Posted 2024 Revenue Of Rp1.01 Trillion And Net Profit Of Rp18.9 Billion, And H1 2025 Revenue Of Rp555 Billion With A 16% Yoy Profit Increase To Rp7.8 Billion, While Margins Rose To 2.5% After Cost‑Efficiency Measures. Insider Purchases By Commissioner Ir. Pudji Harianto (66,500 Shares) And Director Henry Budiono (50,000 Shares) And Rumors Of Strategic Interest From East Asian Investors Are Seen As Additional Catalysts For A Potential Mid‑Term Rerating.

title: PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. Exits Special Monitoring Board After Liquidity Surge
body: Effective Friday, PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. Was Transferred From The Special Monitoring Board To The Development Board As Its Share Price Rose From Rp7 To Rp178, A 2,125% Year‑To‑Date Gain And About 2,400% Increase Over Three Months. The Move Reflects The Stock No Longer Meeting The Low‑Liquidity Criteria Previously Required For The Special Monitoring Board.

title: PT Borneo Olah Sarana Sukses Tbk Pauses Central Block Exploration Pending Strategic Partner Investment And Remains Under Special Monitoring
body: The Company Reported That Exploration In The Central Block Was Not Continued In July 2025, Citing Sufficient Existing Data And A Focus On Monitoring Coal Quality And Quantity, With Further Exploration To Resume After Additional Investment From A Strategic Partner. It Also Noted That PT Borneo Olah Sarana Sukses Tbk Has Not Filed Its Unaudited Interim Financial Statements For The Period Ending 30 June 2025, Is Under Special Monitoring, And Its Last Traded Price Was Rp50 Per Share.

title: PT Samudera Indonesia Tbk Ceo Bani Maulana Mulia Increases Shareholding With Oct. 7 Purchase
body: On Oct 7 2025, Bani Maulana Mulia Bought 1,281,000 PT Samudera Indonesia Tbk Shares At Rp304 Each, Raising His Stake To 55.07 Million Shares (0.336%). The Purchase Follows A Sep 9 Acquisition Of 606,100 Shares At Rp328, And Smdr Shares Rose 1.33% To Rp304 After The Latest Transaction.

title: Commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara Reduces Stake In PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk Through October Share Sales
body: Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara Sold A Total Of 100,000 Shares Of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk On 3 And 8 October 2025 At Rp995 And Rp1,025 Per Share, Following Earlier Sales Of 100,000 Shares On 26 And 29 September 2025 At Rp990 And Rp1,005. After The Transactions His Holding Fell To 70 Million Shares (1.488%), And Drma’s Share Price Slipped 0.5% To Rp995, Down 5 Points On The Day.

title: Indonesia’s Palm Oil Sector Faces EU Deforestation‑Free Regulation Compliance Amid Geolocation Data Challenges
body: Indonesia’s palm oil industry must provide precise geolocation data to meet the EU’s deforestation‑free regulation, prompting government initiatives such as the national sustainable commodity dashboard and expanded ISPO certification for smallholders, while the European Commission has postponed enforcement to the end of 2026. The sector’s ability to comply hinges on improved data accuracy, legal documentation, and cross‑ministerial coordination to maintain its global market position.

title: Petrosea Secures $26.2 Million EPC Contract for Reko Diq Gold-Copper Project in Pakistan
body: Indonesian engineering‑mining firm Petrosea, through its wholly‑owned subsidiary Petrosea Solutions Pakistan, has signed an initial implementation agreement with Reko Diq Mining Company to provide EPC services for the world’s largest gold‑copper mine in Balochistan, Pakistan, under a USD 26.2 million contract expected to take about ten months. The deal marks Petrosea’s first engineering, procurement and construction venture outside Indonesia and signals its strategy to diversify and grow sustainably beyond its home market.

title: PT Stargate Pacific Resources Opens Prequalification Invitation for Nickel Mining Service Partners in North Konawe
body: PT Stargate Pacific Resources has announced a 20‑day prequalification invitation for local and national nickel mining service companies to support its nickel mine in North Konawe, Indonesia. Companies must hold a valid mining services license, demonstrate a solid track record in the region, possess adequate heavy equipment and personnel, and meet compliance obligations; interested parties should submit a stamped letter of interest and company profile to the specified email addresses.

title: Baru Gold Corp. Advances Production Readiness at Sangihe Gold Project with Local Electrowinning Plant
body: Baru Gold Corp. and its subsidiary PT. Tambang Mas Sangihe have completed a competitive bid for a modern electrowinning elution column plant, which will be manufactured locally in Indonesia and can be operational within months, supporting an initial capacity of 1,500 ounces per month that can be doubled. The company’s COO Sri Darmawan and CEO Terrence Filbert emphasize rapid implementation and capital conservation while awaiting final approvals, positioning Baru to commence gold production without delay.

title: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium Targets Own Bauxite Mine by 2030 Amid Expansion of National Aluminium Capacity
body: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium is in due diligence to acquire a bauxite mine from PT Aneka Tambang Tbk in West Kalimantan, aiming to own its own bauxite source by 2030, while the state mining holding Mind ID plans to boost national aluminium production from 275 ktpa to 900 ktpa by 2029 with additional alumina capacity and a new smelter. The company is also signing offtake agreements with Vitol and partnering with Panasonic to develop Indonesia’s low‑carbon aluminium downstream industry, supporting the country’s renewable energy and job‑creation goals.

title: Indonesia’s Financial Services Authority Orders Blocking of 27,395 Bank Accounts to Combat Online Gambling
body: The Financial Services Authority, led by Chief Executive Banking Supervision Dian Ediana Rae, has instructed banks to block 27,395 accounts linked to online gambling, up from 25,912 the previous month. Despite the crackdown, the national banking sector remains solid, with bank credit growing 7.56% YoY, a 2.28% gross NPL rate, and a capital adequacy ratio of 26.03%.

title: Indonesia Halts Raw Coconut Exports to Promote Downstream Processing and Boost Value
body: Indonesia’s Minister of Agriculture, Andi Amran Sulaiman, announced a halt on raw tall coconut exports and a downstreaming initiative that could raise the value of coconut products up to 100 times, potentially generating up to Rp2.4 trillion in foreign exchange. The plan also includes free distribution of seedlings for cocoa, coffee, tall coconut, cashew, and nutmeg across 800,000 hectares, aiming to create 1.6 million jobs within two years.

title: Indonesia Targets Export Growth Through New Trade Deals, Including CPTPP and EU Agreement
body: Indonesia’s Minister of Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said the country is pursuing trade agreements such as the CPTPP and a recently finalized Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with the EU to lift exports, with the EU deal potentially boosting Indonesian exports 2.5 times and raising total trade to $60 billion. He highlighted that PT Toyota Motor Manufacturing Indonesia and PT TMmin have exported millions of vehicles worldwide, and that Indonesia’s export forecast is expected to rise over 50% in the next three to four years.

title: Indonesia Launches B50 Biodiesel Road Test Ahead of 2026 Full Implementation
body: Indonesia has begun road testing its B50 biodiesel blend—50% crude palm oil and 50% fossil diesel—over the next six months, with plans to secure sufficient crude palm oil supply through a national steering committee, while the government weighs whether to adopt B45 or B50 based on projected fatty acid methyl ester availability. The B40 program has already saved Indonesia an estimated $9.3 billion in foreign exchange in 2025.

title: Indonesia and the United States are finalizing a reciprocal tariff agreement that includes $15 billion in U.S. energy purchases, $4.5 billion in agricultural goods, and 50 new Boeing aircraft
body: The agreement, which will exempt commodities such as palm oil, cocoa, and chocolate from tariffs, follows a reduction of the U.S. import tariff on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19% after negotiations. Indonesia also committed to buying $15 billion of U.S. energy products, $4.5 billion of agricultural goods, and 50 Boeing 777 aircraft, marking a significant step in strengthening trade ties amid global economic uncertainty.

title: Indonesia Nears Deal to Raise PT Freeport Indonesia Stake to 63%
body: Indonesia's Investment Downstream Minister Rosan Perkasa Roeslani said negotiations have reached a key milestone to increase the government's ownership of PT Freeport Indonesia from 51% to 63% through a 12% share divestment by US‑based Freeport‑McMoRan, pending final agreement on detailed terms. Freeport officials indicated the divestment has not yet been finalized, and the additional stake is required to extend the mine's special permit set to expire in 2041.

title: Bapanas Confirms Quality and Safety of Government Rice Reserves Managed by Bulog
body: Bapanas head Arief Prasetyo Adi said all rice distributed by state logistics agency Bulog undergoes strict quality assurance, including inspections, testing, sanitation and fumigation. As of October 6, Bulog held 3.89 million tons of rice—3.83 million tons of CBP reserves and 56,600 tons of commercial rice—sourced from 3.09 million tons of domestic procurement, with 870,800 tons already allocated to food assistance programs.

title: Sriwijaya Capital rumored to prepare capital injection into PT Red Planet Indonesia amid strong stock rally and ongoing losses
body: Sriwijaya Capital, owned by Arsjad Rasjid, is reportedly planning a capital injection into PT Red Planet Indonesia Tbk as part of its domestic portfolio expansion, following recent partnerships with Danantara and Bluefive Capital. Red Planet, which posted a net loss in H1‑2025, has seen its shares rise 38.9% in the past month and over 400% year‑to‑date, prompting a temporary trading halt, though neither party has confirmed the injection.

title: Indonesia to Make Halal Certification Mandatory Across Industries by 2026, Strengthening National Identity and Global Competitiveness
body: Indonesia’s Secretary General of the Halal Product Assurance Agency, Muhammad Aqil Irham, announced that halal certification will become mandatory for all industries by October 2026 under Law No. 33/2014 and Government Regulation No. 42/2024, positioning halal as a core characteristic of Indonesian production. The move aims to boost consumer confidence, protect quality, and enhance Indonesia’s standing in the global halal value chain.

title: Indonesia Launches Multi‑Scheme Carbon Value Framework to Strengthen Climate Finance and Meet NDC Targets
body: Indonesia has introduced a multi‑scheme carbon economic value framework and submitted its first biennial transparency report, outlining $282 billion in climate finance needs—$281.18 billion for mitigation and $816.52 million for adaptation—while securing funding through REDD+ and Norway’s result‑based contribution. The new framework, backed by a mutual recognition agreement covering 54 technology‑based and 58 nature‑based methodologies, aims to cut domestic greenhouse‑gas emissions by 31.89 % and attract 43.2 % global financial support.

title: Indonesia's Ministry of Agriculture and BSSN Sign Memorandum to Strengthen Cybersecurity for Digital Agriculture
body: The Ministry of Agriculture and the National Cyber and Encryption Agency (BSSN) signed a memorandum of understanding to enhance cybersecurity across digital agriculture systems, including protection of electronic transactions, communication security, and capacity building. The collaboration aims to secure data, improve cyber literacy, and support Indonesia's food self‑sufficiency vision under President Prabowo Subianto.

title: Indonesian Minister Calls for Cooperative Universities and Banks to Strengthen Economy
body: During the inauguration of the cooperative information center management agency (Dekopin), Minister Ferry Juliantono urged the creation of cooperative universities and banks to boost the sector’s role in the national economy, citing the Indonesian Cooperative Management Institute University Sumedang as a model. He also proposed converting the ministry’s revolving fund management agency into a dedicated bank for cooperatives and praised Dekopin’s BP‑PIP initiative for spreading cooperative narratives.

title: Indonesia Grants Cooperatives First Authority to Manage Mining Areas, Covering 2,500 Hectares
body: Minister of Cooperatives Ferry Juliantono announced that, under Regulation 39/2025, cooperatives can now obtain mining permits and manage up to 2,500 hectares of mining land, marking a historic shift toward cooperative participation in the sector. The government pledges support to help cooperatives compete with large corporations and foster local economic benefits.

title: PEFINDO Reaffirms Ratings for State‑Owned Constructor Waskita Karya Amid Weak Financial Profile
body: PEFINDO reaffirmed Waskita Karya's corporate rating and its sustainable bond ratings (III stage IV with IDD, III stage II, III stage III, IV stage I with IDB, III and IV IDAAA, and sukuk mudharabah I IDAAA), noting the company has not obtained restructuring approval from bondholders and its financial profile remains very weak. The agency said an upgrade is possible once the restructuring program is completed and the firm demonstrates sustainable debt‑servicing capacity; as of 30 June 2025, the Indonesian government via danatara asset management holds 75.35 % of the shares, with the public holding the remainder.

title: Sarkoro Handajani increases stake in Maxindo Karya Anugerah to 0.34% after buying 16.7 million shares at a discount
body: On October 6, 2025, Sarkoro Handajani purchased 16,705,450 shares of Maxindo Karya Anugerah at Rp50 per share, a 12.28% discount to the closing price of Rp57, costing about Rp835.27 million. The acquisition raised its holding to 32.32 million shares, representing 0.34% of the company, up from 0.16% before the transaction.

title: Vale Indonesia allocates $1.7 million to Q3 2025 exploration across multiple Sulawesi blocks
body: Vale Indonesia spent a total of USD 1.7 million on exploration activities in July, August and September 2025, with expenditures of USD 706.98 k, USD 512.71 k and USD 512.71 k respectively. The work, conducted with third‑party partners, targets the Sorowako, Sorowako Outer, Bahodopi and Pomalaa blocks using HQ‑3 core drilling and electrical resistivity tomography, with resource and reserve calculations underway.

title: SBI Holdings, Inc acquires 5.63% stake in Bank Amar Indonesia, becoming third-largest institutional shareholder
body: SBI Holdings, Inc has taken a 5.63% share in Bank Amar Indonesia, making it the third-largest institutional shareholder after tolarem pte.ltd (75.25%) and pt jagat raya imajinasi (6.59%). The transaction, effective 9 October 2025, also saw investree exit its holdings, and both parties expressed intent to collaborate on expanding retail and UMKM banking services.

title: Repower Asia outlines organic and non‑organic growth strategies while targeting low‑income housing and leveraging extended VAT benefits through 2026
body: Repower Asia plans to boost organic growth by optimizing sales of existing projects such as Botanical Puri Asri Depok and launching new housing developments in Pasar Minggu and Pondok Cabe, as well as entering the low‑income segment through an operational partnership with Riscon Group. Concurrently, the company will pursue non‑organic growth by enhancing recurring income, creating synergies across telecom, digital, and healthcare sectors, and exploiting the government‑extended VAT benefit to sustain its positive first‑half 2025 performance.

title: PT Multi Artha Pratama Sells 178.23 Million Shares Of PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk. To Increase Free Float, Cutting Its Ownership To 87.78%
body: On The Same Day, PT Multi Artha Pratama Sold 178.23 Million PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk. Shares At An Average Price Of Rp14,075, Valuing The Transaction At About Rp2.5 Trillion And Lowering Its Direct Holding From 88.84% To 87.78% Of The Outstanding Shares. Following The Announcement, PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk. Shares Fell Roughly 975 Points, Or 6.34%, To Rp14,400.

title: PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama Sells About 250 Million Shares Of PT Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Tbk. In Two Transactions, Cutting Its Stake To 30.72%
body: On 1 October 2025, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama Sold 166,666,700 Shares Of Nsss At Rp480 Each (≈Rp80 Billion), And On 3 October 2025 It Sold Another 83,420,100 Shares At Rp490 Each (≈Rp40.87 Billion), Totaling Roughly Rp121.3 Billion. The Sales Reduced Its Holding To 7.31 Billion Shares (30.72%), While Nsss’s Share Price Slipped 2.61% To Rp560 After Recent Gains Of 27.7% Month‑To‑Date, 125.4% Over Six Months, And 95.8% Year‑To‑Date.

title: Indonesia Ministry Supports Automotive Msme Players To Enter Global Markets
body: The Ministry Of Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises, Led By Minister Maman Abdurrahman, Announced At The Indonesia Modification & Lifestyle Expo 2025 That It Will Provide Financing, Export Market Development, Training, And Capital Market Access To Help Automotive Modification Businesses Such As Rims And Body Kits Expand Globally. The Ministry Highlighted The Strategic Role Of Msmes In The National Automotive Supply Chain And Pledged Support To Improve Business Capacity And Competitiveness.

title: Indonesia Confirms Shrimp Exports To U.S. Are Safe From Cesium‑137 Contamination
body: Indonesia’s Minister Of Maritime Affairs And Fisheries, Sakti Wahyu Trenggono, Confirmed That Indonesian Shrimp Exports To The United States Are Free Of Cesium‑137 Contamination And That The Ministry Is Working With The Us Food Drug Administration To Secure A Safety Certification Memorandum. The Government’s Task Force Has Also Intensified Coordination Across Ministries And Conducted Field Inspections Of Clove Products To Address Contamination Concerns, With No Expected Impact On Future U.S. Tariff Negotiations.

title: Indonesia'S Cooperatives Minister Invites Kadin Indonesia To Partner With Red White Village Co‑Ops, Targeting Mining And Rural Development
body: Minister Ferry Juliantono Announced That The Ministry Of Cooperatives And Smes Will Partner With Kadin Indonesia To Support Red White Village Cooperatives, Especially In Mining And Rural Areas, Following Regulation No. 39/2025 That Allows Cooperatives To Manage Up To 2,500 Hectares Of Mineral Mines. Kadin Indonesia’s Chairman Anindya Bakrie Confirmed Readiness To Collaborate, Citing Existing Market Initiatives And Trade Missions.

title: Indonesia Plans $5.5 Billion Waste‑To‑Energy Investment Across 33 Cities
body: Indonesia’s State‑Backed Agency, Danantara Indonesia, Announced A 91 Trillion Idr ($5.5 Billion) Waste‑To‑Energy Program Targeting 33 Cities, With Each Facility Expected To Process About 1,000 Tons Of Waste Daily. The Initiative, Showcased At The Indonesia International Sustainability Forum 2025, Has Attracted 192 Company Registrations And Aims To Launch Pilot Sites In 10 Cities By Early November 2025.

title: Indonesia Targets Upgrading 65 Fishing Villages By End-2025 Under Red White Program
body: Indonesia’s Marine Affairs And Fisheries Ministry Announced That 65 Fishing Villages Across The Country Will Be Upgraded By December 2025 Or January 2026 Under The Red White Fishing Villages Program, With Rp1.34 Trillion Allocated For Infrastructure Such As Docks, Roads, And Cold Storage.
