The Initiative, Part Of President Prabowo Subianto’s 2029 Plan To Upgrade 1,100 Villages, Also Earmarks Additional Funding For 250 Sites In The 2026 State Budget.

title: Jakarta Lrt Expansion To Connect Dukuh Atas, Kota Tua, And North Jakarta
body: Jakarta Provincial Government Plans To Extend The Lrt Network To New Hubs Including Dukuh Atas, Kota Tua, Glodok, And Pasar Baru, With Further Extensions Toward Northern Areas Such As Tanjung Priok, Jakarta International Stadium, Ancol, And Pantai Indah Kapuk 2. The Project Aims To Create A Comprehensive Multi‑Modal Hub Integrating Lrt, Mrt, And Transjakarta Services, With Two Route Options—North Jakarta Or Manggarai‑Dukuh Atas—Under Consideration For Finalization.

title: Indonesia To Expand Village Cooperative Outlets Nationwide Starting October 15
body: The Indonesian Government Will Begin Building Additional Outlets And Warehouses For Its 80,000 Village Cooperatives Under The Red White Program On October 15, With The Finance Ministry Pledging State Budget Funding And Danantara Investment Management Agency Coordinating Infrastructure Development. As Of Now, About 11,225 Kdmps Have At Least One Operational Outlet, Totaling Nearly 16,000 Active Outlets.

title: Indonesia'S Finance Minister Orders Crackdown On Stock Market Manipulators
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Has Directed The Indonesia Stock Exchange And Financial Services Authority To Take Firm Action Against Individuals Engaged In Pump‑And‑Dump Schemes, Aiming To Clean Up The Market Within A Year And Restore Confidence Among Younger Investors. He Also Said That Tax Incentives Would Only Be Granted Once The Authorities Effectively Curb Manipulative Practices That Harm Small Investors.

title: Indonesia’S Creative Economy Ministry Highlights Cybersecurity’S Role Ahead Of National Cybersecurity Connect 2025
body: Minister Teuku Riefky Harsya Of The Ministry Of Creative Economy Underscored The Importance Of Cybersecurity For Accelerating The Creative Economy And Announced Support For National Cybersecurity Connect 2025, Scheduled For October 29‑30 In Jakarta. The Ministry Cited A Projected Investment Of Rp15.49 Trillion (Us$934.2 Million) In The Digital App Sector For 2025, Emphasizing The Need To Balance Rapid Economic Growth With Cyber Resilience.

title: Indonesia Records 9.6 Million Halal‑Certified Products, Aims To Become Global Halal Hub
body: The Halal Product Assurance Agency Bpjph Announced That 9.6 Million Products In Indonesia Have Been Certified Halal, Reflecting Growing Awareness And Commitment Among Businesses. The Government Plans To Make Halal Certification Mandatory For All Products By October 2026 And Is Expanding Digital Integration And International Cooperation To Position Indonesia As A Global Halal Hub.

title: Indonesia Aims To Shorten Food Supply Chain To Three Stages Via Village Cooperatives
body: Indonesia’s Agriculture Minister Andi Amran Sulaiman Announced That The Government’s Red‑And‑White Village Cooperative Program Will Cut The Food Supply Chain From Eight To Three Stages—Farmers, Cooperatives, And Consumers—Intending To Boost Farmer Welfare And Consumer Purchasing Power. The Plan Includes Government Provision Of Fertilizers, Seeds, Equipment, And Production Facilities, And A Partnership With PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara To Build Cooperative Facilities As Part Of A Goal To Establish 80,000 Village Cooperatives Nationwide.

title: P?? Imah Allocates Rp20.31 Billion For Tin Exploration In Q3 2025
body: P?? Imah Will Use Rp20.31 Billion—Rp19.61 Billion For Operating Costs And Rp702.99 Million For Investment—To Conduct Tin Exploration Activities In The Third Quarter Of 2025, Including Offshore Drilling With Six Drilling Vessels And Three Pontoon Units Totaling 15,058.55 Meters, And Onshore Surveys And Drilling Totaling 4,615 Meters.

title: Indonesia Delays PT Freeport Indonesia Mine Restart Pending Safety Audit After Landslide
body: Indonesia’s Minister Of Energy And Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, Announced That PT Freeport Indonesia Will Not Resume Production At The Grasberg Mine Until A Comprehensive Audit Of Its Underground Operations Is Completed, Following A Wet Ore Landslide That Killed Seven Workers On September 8, 2025. The Audit Will Assess Structural Integrity And Potential Landslide Risks, And Freeport Must Implement Mitigation Measures Once Results Are Available.

title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi To Acquire 90% Of Gdi Shares For 680 Mw Power Plant Development
body: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi, Through Its Subsidiary PT Volta Daya Energi Indonesia, Has Signed A Share Purchase Agreement To Acquire 90% Of Gdi Shares, Buying 9,000 Shares, To Support The Development Of A 680 Mw Power Plant In Feni Haltim Industrial Park, Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara, With An Estimated Value Of Usd 600 Million (Rp 10 Trillion) And A 24‑Month Construction Timeline. The Move Aligns With Petrindo’s Long‑Term Strategy To Bolster The Battery Electric Vehicle Ecosystem And Enhance Value In Indonesia’s Mining And Energy Sectors.

title: PT Pimsf Announces Plan To Acquire 45.45% Of Gpso Shares From Karnadi Margaka, Becoming New Controlling Stakeholder
body: PT Pimsf, Part Of The Tjokro Group, Has Formally Announced Its Intention To Acquire Approximately 45.45% Of Gpso Shares Held By Karnadi Margaka, Which Would Make It The New Controlling Shareholder After The Transaction Completes. The Acquisition, Disclosed To The Financial Services Authority, Indonesia Stock Exchange, And Gpso’s Board On October 10, 2025, Will Trigger A Mandatory Tender Offer To All Public Gpso Shareholders Under Ojk Regulation No. 9/Pojk.04/2018.

title: PT Sepatu Bata Tbk Shuts Footwear Production After Purwakarta Plant Closure, 233 Workers Unemployed
body: The Extraordinary General Meeting On 25 September 2025 Voted To Delete The Footwear Manufacturing Activity From The Company’s Articles Of Association Following The 2024 Closure Of The Purwakarta Plant, Leaving 233 Employees Without Jobs. Financially, PT Sepatu Bata Tbk Reported A 2023 Loss Of Rp190.29 Billion (Up 79.65 % From 2022) And A March‑2025 Loss Of Rp19.64 Billion (Up 41.75 % Yoy), While Revenue Fell 16.34 % To Rp94.92 Billion.

title: Raymond Increases Stake In PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk. To 2.5 Million Shares After Buying 100,000 Shares On Oct 7, 2025
body: Raymond, A Director Of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk., Purchased 100,000 Shares (1,000 Lots) Of The Company On 7 October 2025 At Rp7.925 Per Share, Valuing The Transaction At About Rp792.5 Million And Raising His Holding To 2.5 Million Shares (0.0001 % Of Mini Tpia). The Transaction Was Described As An Investment In Direct Share Ownership, And Tpia Shares Closed The Following Friday Up 375 Points (4.85%) At Rp8,100.

title: PT Pimsf Pulogadung To Acquire 45.45% Of PT Geoprima Solusi Tbk, Driving Gpso Share Surge
body: PT Pimsf Pulogadung, Part Of Tjokro Group, Announced Plans To Acquire About 45.45% Of PT Geoprima Solusi Tbk From Controlling Shareholder Karnadi Margaka, Which Will Make Pimsf The New Controlling Shareholder And Trigger A Mandatory Tender Offer. The Announcement Lifted Gpso Shares To The Daily Upper Limit At Rp1,050, Up 9.95% (95 Points), And The Stock Has Risen 269.7% In One Month And 224.7% In Six Months.

title: Ludijanto Setijo Divests 156.56 Million Shares Of PT Indo Acidatama Tbk And 143.06 Million Shares Of Srsn, Cutting His Srsn Stake To 365.8 Million Shares
body: Controlling Shareholder Ludijanto Setijo Sold 156.56 Million Shares Of PT Indo Acidatama Tbk For About Rp12.25 Billion And 143.06 Million Shares Of Srsn At Rp77–Rp80 Per Share For About Rp11.2 Billion, Aiming To Divest His Direct Holdings. After The Sales, His Srsn Ownership Fell From 522.39 Million To 365.8 Million Shares, While The Stock Rose 4.17% To Rp75 On Friday, Marking A 11.9% Monthly Gain From Rp67 And A 50% Year‑To‑Date Rise From Rp50.

title: Dssa Reports October 2025 Exploration Activities In Coal And Geothermal Sectors
body: Dssa, Through Its Subsidiaries PT Manggala Alam Lestari, PT Daya Mas Cisolok Geothermal, And PT Daya Mas Nage Geothermal, Reported October 2025 Exploration Activities That Included 4 Primary And 7 Infill Drilling Points Covering 405,100 M² At A Cost Of Rp662,53 Juta, 56 Geotechnical Samples, And Ongoing Verification Of Coal Reserves. The Geothermal Studies Covered 622,8 Million M² And 686,9 Million M² At Costs Of Rp6,38 Miliar And Rp6,77 Miliar, Respectively, And Will Feed Into A Final Exploration Report For Q4 2025, Underscoring Dssa’s Commitment To An Integrated Energy Portfolio.

title: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk. Allocates Rp9.84 Billion For October 2025 Exploration In Pani Gold Project
body: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk. Announced That Its Subsidiaries PT Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining And PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera Allocated Rp9.84 Billion For Exploration Activities In The Pani Gold Project During October 2025, With The Work To Be Reported In The Q3 2025 Exploration Report. The Pani Project Covers 14,670 Ha, Contains 292.4 Million Tonnes Of Ore With 7 Million Troy Ounces Of Gold, And Is Projected To Produce A Peak Of 500 K Troy Ounces Per Year By 2033 With A Mine Life To 2041.

title: Hillcon Equity Management Reduces Stake In PT Hillcon Tbk By Selling 250 Million Shares For Rp65 Billion
body: Hillcon Equity Management Sold 250 Million Shares Of PT Hillcon Tbk On 8 Oct 2025 At Rp260 Each, Reducing Its Holding To 49.67% And Bringing The Transaction Value To Rp65 Billion. The Sale Follows A Prior 16.2 Million‑Share Sale On 25 Sep 2025, And Hill Shares Slipped 1% To Rp198 On The Day.

title: Yentoro Adds 100,000 Shares To PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk., Raising Ownership To 4.08%
body: Yentoro, Director Of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk., Purchased 100,000 Jast Shares At Rp89 Each On 7 October 2025, Increasing His Stake To 44.12 Million Shares (4.08 %). The Transaction Was Recorded As A Direct Ownership Investment, And Jast Shares Remained Flat At Rp89 Per Share.

title: PT Repower Asia Indonesia Tbk Holds Virtual Disclosure To Address Idx Request And Highlight Ytd Stock Gains
body: PT Repower Asia Indonesia Tbk Conducted A Virtual Public Disclosure On 19 September 2025 To Respond To The Indonesia Stock Exchange’s Request For Increased Trading Activity, Noting That Its Shares, Real, Had Risen 1.125% Year‑To‑Date To Rp98 Before Falling To Rp71 On Friday. Ceo Aulia Firdaus Outlined Plans To Extend Ppn Dtp Benefits Through 2026, Focus On Existing And New Housing Projects, And Strengthen The Company’s Financial Position For Future Expansion.

title: PT Harapan Group Sukses Divests 18.34% Of Shares, Reducing Ownership To 36.02%
body: PT Harapan Group Sukses Sold 390.78 Million Shares Of PT Harapan Duta Pertiwi Tbk At Rp145 Each, A Divestment Worth Rp56.66 Billion That Lowered Its Stake From 54.37% To 36.02% (767.45 Million Shares). Ceo Kevin Jong Said The Sale Does Not Alter Control, And Hope Shares Rose 6.33% To Rp193.

title: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk Reports Rp100.77 Billion In Exploration Spending Across Indonesia In October 2025
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk Spent About Rp100.77 Billion On Exploration In October 2025, With The Largest Allocation Of Rp75.09 Billion To PT Bumi Suksesindo’s Seven Hills Project In Banyuwangi, East Java. Other Subsidiaries, Including PT Batutua Kharisma Permai, PT Damai Suksesindo, And PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera With PT Gorontalo Sejahtera Mining, Invested Rp15.32 Billion, Rp520 Million, And Rp9.84 Billion Respectively, While PT Merdeka Teknik Servis Handled Technical Execution.

title: Indonesia Accelerates Geothermal Permit Process To 3 Months To Boost Clean Energy Transition
body: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Announced At The Indonesia International Sustainability Forum That The Permit Process For Geothermal Power Plants Will Be Cut From One Year To Three Months, Aiming To Speed Up Indonesia’s Clean‑Energy Transition And Support Its Goal Of 80% Energy Self‑Sufficiency By 2029. With A Current Installed Geothermal Capacity Of 2,744 Mw—Second Only To The United States—Indonesia Also Plans To Increase The Biodiesel Mix To 45–50% And Pertamina Is Targeting The Country To Become The World’s Top Geothermal Producer By 2029.

title: Indonesian Military And PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara Sign Mou To Accelerate Red White Village Cooperatives
body: Vice Commander General Tandyo Budi Revita And PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara President Joao Mota Signed A Memorandum Of Understanding At Tni Headquarters To Rapidly Establish 80,000 Red‑White Village Cooperatives Nationwide, With The Military Pledging Support For Physical Development And Security. The Partnership Aims To Boost Rural Economies And Align With The President’s Directive To Expand The Cooperative Sector.

title: Indonesia Expands Qris Cross‑Border Payments To Strengthen Rupiah Stability And International Connectivity
body: The Indonesian Government And Bank Indonesia Are Accelerating The Rollout Of Qris Cross‑Border Payments, With PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. Already Operating In Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore, And Japan And Planning Expansion To South Korea, China, And India, According To Minister Airlangga Hartarto. Bni’s Corporate Secretary Okki Rushartomo Highlighted The Growing Transaction Volume And The Partnership’s Role In Boosting Financial Connectivity And Protecting The Rupiah’s Value.

title: Freeport Halts Gresik Smelter Operations After Papua Mine Landslide
body: PT Freeport Indonesia’s Gresik Smelter Has Stopped Operations Because It Has No Concentrate Supply Following A Wet‑Ore Mudslide At The Grasberg Mine, With Mining Activities Suspended Since September 8. The Company Is Concentrating On Evacuating Trapped Workers, Conducting Safety Investigations, And Exploring Ways To Resume Production, Which Will Soon Be Evaluated For Its Impact On Output.

title: PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk And PT Pp London Sumatra Indonesia Tbk Clarify No Forest Land Violations, No Sanctions Received
body: Both Companies, Represented By Simp And Lsip, Confirmed That All Plantation Lands Are Fully Licensed And Not Located In Unpermitted Forest Areas, And That They Have Not Received Any Notices, Fines, Or Administrative Sanctions From Government Agencies. They Stated That No Material Impact On Financial Statements Is Expected And Pledged To Comply With Any Future Penalties If Imposed.

title: Amman Mineral Spends Usd 2.69 Million On Exploration In Sumbawa And Rinti Blocks
body: Amman Mineral Spent Usd 2.69 Million On Exploration In The Blok Ii And Blok Iii Areas Of Sumbawa, Covering Drilling, Geological Mapping, And Sample Analysis, While An Additional Usd 351,000 Was Allocated For Ip Survey And Mapping In The Rinti Block. The Company Plans To Continue Resource Drilling At Elang, Exploration Drilling At Gerbang Timur And Sebu Timur, And Sterilization Drilling With Five Rigs, As Well As Further Ip Anomaly Drilling In Rinti.

title: Nippon Indosari Corpindo To Allocate 50 Million Buyback Shares To Long‑Term Incentive Program For 2026‑2030
body: Nippon Indosari Corpindo Plans To Transfer 50 Million Shares From Its Buyback Program To A Long‑Term Incentive Scheme For Management And Directors, To Be Implemented Annually From 2026 To 2030. The Proposal Will Be Approved At An Extraordinary General Meeting On 18 November 2025, With The Recording Date Set For 24 October 2025.

title: Indonesia Finance Minister Declares State Budget Will Not Fund Jakarta–Bandung High‑Speed Rail Debt, Points To Danantara Indonesia For Financing
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Said The Indonesian State Budget Will Not Be Used To Pay The Debt Of The Jakarta–Bandung High‑Speed Railway Operated By PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China, And That Financing Should Be Handled By The Sovereign Wealth Fund Danantara Indonesia And State‑Owned Enterprises. Danantara’s Coo Dony Oskaria Outlined Two Settlement Options—Taking Over Infrastructure Or Injecting New Capital—While Minister Rosan Perkasa Roeslani Confirmed Ongoing Debt‑Restructuring Talks With Chinese Partners To Secure A Sustainable Financial Structure, Noting That Danantara Receives About Rp80 Trillion Annually In Dividends And That PT Kereta Api Indonesia Holds A 60 % Stake In The Project.

title: Indonesia Can Still Export Shrimp To The U.S. Despite New Radiation Checks
body: Indonesia’s Marine Affairs Fisheries Ministry Confirmed That Shrimp Exports To The U.S. Remain Possible, Though Companies In Cikande Industrial Estate Serang Are Barred Due To Suspected Cesium‑137 Contamination, While Those In Cikande Industrial Estate Medan And Shrimp Processing Companies Java Lampung Can Continue With A Cesium‑137‑Free Certificate From The Kkp Quality Agency. Forty‑One Processing Units, Including 35 In Java And Six In Lampung, Must Obtain The Certificate, And The Kkp Has Proposed A Digital System Linked To The Fda’s Online Platform To Streamline Inspections.

title: Adhi Properti Launches Stay‑G Short‑Term Rental Units At Lrt City Sentul
body: Adhi Properti And Stay‑G Opened 20 Short‑Term Rental Units At Lrt City Sentul, Aiming To Boost Occupancy Beyond The Current 350 Residents And Strengthen The Area’s Appeal As A Stay‑Cation Destination. The Partnership Underscores Adhi Properti’s Strategy To Expand Its Hospitality Offerings And Enhance Sentul’s Position As A Preferred Destination For Jakarta Visitors.

title: Sidomulyo Selaras To Seek Approval For Share Reclassification And New Series B Issuance In Upcoming Extraordinary General Meeting
body: Sidomulyo Selaras Will Hold An Extraordinary General Meeting On 17 October 2025 To Approve A Change In Share Classification To Rp100 Nominal Per Share And The Issuance Of A New Series B Share At Rp25 Nominal, Alongside A Rp61.35 Billion Private Placement Of 1.11 Billion New Shares Priced At Rp55 Each, Which Will Convert Existing Debt Into Series B Shares And Reduce The Company’s Debt‑To‑Equity Ratio From 517.56 % To 58.59 %. The Transaction, Completed With Tjoe Mien Sasminto, Will Leave Tjoe Mien Holding 68.92 % Of The Company, Shrink Asabri’s Stake From 18.06 % To 9.11 %, And Improve The Company’s Short‑Term Asset‑To‑Liability Ratio To 95.86 % After Receiving A Restriction Approval From Bank Central Asia On 4 July 2025.

title: Indonesia Secures Rp278 Trillion In Green Investment Commitments At 2025 Isf
body: Indonesia's Investment Downstreaming Ministry Announced That 13 Memorandums Of Understanding Signed At The 2025 Indonesia International Sustainability Forum In Jakarta Secured Rp278 Trillion In Green Investment Commitments Across Clean Energy, Marine, Carbon, Forestry, And Green Infrastructure Sectors. Business Leaders, Including Standard Chartered And The Chamber Of Commerce, Highlighted The Commitments As A Boost For Economic Development, Job Creation, And Indonesia's Leadership In The Low‑Carbon Transition.

title: Puri Sentul Permai Expands Rest‑Area Hotel Network With New Xpress Hotel At Km 379A, Tol Batang-Semarang
body: Puri Sentul Permai Has Opened A New Xpress Hotel At Km 379A On Tol Batang-Semarang, Adding To Its Five Existing Rest‑Area Hotels And Reinforcing Its Commitment To Providing Clean, Convenient Rest Stops For Drivers. The Company, In Partnership With PT Jasamarga Related Business, Aims To Enhance Road Safety, Support Local Employment, And Boost Regional Tax Revenue.

title: Wijaya Karya Bangunan Gedung Faces Four Pkpu Lawsuits Over Debt Payment Delays
body: Four Entities—Maha Akbar Sejahtera, Edo Fenando Putra, Shimizu Global Indonesia, Mitra Selaras Hutama Energi, Cv Sinar Abadi Mandiri, Dikara Guna Raksa, And Sirius Digital Solusindo—Have Filed Pkpu Claims Against Wijaya Karya Bangunan Gedung, Registered At The Jakarta Central Commercial Court Under Registers 307–310. The Company Has Not Yet Received Official Notice, Will Verify The Claims Before Responding, And Reports No Immediate Impact On Its Operations Or Financial Condition.

title: Indonesia Seeks Stronger Energy Ties With Russia As Part Of Net‑Zero 2060 Strategy
body: Indonesia’s Energy Ministry Said It Is Pursuing Collaboration With Russia’s Gazprom, Rosneft And Rosatom On Gas, Nuclear, And Carbon‑Capture Projects To Support Its Net‑Zero Emissions Goal By 2060, While A Presidential Decree‑Based Downstreaming Task Force Aims To Reduce Import Reliance And Offset Foreign‑Exchange Losses Of Rp523 Trillion. The Government Also Plans To Boost Renewable Use, Launch A Biodiesel Program, And Target 15 Carbon‑Capture Projects With A Storage Capacity Of Up To 68 Billion Tonnes Of Co₂ By 2030.

title: Energy Collier Private Limited Acquires 37.11% Stake In Resources Alam Via Transaction With Ubs Ag Singapore Branch
body: On 9 October 2025, Energy Collier Private Limited Purchased 1,855,447,105 Shares Of Resources Alam, Valued At Approximately Rp634.56 Billion, Giving It A 37.11% Ownership. The Remaining Shares Are Held By Sejahtera Jaya Cita (27.83%), Sinar Nusantara Sdn Bhd (8.27%), Lx International Pte Ltd (5.21%), And Public (21.58%).

title: Jora Nilam Judge Continues Divesting Shares Of Menn Teknologi, Reducing Holdings To 18.35%
body: Jora Nilam Judge Sold 60.15 Million Shares Of Menn Teknologi Between 26 September And 9 October 2025, Assisted By Bni Sekuritas, Cutting The Company’s Holdings To 18.35 % From 22.54 %. Menn Teknologi’s Corporate Secretary, Edrick Pramana, Said The Company Has Not Received Any Ownership Documents For Shares Over 5 % And That No Shares Were Absorbed In The Mandatory Tender Offer.

title: PT Triniti Dinamik Tbk. Announces First Waterfront Commercial Development In Karawang Featuring Ion Terrace And Clarke Quay Units
body: PT Triniti Dinamik Tbk. And Its Partner Emiten Properti District East, A Joint Venture Of True Land And Alfaland Group, Have Unveiled A New Waterfront Commercial Area In Karawang Comprising Ion Terrace And Clarke Quay Units That Face The Main Road And The Lake, Respectively. The Project Aims To Create A Work‑Leisure Balanced Business And Recreation Space, Attract Long‑Term Investment, And Strengthen District East As A New Business And Lifestyle Hub.

title: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk Reports Rp176.95 Billion In Exploration Expenditure Focused On Gold, Nickel, And Bauxite
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (Antm) Disclosed Total Exploration Spending Of Rp176.95 Billion Through September 2025, Targeting Gold In Pongkor, Nickel In Konawe Utara, Pomalaa, And Buli, And Bauxite In Tayan, Landak, And Mempawah–Toho. The Company’s Geomin Unit Also Conducted Geological, Geophysical Surveys, Drilling, And Resource Estimation Across These Sites, With PT Sumberdaya Arindo Handling Nickel Exploration In Buli.

title: Cbre Shares Correct After Rally Amid Rp200 Billion Transaction Speculation And Expansion Plans
body: Cbre Shares Fell 14.83% To Rp1,465 On Friday, Still Above Its October Low Of Rp680, After A Spectacular Rally, While Speculation Grew That A Rp200 Billion Deal Involving Andry Hakim Could Push His Stake Near The 5% Threshold. The Company Also Plans To Acquire A Pipe‑Laying Vessel From Hilong Shipping Holding Ltd For Us$100 Million And Is Exploring A Potential Offshore Services Acquisition With Over 50% Upside.

title: PT Pp Tbk. Commences Expansion Of Surabaya–Gempol Toll Road Segment
body: PT Pp Tbk. Has Begun Widening The Surabaya–Gempol Toll Road Segment, A Rp140.3 Billion Project Slated For Completion In 270 Days, Using Portal Gantry Erection To Accelerate Construction. The Expansion Aims To Improve Traffic Flow And Support East Java’s Economic Growth As Part Of The National Infrastructure Connectivity Program.

title: Hope Shares Transfer 18.34% To Celebes Mining Resources, Driving 7.73% Gain
body: On 9 October 2025, Hope Transferred 390.78 Million Shares (18.34%) To Celebes Mining Resources At Rp145 Per Share, A Transaction Worth Approximately Rp56.66 Billion, Reducing Harapan Group Sukses’s Stake To 36.02%. The Deal Pushed Hope Shares Up 7.73% To Rp195, Following A 19% Monthly Rise And A 500% Year‑To‑Date Surge.

title: Bakrie Kalila Divests 224.9 Million Energi Mega Persada Shares, Reducing Stake To 5.27%
body: Bakrie Kalila Sold 224,897,300 Shares Of Energi Mega Persada On 6–7 October 2025, A Transaction Worth Approximately Rp208.42 Billion, With The Sale Facilitated By Panin Sekuritas, Trimegah Sekuritas, Kb Valbury Sekuritas, And Rhb Sekuritas Indonesia. After The Divestment, Bakrie Kalila’s Holding In Energi Mega Persada Stands At 1.36 Billion Shares (5.27 %) And The Company’s Dilution Increased By 0.86 % To 6.13 % Of The Total Shares.

title: Surya Biru Murni Acetylene Tbk Plans Strategic Expansion Into Sustainable Construction Materials
body: Surya Biru Murni Acetylene Tbk (Sbma) Announced A Strategic Expansion Into Sustainable Construction Materials, Adding Seven New Kbli Codes And Planning To Produce Building Materials From Waste Carbide, With Shareholder Approval Sought At A Special General Meeting On November 10, 2025. The Company’s Shareholder Base Grew To 3,615 Investors, Indicating Market Confidence In The Diversification Strategy.

title: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk Shares Surge 51.88% After Subsidiary Acquisition Of PT Guna Dharma Integra
body: Shares Of PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk Rose 51.88%, Or 830 Points, To Rp2,430 Per Share, An 8.97% Increase, Following The Completion Of PT Volta Daya Energi Indonesia’s Acquisition Of 90% Of PT Guna Dharma Integra On 9 October 2025. Management Confirmed The Price Jump Was Linked To This Corporate Action And Stated No Other Material Actions Are Pending.

title: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk. Reports Q3 2025 Exploration Results Across Gold, Nickel, And Bauxite, Incurring Idr 176.95 Billion In Expenditures
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk. (Antam) Disclosed Third‑Quarter 2025 Exploration Results For Gold At Pongkor, Nickel In North Konawe And Pomalaa, And Bauxite In Tayan, Landak, And Mempawah‑Toho, Covering Drilling, Core Sampling, And Trial‑Pit Excavation. The Company Incurred An Unaudited Idr 176.95 Billion In Expenditures, Aiming To Secure Sufficient Potential Reserves For Its Strategic Mineral Resources.

title: Indonesia'S Prabowo Subianto Signs New Mineral Coal Regulation, Expanding Priority Allocation And Setting New Area Limits
body: President Prabowo Subianto Has Signed Government Regulation No. 39/2025, Amending Pp No. 96/2021 To Allow Metallic Mineral And Coal Mining Permits To Be Awarded Via Auction With Priority Allocation For Cooperatives, Smes, Mass Organizations, State‑Owned And Private Enterprises, And Universities, While Establishing Maximum Area Limits For Each Group. The Regulation Also Introduces New Provisions For Radioactive Mineral And Rare‑Earth Commodity Utilization And Adds Detailed Application Requirements For Wiupk Permits.

title: Indonesia'S Esdm Issues New Regulation Requiring Mineral Coal Mining Rkab Submissions Via Integrated System And Minerbaone Application
body: The Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources (Esdm) Has Issued Ministerial Regulation No. 17/2025, Mandating That All Rkab Submissions For Exploration‑Stage And Operation‑Production‑Stage Mineral Coal Mining Activities Be Made Through An Integrated Information System And, Starting October 1 2025, Via The Minerbaone Application. The Regulation Shortens The Validity Of Rkab Approvals To One Year, Sets Quarterly Reporting Requirements, And Provides A Six‑Month Transition Period For Digital System Refinement, While Companies That Received Rkab Approvals Before The Regulation Remain Valid For 2025 But Must Resubmit For 2026 And 2027.

title: Natureverse Inc. Increases Stake In Slj Global To 15.34% After Purchasing 190.19 Million Shares
body: Natureverse Inc., Through Uob Kay Hian Pte Ltd A/C, Bought 190.19 Million Shares Of Slj Global At Rp150 Per Share, Paying Rp28.52 Billion, Raising Its Holding To 969.42 Million Shares (15.34% Of The Company) From 779.22 Million Shares (12.33%) Before The Transaction.

title: Cokal Limited Completes First Commercial Trial Coal Shipment To Indonesian Steel And Coking Partners
body: Cokal Limited Announced The Successful Commercial Trial Shipment Of Metallurgical Coal To PT Dexin Steel Indonesia And PT Detian Coking Indonesia, Marking Its First Sales Since May 2025 And Signalling A Positive Shift In Market Conditions. The Company, Which Holds Interests In Four Central Kalimantan Projects, Is In Advanced Discussions For Additional Sales In The Fourth Quarter, With M Resources And Intco Supporting The Pricing And Market Reach.

title: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk Reports Strong First‑Half 2025 Nickel Production And Revenue Growth, Eyes H2 2025 Upside
body: In The First Half Of 2025, PT Vale Indonesia Tbk Increased Nickel Matte Production By 2% Year‑On‑Year, Raised Shipments To 18,023 T In Q2, And Lifted Revenue To Us$220.2 Million, Up 7% From Q1, While Maintaining Ebitda Of Us$40 Million And A Net Profit Of Us$3.5 Million. Strategic Catalysts—Including A $1.42 Billion High‑Pressure Acid Leach Smelting Project With Danantara Indonesia And China‑Listed Gem Limited, And The Approval To Sell 2.2 Million T Of Saprolite Ore From Bahodopi Mine—Alongside A 19.29% Upside Target Price Of Idr 4,700 Per Share, Position The Company For Stronger H2 2025 Performance Amid Stable Nickel Prices.

title: Indonesia Finalizes Presidential Instruction To Fast‑Track Development Of Kdmp Facilities
body: The Government Has Issued A Presidential Instruction To Accelerate The Construction Of Warehouses, Outlets, And Other Support Facilities For The 80,000 Village Cooperatives Under The Red‑White Program, With PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara And The Armed Forces Set To Play Key Roles. As Of Now, 11,225 Cooperatives Operate At Least One Outlet And About 16,000 Outlets Are Already Active.

title: Indonesia Requires Radioactive-Free Certificates For Shrimp Exports To The United States
body: Indonesia Has Begun Requiring Radioactive-Free Certificates For Shrimp Exporters Targeting The United States Market, With The Ministry Marine Affairs Fisheries Acting As The Certifying Entity For Cs‑137 Contamination‑Free Certification Effective October 31, 2025. Companies On The ‘Yellow List’—Fish Processing Units In Java Lampung With U.S. Export Permits—Must Meet The New Requirements, While ‘Red List’ Companies Such As PT Bahari Makmur Sejati Face A Stricter Verification Process Involving An Independent Body Accredited By The Fda.

title: Indonesia Targets November Finalization Of 2026 Minimum Wage Plan Amid 10.5% Hike Proposal
body: The Indonesian Government Aims To Finalize The 2026 Provincial Minimum Wage Adjustment In November After October Deliberations, With The National Wage Council Overseeing The Process. A Proposed 10.5% Hike From The Confederation Of Indonesian Labor Unions Has Been Noted, But Further Feasibility Review Is Required Before Any Decision Is Made.

title: Removal Of Pik 2 Tropical Coastland From National Strategic Projects List Drives PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk Shares Down 5.25%
body: The Indonesian Government’s Removal Of Pik 2 Tropical Coastland From The National Strategic Projects List Has Pushed PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk Shares Down 5.25% To Rp13,975, Marking A Weekly Decline Of Over 11%. The 65‑Trillion‑Idr Project, Which Was Expected To Create 6,235 Direct And 13,550 Indirect Jobs, Was Withdrawn Amid Land‑Use And Forest‑Area Violations Identified By The Ministry Of Agrarian Affairs And Spatial Planning.

title: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Pursues Offshore Services Acquisition Amid Vessel Deal
body: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Is Conducting Due Diligence To Acquire A Leading Offshore Services Company, With A 50%+ Chance Of Closing, While Also Preparing To Acquire A Pipe‑Laying Vessel From Hilong Shipping Holding Ltd. The Acquisition Aims To Strengthen Its Energy Supply Chain, Especially In Exploration And Production, And The Vessel Is Expected To Become Commercially Operational In Early 2026.

title: Eastparc Hotel Reports 10% Decline In Net Profit To Rp20.98 Billion For Q3 2025
body: Eastparc Hotel’s Net Profit Fell 10% Year‑On‑Year To Rp20.98 Billion, With Earnings Per Share Dropping To Rp5.09. Revenue Declined 7.74% To Rp66.95 Billion, Yet Total Equity Rose To Rp472.86 Billion And Assets Increased To Rp494.46 Billion.

title: Adhi Karya Joins Bsi Selaras Consortium To Build Rp12.35 Trillion Bogor–Serpong Via Parung Toll Road
body: On 3 October 2025, Adhi Karya, As A 12% Shareholder Of The Bsi Selaras Consortium, Signed The Concession Agreement For The 32.03‑Km Bogor–Serpong Via Parung Toll Road, A Rp12.35 Trillion Project That Will Begin Land Acquisition In 2026, Construction In October 2026, And Target Operation By The End Of 2028 Under A 40‑Year Concession.

title: Rafi Optimistic On Q4 2025 Performance Amid Cost Efficiency And Product Diversification
body: Rafi, Led By Ceo Eko Pujianto, Reports Positive Q4 2025 Results And Plans To Strengthen Cash Flow And Profitability Through Cost Renegotiation, Variable Cost Conversion, And A Shift From Franchise To Raw‑Material Sales, With Seafood And Rice Now Driving Revenue. The Company Projects 5% Revenue Growth And 10–15% Profit Margin Improvement In 2025, Supported By New Product Lines, A Solar‑Powered Cold‑Storage Partnership, And Planned Upstream Acquisitions.

title: PT Folago Global Nusantara Tbk Acquires 51% Stake In Lumino Digital To Expand Creative Performance Marketing
body: PT Folago Global Nusantara Tbk Has Acquired A 51% Stake In Lumino Digital, A Creative Agency Known For Viral Tiktok And Instagram Content, As Part Of Its Strategy To Broaden Its Creative Performance Marketing Portfolio. The Partnership Aims To Combine Folago’s Mcn Network Of Hundreds Of Creators With Lumino’s Data‑Driven Viral Content Expertise To Deliver Measurable 100 Million‑View Campaigns And Drive Conversion For Brands.

title: Energi Mega Persada To Raise Rp269.5 Billion Via Private Placement Of 350 Million New Shares
body: The Company Will Issue 350 Million New Shares At An Exercise Price Of Rp770 Per Share, A 22.61% Discount To The Monday Close Of Rp995, With PT Samuel International As The Sole Purchaser. After The Placement, The Fully Paid‑Up Capital Will Rise To Rp6.93 Trillion, Or 26.34 Billion Shares.

title: Chengdong Investment Corporation Sells 3.71 Billion Bumi Resources Shares, Raising Rp459.38 Billion, While Bumi Resources Acquires 99.68% Of Wolfram Limited For Rp698.98 Billion
body: Chengdong Investment Corporation Divested 3.71 Billion Bumi Resources Shares Between June And October 2025, Generating Rp459.38 Billion With Average Prices Ranging From Rp112.06 To Rp152.44 Per Share And Reducing Its Stake To 8.99%. Bumi Resources Completed A Staged Acquisition Of 99.68% Of Wolfram Limited For Rp698.98 Billion (Aud 63.5 Million), Expanding Its Portfolio Into Critical Minerals After Receiving Approval From The Foreign Investment Review Board Australia.

title: Formosa Ingredient Factory To Distribute Rp2.31 Billion Interim Dividend, 28.25% Of Net Profit
body: Formosa Ingredient Factory Will Pay An Interim Dividend Of Rp2 Per Share, Totaling Rp2.31 Billion, Which Represents About 28.25% Of Its Net Profit Of Rp8.2 Billion As Of June 30 2025. The Dividend Will Be Paid On November 10 2025, With Cum And Ex Dates Scheduled From October 21 To 24, 2025, And The Company’s Retained Earnings Stand At Rp34.14 Billion Against Total Equity Of Rp185.67 Billion.

title: Arkadia Digital Media Reports Third-Quarter 2025 Loss Of Rp2.79 Billion, Down 27.39% Yoy
body: The Company Posted A Net Loss Of Rp2.79 Billion For Q3 2025, Up From Rp2.19 Billion A Year Earlier, While Revenue Fell 21.38% To Rp27.94 Billion. Operating Expenses Rose, And The Company’s Equity Fell To A Deficit Of Rp54.53 Billion.

title: Bei Prepares Scenarios For Potential Free Float Increase Ahead Of Ojk Review In Q4 2025
body: Director Gede Nyoman Yetna Of Bei Confirmed That The Exchange Has Developed Multiple Scenarios And Impact Studies For A Possible Rise In The Minimum Free Float, Which Will Be Discussed By Ojk In Q4 2025. Bei Also Plans To Boost Free Float Through Large Ipos, Targeted Socialization, Monitoring, And Special Notation For Issuers Below 5 % Free Float, While Ojk Considers Raising The Minimum Free Float For Listed Companies From 7.5 % To 10 % Over Three Years To Enhance Liquidity Without Burdening Small Issuers.

title: PT Wijaya Karya Beton Tbk Strengthens Capital Base And Secures Rp2.79 Trillion Contract Amid Infrastructure Stimulus
body: PT Wijaya Karya Beton Tbk (Wika Beton) Maintains A 60% Stake From Its Parent, PT Wijaya Karya Tbk, While Institutional Investors Such As Koperasi Karya Mitra Satya And Pension Funds Support Its Financial Foundation. The Company Secured A New Rp2.79 Trillion Contract Through September 2025, Up 10.28% From Rp2.53 Trillion In August, And Continues To Operate At 34% Plant Utilization With Ongoing Product Innovation.

title: Indonesia Transfers Six Seized Tin Smelters To State-Owned PT Timah In Crackdown On Illegal Mining
body: Indonesia’s Government Transferred Six Seized Tin Smelters, Worth 6‑7 Trillion Rupiah, To State‑Owned PT Timah, Aiming To Curb Illegal Mining And Strengthen Domestic Tin Production. PT Timah Plans To Integrate The Facilities By Early 2026, Potentially Generating 4.6 Trillion Rupiah In Annual Revenue And Stabilizing Indonesia’s Tin Supply Amid Global Price Pressures.

title: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk Raises Pani Gold Mine Ore Reserves By 150% To 4.8 Million Ounces
body: PT Merdeka Gold Resources Tbk Announced That The Pani Gold Mine’s Gold Ore Reserve Has Increased To 4.8 Million Ounces, Up 150% From 1.9 Million Ounces, Based On A New Technical Study. The Mine, Located In Pohuwato Regency, Gorontalo Province, Is Expected To Begin Operations On October 1, 2025, With First Gold Production In Q1 2026 And A Potential Peak Output Of 500,000 Ounces Per Year By 2032.

title: PT Oscar Mitra Sukses Sejahtera Tbk Announces Mass Resignation Of Directors Amid Takeover Plan
body: PT Oscar Mitra Sukses Sejahtera Tbk Announced The Resignation Of Six Key Directors And Commissioners Effective After An Extraordinary General Meeting On 5 November 2025, A Move Linked To A Takeover Plan Disclosed On 23 September 2025. The Plan Involves A Two‑Stage Sale Of 1.48 Billion Shares (77.9% Of Issued Capital) To A Consortium Of PT Olive Power Invest, PT Motif Investasi Indonesia And PT Pacific Prima Permata, While The Company’s Shares Have Risen 9.68% To Rp170 And 96.3% In The Past Month.

title: Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. Expands Payment Facilitation Role With Bpjs Ketenagakerjaan Via Bnidirect Cash Platform
body: Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. (Bni) Has Partnered With Bpjs Ketenagakerjaan To Optimize Its Bnidirect Cash Platform, Offering Integrated Cash Management, Multi-Level Approval, And Automated Billing Payment For Employer Contributions. The Collaboration Aims To Improve Payment Efficiency, Reduce Delays, And Strengthen Indonesia’s Social Security Ecosystem.

title: Wir Group And Mayora Champion Launch Vr School Tour For 7,500 Students In Jabodetabek
body: The Program, Running From 30 September To 31 October 2025, Uses A Converted Bus As A Mobile Vr Laboratory To Let Sd To Smp Students Explore The Solar System, Flora, Fauna, And Digital Worlds. Ceo Stephen Ng Said The Initiative Expands Technology‑Based Education Access And Plans To Extend The Vr School Tour To Other Regions, While Mayora Group’s Marketing Director Highlighted The Synergy Between Nutrition And Immersive Learning.

title: Ubs Switzerland Ag Buy Shares of Wicaksana Overseas International Tbk
body: Ubs Switzerland Ag, an institution, bought 350,145,665 shares of Wicaksana Overseas International Tbk, increasing its holdings from 0 to 350,145,665. The transaction occurred in the consumer-non-cyclicals sector, specifically food-staples-retailing. The purpose of the transaction is undisclosed.

title: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk Buy Shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk, an insider, bought 25,698,420 shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk, increasing its holding from 49,711,335,640 to 49,968,319,840. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically alternative-energy. The purpose of the transaction is not specified.

title: Mahogany Global Investment Pte Ltd Sell Shares of PT Wahana Interfood Nusantara Tbk
body: Mahogany Global Investment Pte Ltd, an insider, sold 580,500 shares of PT Wahana Interfood Nusantara Tbk, reducing its holding from 459,637,051 to 459,056,551. The transaction occurred in the energy sector, specifically alternative energy, with a share price of 450.

title: PT Buana Graha Utama Buy Shares of Multi Indocitra Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 08, 2025 (WIB), PT Buana Graha Utama bought shares of Multi Indocitra Tbk (MICE.JK) at approximately IDR 492, increasing holdings from 285,921,618 to 285,971,618. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buy Shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 08, 2025 (WIB), Patrick Rudolf Dannacher bought shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) at approximately IDR 1,070, increasing holdings from 140,902,350 to 142,712,350. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Rudi Reksa Sutantra Transaction Shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 08, 2025 (WIB), Rudi Reksa Sutantra transaction shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk (ATLA.JK) at approximately IDR 68, decreasing holdings from 3,103,484,300 to 3,100,717,800. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Bank Julius Baer And Coltd Singapore Buy Shares of Bayu Buana Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 14, 2025 (WIB), Bank Julius Baer And Coltd Singapore bought shares of Bayu Buana Tbk (BAYU.JK) at approximately IDR 1,300, increasing holdings from 27,755,615 to 27,905,615. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Bank Of Singaporelimited Buy Shares of Maskapai Reasuransi Indonesia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 14, 2025 (WIB), Bank Of Singaporelimited bought shares of Maskapai Reasuransi Indonesia Tbk (MREI.JK) at approximately IDR 1,000, increasing holdings from 32,217,955 to 32,240,155. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Levoca Enterpriseltd Sell Shares of Bakrie & Brothers Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 10, 2025 (WIB), Levoca Enterpriseltd sold shares of Bakrie & Brothers Tbk (BNBR.JK) at approximately IDR 49, decreasing holdings from 27,898,722,798 to 13,219,385,798. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Uob Kay Hian Pte LTD Buy Shares of Bakrie & Brothers Tbk

title: Indonesia’S Energy Ministry Delays B50 Biodiesel Program To 2026 After Successful B40 Rollout
body: The Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Confirmed That The Mandatory B50 Biodiesel Program, Which Follows The Successful B40 Rollout, Will Not Begin Until 2026 After A 6‑ To 8‑Month Road‑Test Period. The B40 Program Saved Indonesia Roughly Us$9.3 Billion (Idr147.5 Trillion), Added Rp20.98 Trillion In Local Value, And Created About Two Million Jobs.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia Targets 25% Roe And Expands Hajj Gold Franchise Amid Strong Inventory Turnover
body: Bank Syariah Indonesia Aims For A 25% Return On Equity With A 40% Cost‑To‑Income Ratio, A Product Holding Ratio Over Five Times, And Credit Costs Below 80 Basis Points, While Its Hajj Gold Franchise Shows A 6.9% Gold Penetration In Payroll Loans And A Three‑Fold Inventory Turnover. The Bank’s Hajj Account Base Grew By 5.9 Million In 2025, With Average Balances Rising From Idr 2.1 Million To Idr 2.5 Million, Underscoring The Franchise’s Sticky Savings And High‑Margin Business Model.

title: Indonesia Finance Ministry Accelerates Regulatory Reforms To Boost Business And Agriculture
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Of Finance Announced A Suite Of Regulatory Streamlining Measures, Including A “Silence Is Consent” Permit System And The Removal Of 145 Fertilizer Distribution Rules, To Give Businesses Greater Certainty And Enable Farmers To Buy Fertilizers Directly From January 1, 2025. The Reforms Are Part Of A Presidential Regulation Priority Program Acceleration Team Led By Airlangga Hartarto And Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Aimed At Improving Budget Absorption Of Flagship Programs And Supporting National Grain Production Under President Prabowo Subianto’s Agenda.

title: Indonesia'S Transportation And Tourism Ministers Agree To Boost Connectivity To Strengthen National Tourism Destinations
body: Transportation Minister Dudy Purwagandhi And Tourism Minister Widiyanthi Putri Wardhana Met To Confirm That Improving Transportation Connectivity Is A Strategic Step To Make National Tourism Destinations More Accessible And Competitive, And They Outlined Plans To Open New Domestic And International Flight Routes, Including Direct Flights From Yogyakarta To Cities In China, Korea, Japan, Australia, And India, As Well As Routes From Lombok To Sydney And Other Key Hubs. The Tourism Ministry Reported That Foreign Tourist Visits Rose 9.44% To 7.05 Million In The First Half Of 2025, Placing Indonesia Fifth Among Asean Countries, And Called For Further Optimization Of International Flight Access And Support For Marine Tourism Licensing.

title: Indonesian Minister Reassures Safety Of Cikande Industrial Estate Amid Cesium‑137 Radiation Concerns
body: Minister Of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita Confirmed That The Cikande Industrial Estate, Managed By PT Modern Industrial Estate, Will Continue Operations Under Strict Safety Protocols After A Cesium‑137 Radiation Source Was Detected. The Ministry, Together With The Food Affairs Ministry, Nuclear Energy Regulatory Agency, And Local Authorities, Has Established A Task Force And Monitoring System To Protect Public Health, Maintain Supply Chain Integrity, And Preserve Indonesia’s Investment‑Friendly Image.

title: Indonesia Energy Minister Orders Investigation Into PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt Scrubber Tower Fire
body: Energy And Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Has Ordered An Investigation Into A Fire That Broke Out At The Scrubber Tower Of PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt In Morowali Industrial Park, Central Sulawesi, With Police Already Conducting A Crime Scene Investigation And Preliminary Findings Pointing To Welding Sparks Igniting Tarpaulin Over A Fiberglass Tank. The Incident Injured One Indonesian And One Foreign Worker, Both Receiving Medical Treatment, And The Government Will Review The Findings Before Deciding On Preventive Measures.

title: Indonesia Prepares New Radiation Reporting Rules For Industrial Factories Following Cesium-137 Exposure Incident
body: Industry Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita Announced That Indonesia Will Require All Factories In Industrial Areas To Report Quarterly Radiation Portal Monitoring Results, With The Regulation Expected To Be Issued Soon. The Ministry Is Also Offering Businesses The Option To Purchase Testing Equipment Or Partner With Third Parties, While Decontamination Of Sites In Cikande Modern Industrial Estate Is Targeted For Completion In December 2025.

title: Indonesia Targets December 2025 Completion For Cs‑137 Decontamination In Cikande Industrial Area
body: Minister Hanif Faisol Nurofiq Announced That Decontamination Of Cs‑137 At Ten Key Sites In The Cikande Industrial Area Will Be Finished By December 2025, While Law Enforcement Investigates The Source, Possibly From Imported Iron‑Steel Scrap Or Commercial Waste. The Government Has Temporarily Suspended Imports Of Iron‑Steel Scrap And Is Strengthening Monitoring And Regulatory Frameworks, With Emergency Storage Operations At PT Pmt Expected To Begin In 2026.

title: Indonesia Finance Minister Declares No Cigarette Excise Tax Increase Planned For 2026
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Confirmed That The Indonesian Government Will Not Raise The Retail Price Of Cigarettes Or Increase Tobacco Excise Tax In 2026, Citing Concerns That Higher Prices Could Widen The Gap Between Legal And Illegal Cigarettes And Undermine Revenue. He Also Noted That Alternative Strategies Are Being Prepared To Maintain State Revenue While Supporting The Tobacco Industry’s Sustainability And Fair Competition.

title: Bursa Efek Indonesia Places PT Mustika Ratu Tbk. Under Unusual Market Activity Surveillance After Sharp Stock Surge
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange Announced That PT Mustika Ratu Tbk. (Mrat) Is Now Under Surveillance For Unusual Market Activity Following A 45.03% Jump On Tuesday And A 14.29% Rise On Wednesday, With The Stock Having Risen 154% In The Past Month And 150% In The Last Six Months. The Move Does Not Imply Wrongdoing But Urges Investors To Consider Publicly Available Material Before Making Decisions.

title: Pp Presisi Secures Rp872.5 Billion Credit Facility From Bank Mandiri For Lancarjaya Mandiri Abadi
body: The Facility Includes Revolving Working Capital Credit Of Rp82.5 Billion, Non‑Revolving Working Capital Credit Of Rp250 Billion, Investment Credit Of Rp269 Billion, And A Bank Guarantee Of Rp271 Billion, All At 8.25% Per Annum (Except The Guarantee At 0.5%). These Funds Will Support Lma’s Projects Across Apbn, Apbd, Private Companies, And Bumn Partnerships, Covering Working Capital, Equipment Procurement, And Guarantee Issuance.

title: Merdeka Copper Boosts Merdeka Resources Stake To 57.25% With Rp36.1 Billion Purchase
body: Merdeka Copper Increased Its Stake In Merdeka Resources To 57.25% By Buying 8.2245 Million Shares For Rp36.1 Billion On 13 Oct 2025, Bringing Total Holdings To 9.26 Billion Shares. Boy Thohir And Trinugraha Thohir Bought Back 1.3 Million Shares, While Erick Thohir Clarified No Share Release And Corporate Secretary Adi Adriansyah Sjoekri Said The Transaction Had No Operational Impact.

title: Central Omega Posts 52.8% Rise In Net Profit To Rp442.36 Billion For Fy 2025
body: Central Omega Reported A Net Profit Of Rp442.36 Billion For The Year Ended 30 September 2025, A 52.8% Increase From Rp289.52 Billion In The Same Period Last Year, While Revenue Rose 29.2% To Rp1.24 Trillion. Operating Profit Jumped To Rp473.49 Billion From Rp233.88 Billion, And Total Assets Grew To Rp2.97 Trillion Against Rp2.54 Trillion At Year‑End 2024.

title: Plaza Indonesia Realty To Distribute Interim Dividend Of Rp268.71 Billion Based On Net Profit Of Rp265.53 Billion As Of June 30, 2025
body: The Company Will Pay Rp76 Per Share To Shareholders, With The Dividend Scheduled To Be Paid On October 31, 2025, Following Cum And Ex Dates Set For October 22-27, 2025. Net Profit For The First Half Of The Year Was Rp265.53 Billion, Retained Earnings Stand At Rp10.12 Trillion, And Total Equity Is Rp11.27 Trillion.

title: Bes Trust Pte Ltd Divests 252.95 Million Shares Of Cakra Buana Resources Energi, Raising Rp189.71 Billion
body: Bes Trust Pte Ltd Sold 252.95 Million Shares Of Cakra Buana Resources Energi At Rp750 Per Share, A 48.8% Discount To The October 10, 2025 Closing Price Of Rp1,465, Raising Rp189.71 Billion And Leaving It With 89.04 Million Shares (1.87%). Meanwhile, Andry Hakim Sold 109.903374 Million Shares At The Same Price, Raising Rp82.42 Billion And Increasing His Stake To 226.9 Million Shares (5%).

title: Waskita Karya Reports A Rp3.17 Trillion Loss For The Quarter Ended September 30, 2025, Up 5.66% From The Same Period Last Year.
body: For The Quarter Ended September 30, 2025, Waskita Karya Posted A Net Loss Of Rp3.17 Trillion, A 5.66% Increase From The Same Period Last Year, While Revenue Fell 22.12% To Rp5.28 Trillion. Gross Profit Slipped To Rp979.97 Billion, And The Company’s Equity Dropped To Rp4.37 Trillion From Rp7.88 Trillion, With Total Liabilities Falling To Rp67.55 Trillion From Rp69.27 Trillion.

title: Levoca Enterprise Ltd And Port Fraser International Ltd Divest 5.25 Billion Shares Of Bakrie Group In October 2025
body: Levoca Enterprise Ltd Sold 4 Billion Shares Of Bakrie Group On 10 October 2025 At Rp49 Per Share, Valuing The Divestiture At Rp196 Billion, While Port Fraser International Ltd Sold 1.25 Billion Shares On 13 October 2025 At Rp51 Per Share, Worth Rp63.75 Billion. After The Transactions, Levoca’s Holdings Fell To 9.21 Billion Shares (5.316% Of The Total, A 2.307% Drop), And Port Fraser’s Holdings Dropped To 45.1 Billion Shares (26.008% Of The Total, A 0.721% Decline).

title: PT Central Omega Resources Tbk Reports Strong Q3 2025 Nickel Production, Sales, And Profit Growth
body: The Company Mined 2.07 Million Tonnes Of Nickel Ore, Up 18% Yoy, And Sold 2.29 Million Tonnes, A 31% Increase, Driving Revenue To Rp1.2 Trillion (+29.5%) And Net Profit To Rp442.69 Billion (+54.8%). Ebitda Surged 198% Yoy To Rp638.09 Billion, While Operating Cash Flow Rose 25% To Rp677.4 Billion, Though The Stock Fell 6.25% To Rp750 On Tuesday.

title: Koka Indonesia Tbk. Confirms Acquisition By Ningbo Lixing Enterprise Management Co., Ltd. Continues Pending Regulator Approval
body: Koka Indonesia Tbk. Confirms Its Acquisition By Ningbo Lixing Enterprise Management Co., Ltd. (Nlem) Is Proceeding, With Both Parties Signing A Memorandum Of Understanding And Awaiting Regulator Approval, While The Deal Will Increase The Locked‑Up Stake From 42.75% To 78.5% And Is Expected To Close Within Three Months. Koka’s Shares Have Surged 308% In The Past Month, 355.8% Over Six Months, And 503% Year‑To‑Date, And The Company Will Maintain Its Core Construction Focus While Exploring New Cross‑Border Opportunities.

title: PT Logisticsplus International Tbk Secures Rp42.4 Billion Operational Package Contract And Acquires Majority Stake In PT Wibowo Manajemen Indonesia
body: PT Logisticsplus International Tbk (Lopi) Won A Rp42,365,081,428 Procurement Contract For Operational Package Services B Year 2025, Boosting Its Operations And Revenue, While Its Shares Rose 2.3% To Rp89. PT Logisticsplus International Tbk Also Acquired 70% Of PT Wibowo Manajemen Indonesia For Rp2.63 Billion On June 19 2025 To Expand Logistics Outsourcing Services, With The Ceo Purchasing 420 Shares From Directors And Commissioners.

title: PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk Reports Share Sale By Controlling Shareholder PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia
body: On October 8, 2025, PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sold 155.0 Million Shares Of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk In Three Transactions Totaling About Rp24.6 Billion, Reducing Its Stake From 4.352 Billion To 4.207 Billion Shares. The Sale Coincided With A 14.6% Drop In Dada Shares To Rp111, After A Recent 54.1% Rise From Rp72 In September And A 1,485% Surge From Rp7 In April.

title: PT Cipta Sarana Medika Tbk Reports 23% Rise In Assets And 40% Rise In Liabilities In Interim Financials, Driven By Ipo Proceeds
body: The Company’s Interim Financial Statement As Of June 30, 2025 Shows Total Assets At Rp330.02 Billion, Up 23% From Rp268.10 Billion, And Total Liabilities At Rp194.31 Billion, Up 40% From Rp138.37 Billion, Largely Due To Cash Inflows From Its Ipo And New Equity Offerings. Net Profit For Q2 2025 Reached Rp6.3 Billion, A 5.7% Yoy Increase And 123% Growth Over 2024, While Revenue Rose 13.9% Yoy To Rp85.9 Billion, Though The Stock Has Fallen 51.2% Year‑To‑Date After The May 7 Ipo That Raised Rp69.96 Billion.

title: PT Alamtri Minerals Indonesia Tbk Clarifies Coal Stock Levels And Development Progress Of Subsidiaries
body: In A Response To The Indonesia Stock Exchange Dated 14 October 2025, PT Alamtri Minerals Indonesia Tbk Explained That The Rise In Metallurgical Coal Inventory At PT Maruwai Coal And PT Laha Coal Is A Logistical Strategy, Not Market Demand, And That The Stock Is Unrelated To PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry. The Company Also Reported That Its Three Development Subsidiaries—PT Juloi Coal, PT Kalteng Coal, And PT Sumber Barito Coal—Are Still In Technical Studies, With Commercial Operations Pending, While The Stock Price Has Risen 3.2% To Rp1,415 Per Share, Marking A 37.3% Increase Over The Past Month.

title: Bursa Efek Indonesia Reopens Trading Of PT Sari Kreasi Boga Tbk Shares After Meeting Obligations
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange Lifted The Suspension On PT Sari Kreasi Boga Tbk’s Shares (Rafi) After The Company Fulfilled All Previously Cited Obligations, With The Stock Jumping 1 Point (6.67%) To Rp16 In The Fourth Session Of The Periodic Call Auction. The Exchange Urged Stakeholders To Maintain Transparency And Protect Investor Interests.

title: Bintang Express Acquires 360 Million Shares Of Maha Properti Indonesia From Sri Tahir At 91.8% Discount, Raising Stake To 10.06%
body: The Transaction, Facilitated By Deutsche Bank Ag, Saw Bintang Express Purchase 360 Million Shares Of Maha Properti Indonesia From Sri Tahir At Rp500 Per Share, A 91.80% Discount To The Closing Price Of Rp6,100, Raising Its Holding To 1 Million Shares (10.06%) And Generating Rp180 Billion In Proceeds. Sri Tahir’s Stake Fell To 1.11 Billion Shares (11.19%) After The Transaction.

title: OJK Dissolves PT Sepatu Bata Tbk Pension Fund, Appoints Liquidation Team
body: The Financial Services Authority (Ojk) Has Officially Dissolved The Pension Fund Of PT Sepatu Bata Tbk Following A Decision Under Kep‑103/D.05/2025, After A Formal Request From The Fund’s Founders. A Liquidation Team Has Been Appointed To Manage Asset And Liability Settlement, Operating From Jl. Ra Kartini No. 26, Cilandak Barat, Jakarta, With Full Responsibility To Ensure Compliance With Pension Regulations And Protect Participant Rights.

title: Director Rudy Suparman Executes Buy And Sell Transactions Of PT Barito Pacific Tbk Shares, Netting Rp1.44 Billion
body: Rudy Suparman, A Director Of PT Barito Pacific Tbk, Bought 200,000 Shares At Rp4,000 And Sold 540,000 Shares At An Average Price Of Rp4,155 Between 7 And 10 October 2025, Earning Rp1.44 Billion And Reducing His Holdings From 964,100 To 624,100 Shares. The Company’s Shares Fell 6.18% To Rp1,970 On The Day, After A 5% Weekly Decline And A 70.9% Monthly Drop From Rp2,340 On 15 September 2025.

title: Ubs Group Ag Sells 588.9 Million Bumi Resources Shares To Raise Rp86.28 Billion, Diluting Holdings By 0.16%
body: On 9 October 2025, Ubs Group Ag Sold 588,905,500 Shares Of Bumi Resources At Rp146.525 Per Share, A 2.46% Premium Over The Day's Closing Price Of Rp143, Raising Rp86.28 Billion. The Sale Reduced Ubs Group Ag’s Bumi Resources Stake To 25.71 Billion Shares (6.92%) From 26.3 Billion, A 0.16% Dilution.

title: Indonesia Aims To Retain Medical Spending By Boosting Hospitality In Private Hospitals
body: Indonesia's Health Ministry Says Improving Hospitality In Private Hospitals Could Reverse The Trend Of Citizens Seeking Medical Care Abroad, With Citizens Spending About Rp 600 Trillion Annually Overseas, And Has Tasked The Indonesian Hospitals Association To Help Hospitals Like Primaya Hospital Group Enhance Service Quality. Primaya, Operating Around 20 Hospitals, Has Already Made Strides, Adding A New Kelapa Gading Facility And Pioneering Treatments Such As Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy And Advanced Cardiovascular Tools.

title: Aninditha Anestya Bakrie Divests 1.39 Million Shares Of Ancara Logistics At Rp100 Each, Receiving Rp138.67 Million
body: Commissioner Aninditha Anestya Bakrie Sold 1,386,750 Shares Of Ancara Logistics On 9 October 2025 At Rp100 Per Share, A Price 81.81% Below The Closing Price Of Rp550, And Received Rp138.67 Million. After The Sale, She Retains 348.27 Million Shares (2.2% Ownership) And The Shares Were Donated As An Incentive To Senior Management, Funded By Prior Commitments Rather Than The Company, With Aulia, Director & Corporate Secretary, Affirming The Company's Operational Stability.

title: Rudy Johansen Resigns As Commissioner Of PT Batavia Prosperindo Trans Tbk, No Impact On Operations
body: Paulus Handigdo, Ceo Of Bptr, Confirmed Receipt Of Rudy Johansen's Resignation Letter Dated 14 October 2025 And Stated It Would Not Affect The Company's Operational, Legal, Financial, Or Business Continuity. Johansen, Who Has Served As Director Of PT. Batavia Prosperindo Internasional Tbk Since 2013 And Is Also Director Of Malacca Trust Pte Ltd, Maintains An Affiliation With The Controlling Shareholder Group Of Bptr.

title: Indonesia Approves Mandatory 10% Ethanol Blend In Gasoline, Plans Two New Plants
body: Indonesia’s President Prabowo Subianto Has Approved A Mandatory 10% Ethanol Blend In Gasoline, Prompting Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia To Announce Plans To Build Two Ethanol Plants—One In Bojonegoro From Cassava And Another In Merauke From Sugarcane—To Meet An Estimated Annual Demand Of 2.3–2.6 Million Tonnes. Implementation Of The Ethanol Policy Will Begin Next Year After Infrastructure Preparation.

title: Indonesia'S Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Launches Minerba One App At Minerba Convex 2025
body: During The Opening Of Minerba Convex 2025 In Jakarta, The Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Officially Launched The Minerba One Application, Integrating Previously Separate Digital Systems Such As Modi, Moms, And E-Pnbp Into A Single Platform To Enhance Transparency, Efficiency, And Real‑Time Data Reporting Across Licensing, Production, And Oversight Processes.

title: Finance Minister Says Danantara Indonesia Can Repay Jakarta–Bandung High‑Speed Rail Debt Without State Funds
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Announced That Danantara Indonesia Has Sufficient Financial Capacity To Repay The Jakarta–Bandung High‑Speed Rail Debt Without Relying On The State Budget, Citing Dividends Of Rp80–90 Trillion That Exceed The Rp2 Trillion Annual Interest Owed To Kcic. Danantara Is Evaluating Two Options—Government Takeover Of Infrastructure Or New Capital Injection Into PT Kereta Api Indonesia—While The Total Project Cost Stands At $7.27 Billion (Rp120.38 Trillion) With 75% Financed Through Cdb Loans At 2% Interest.

title: Raymond Buy Shares of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 15, 2025 (WIB), Raymond bought shares of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TPIA.JK) at approximately IDR 7,750, increasing holdings from 2,500,000 to 2,600,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia Disburses Rp200 Trillion To Five State‑Owned Banks To Stimulate Economic Growth
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Announced That Rp200 Trillion Will Be Distributed To Bank Rakyat Indonesia, Bank Negara Indonesia, Bank Mandiri (Each Rp55 Trillion), Bank Tabungan Negara (Rp25 Trillion), And Bank Syariah Indonesia (Rp10 Trillion) With An 80.476% Bi‑Rate Return, Directing The Funds Toward Productive Sectors Rather Than Government Bonds. The Minister Also Noted Rising Electricity Demand Across The Country As A Sign Of Economic Progress And Will Monitor Developments With Pln, While Declining To Discuss Further Stimulus Measures.

title: Bakrie Metalindustries, PT Buy Shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 15, 2025 (WIB), Bakrie Metalindustries, PT bought shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk (VKTR.JK) at approximately IDR 270, increasing holdings from 6,682,230,900 to 6,721,730,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia Tightens Halal Oversight On Chinese Imports Through Embassy-Bpjph Collaboration
body: Indonesia Is Enhancing Inspections Of Halal-Certified Products From China, With The Bpjph And The Indonesian Embassy In Beijing Coordinating Visits To Production Sites, Supply Chains, And Slaughterhouses Across Several Chinese Provinces. The Partnership Aims To Ensure Continuous Compliance With Halal Standards, Protecting Muslim Consumers' Confidence In Imported Goods.

title: Jakarta And Danantara Reach Technical Agreement To Build Waste‑To‑Energy Plant At Bantar Gebang
body: Jakarta Provincial Government And Danantara Have Agreed On Technical Terms To Construct A Waste‑To‑Energy Power Plant At The Bantar Gebang Site, With Each Facility Expected To Generate About 35 Mw From 2,500–3,000 Tons Of Waste Per Day. The Project, Which Could Add 4–5 Plants And Potentially Eliminate Tipping Fees If Electricity Prices Reach 20 Cents/Kwh, Has Attracted Strong Interest From International Investors.

title: Indonesia'S Ministry Of National Development Planning Unveils Manpower Roadmap To Mitigate Job Losses From Energy Transition
body: The Ministry Is Developing A Comprehensive Roadmap To Address Potential Unemployment As Indonesia Shifts Away From Coal, Focusing On Reskilling, Curriculum Updates, And Support Ecosystems To Create Green Jobs. It Emphasizes That While Jobs May Disappear, Workers Should Not, And Calls For Regional Governments To Set Timelines For Sectoral Job Reductions.

title: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama To Issue Rp3.25 Trillion Right Issue Via Owk
body: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama Will Issue 32.58 Billion New Shares At Rp100 Each Through A Right Issue Of Rp3.25 Trillion, With Each Holder Of Five Existing Shares Entitled To 102 Rights To Purchase Owk Convertible Into Shares At A 1:1 Ratio. Proceeds—86.76 % Earmarked For Loans To Subsidiaries Adhi Prakarsa Raya And Summer Cahaya Raya To Acquire Shares From Konutara Sejati And Karyatama Konawe Utara—Will Be Used For Working Capital, While Eco Energi Perkasa, Holding 47.16 % Of The Company, Will Exercise All Rights.

title: Cdi Group Expands Solar Capacity To 11 Mwp, Boosts Logistics Fleet, And Reports Strong First‑Half 2025 Results
body: Chandra Daya Investasi Alias Cdi Group, Through Its Subsidiary Krakatau Chandra Energi, Announced A 4.7 Mwp Solar Plant In Cilegon That Will Bring Its Total Plts Capacity To 11 Mwp, Expected To Start Operating In November 2025, And It Also Purchased Two 9,000‑Dwt Chemical Vessels To Begin Service In 1H 2026. The Company Reported A Net Profit Of Usd 74.4 Million, Assets Of Usd 1.5 Billion, Liquidity Of Usd 527.6 Million, And Secured A Rp 2 Trillion Long‑Term Loan From Bank Andamon Indonesia, A Usd 185 Million Equity Injection From Chandra Asri Group And Egco Group, And Raised Rp 2.4 Trillion In Its Ipo.

title: Karnadi Margaka Divests 170 Million Shares Of Geoprima Solusi, Pimsf Plans To Acquire Controlling Stake
body: Karnadi Margaka Sold 170 Million Shares Of Geoprima Solusi At Rp59 Per Share On 14 October 2025, Cutting Its Voting Stake From 52.49% To About 27%. Pimsf, Part Of Tjokro Group, Intends To Acquire Roughly 45.45% Of Geoprima Solusi From Karnadi, Becoming The New Controlling Shareholder After A Mandatory Tender Offer.

title: PT Morris Capital Indonesia Becomes New Controlling Shareholder Of PT Multi Makmur Lemindo Tbk And Plans Mandatory Tender Offer
body: PT Morris Capital Indonesia (Mci) Has Become The New Controlling Shareholder Of PT Multi Makmur Lemindo Tbk (Mci) After Signing A Cspa To Acquire 1.5 Billion Shares (≈43.78 % Of Paid‑Up Capital) And Plans A Mandatory Tender Offer For Up To 1.626 Billion Shares (≈47.47 %) To Reach 96.35 % Ownership. The Tender Price Is Set At Rp21 Per Share, Based On The 90‑Day High Of Rp21 And An Average Purchase Price Of Rp10.60, While Mci Intends To Expand The Company Beyond Its Pipe Business Into Integrated Energy Distribution And Logistics.

title: Raymond Buys 100,000 Shares Of Tpia, Raising Ownership To 2.6 Million Amid Stock Decline
body: Raymond Purchased 100,000 Shares Of Tpia On October 9, 2025 At Rp7,750 Per Share, Boosting His Stake To 2.6 Million Shares (From 2.5 Million) And A 0.0001% Ownership. Tpia Shares Fell 4.01% On The Day To Rp7.175, And Have Dropped 6.82% Over The Week, 9.18% In The Month, And 16.57% Year‑To‑Date From Rp7,900 On September 15, 2025 And Rp8,600 On October 15, 2024.

title: PT Sepatu Bata Tbk. Shifts To Retail And Distribution After Ceasing In-House Production
body: PT Sepatu Bata Tbk. Has Officially Removed Footwear Manufacturing From Its Articles Of Association And Stopped Factory Operations In May 2024, Shifting Supply To Local Indonesian Producers To Improve Supply Chain Flexibility And Cost Efficiency. The Company Will Focus On Retail And Distribution, Optimizing Store Performance, Launching Exclusive Collections, Cutting Operating Costs, Expanding Digital Partnerships, And Monetizing Non‑Productive Assets To Restore Profitability And Sustain Long‑Term Growth Through 2027.

title: Director Hady Sutiono Resigns From PT Woori Finance Indonesia Tbk
body: Hady Sutiono Has Submitted His Resignation As Director Of PT Woori Finance Indonesia Tbk, Which The Company Accepted On October 13, 2025, With The Change Effective After An Extraordinary General Meeting; The Resignation Is Said To Have No Impact On The Company’s Operations Or Financial Condition, And Bpfi Shares Slipped 1.79% To Rp330 On Wednesday.
