title: Indonesia’S Ministry Of Forestry Partners Red White Village Cooperative To Boost Forest Farmers’ Income Through Market Access And Financing
body: At The 2025 National Forestry Extension Conference In Jakarta, Deputy Minister Rohmat Marzuki Announced That Forest Farmer Groups Will Supply Key Commodities Such As Honey, Coffee, And Spices To The Red White Village Cooperative, Which Already Operates Basic Goods Outlets, To Strengthen Local Economic Independence. The Ministry’s Extension Program, Involving 10,094 Forest Farmer Groups And 3,138 Civil Servant Extension Workers, Has Generated Rp2.9 Trillion In Economic Transactions, While The Social Forestry Program Has Contributed Rp1 Trillion In National Economic Value.

title: Indonesia To Release Funds For PT Pindad’S Maung Mv3 Production Once Capacity Is Ready
body: Indonesian Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Said That Funds Earmarked For Local Production Of PT Pindad’s Maung Mv3 Tactical Vehicle Will Be Released Only When The Company’s Production Capacity Is Ready, After Previous Allocations Were Returned. President Prabowo Subianto Urged Ministers To Switch To Maung Vehicles And Announced Land And Funding For A New Factory To Expand Domestic Vehicle Production.

title: Jakarta–Bandung Hsr Debt Talks To Avoid Delaying Jakarta–Surabaya Expansion
body: Coordinating Minister Agus Harimurti Yudhoyono Said Jakarta–Bandung High‑Speed Rail Debt Must Not Impede The Planned Jakarta–Surabaya Expansion, While Negotiations With Danantara Indonesia, The Finance Ministry, And PT Kereta Api Indonesia Continue To Resolve The $7.27 Billion Project’s Debt. The Government Is Exploring Options Such As Government Takeover Of Infrastructure Or New Capital Injection, With President Prabowo Subianto’s Advice Sought To Move Forward.

title: Pp Properti Reports Significant Losses And Reduced Net Loss In 2025
body: Pp Properti Reported A Net Loss Of Rp47.25 Billion For 2025, A Sharp Decline From Rp723.07 Billion A Year Earlier, While Revenue Fell 19.74% To Rp230.97 Billion. The Company’s Equity Rose To Rp11.78 Trillion From Rp2.19 Trillion, And Its Net Loss Per Share Fell To Rp0.63 From Rp12.22.

title: Surge, Via PT Telemedia'S 1.4 Ghz Win, Positions Itself To Accelerate Indonesia’S Fixed‑Bandwidth Revolution With 5G Fwa Rollout
body: Surge, Through Its Subsidiary PT Telemedia’s Recent 1.4 Ghz Frequency Auction Win, Plans To Launch The World’s First 5G Fixed‑Wireless Access (Fwa) Service In Regional 1, Targeting 54 Million Households With A 100 Mbps Plan At Rp 100,000/Month And Free Modem Rental. Deloitte Research Forecasts Indonesia’s Fixed‑Bandwidth Market To Grow From A 7 % Cagr To An Exponential 57 % Cagr For 5G Fwa By 2030, With Potential To Reach Nearly 40 Million Households By That Year.

title: PT Jhonlin Agro Raya Tbk Chosen To Support Indonesia’S Mandatory B50 Biodiesel Program, Boosting Cpo Demand
body: The Government Aims To Halt Diesel Imports By 2026 By Mandating A 50% Palm Oil‑Based Biodiesel (B50), Which Could Save About Usd10.84 Billion And Increase Domestic Cpo Demand, And PT Jhonlin Agro Raya Tbk Has Been Selected To Help Implement The Program. Analysts View This As A Positive Catalyst For The Company’s Earnings And Note Strong Technical Support Levels Around 2,500‑2,580 With Upside Potential Toward The 9,600 Level.

title: Pefindo Assigns Stable Ida Rating To PT Tbs Energi Utama Tbk, Citing Diversified Business And Conservative Capital Structure
body: Pefindo’s Analysts Gave PT Tbs Energi Utama Tbk A Stable Ida Rating For The Company, Its Bonds And Sukuk Wakalah I, Highlighting Its Diversified Operations, Conservative Capital Structure And Strong New‑Business Profile While Noting Risks From New Project Development And Commodity Price Volatility. The Rating Could Be Upgraded If Upcoming Projects Generate Higher‑Than‑Expected Revenue And Margins, But May Be Downgraded If They Underperform, Debt Financing Intensifies, Or Project Delays Occur.

title: PT Sentra Investa Maksima Buy Shares of PT Lavender Bina Cendikia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 22, 2025 (WIB), PT Sentra Investa Maksima bought shares of PT Lavender Bina Cendikia Tbk (BMBL.JK) at approximately IDR 49, increasing holdings from 111,460,000 to 111,480,100. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Futura Energi Global Tbk Signs Mou For 130 Mw Bali Solar Project, Shares Rise 17.24%
body: PT Futura Energi Global Tbk Signed A Memorandum Of Understanding With Zhejiang Energy Pv-Tech Co., Ltd And PT Hypec International On 21 October 2025 To Develop A 130 Mw Solar Power Plant In Bali, Which Is Currently Under Study And Does Not Constitute An Affiliate Or Conflict‑Of‑Interest Transaction Under Pojk No.42/Pojk.04/2020. The Announcement Coincided With The Company's Shares Gaining 17.24% (125 Points) To Rp850, And The Company Said The Deal Has No Immediate Impact On Operations, Legal Matters, Financial Condition, Or Business Continuity.

title: PT Batavia Prosperindo Internasional Tbk Approves Cancellation Of 425.8 Million Treasury Shares, Reducing Paid‑Up Capital To Approx. Rp531.5 Bn
body: PT Batavia Prosperindo Internasional Tbk Held An Extraordinary Shareholders Meeting On 20 Oct 2025 Where Shareholders Representing 89.86% Of Voting Rights Unanimously Approved The Withdrawal And Cancellation Of 425,828,000 Treasury Shares, Lowering The Company's Issued And Paid‑Up Capital To 10,309,973,240 Shares. The Nominal Value Per Share Is Rp51.55, Resulting In A Total Paid‑Up Capital Of About Rp531.5 Billion, And The Board And Commissioner Lineup Remains Unchanged With Rudy Setiadi Tjahjono As President Director, Luo Xude As Director, And Rudy Johansen As Commissioner, Supported By Irena Istary Iskandar And Paulin Angeline.

title: Indonesia And South Africa Explore Preferential Trade Agreement To Strengthen Economic Ties
body: Presidents Prabowo Subianto And Cyril Ramaphosa Announced That Indonesia And South Africa Are Considering A Preferential Trade Agreement Or Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, Citing Significant Trade Growth Over The Past Five Years. The Leaders Also Discussed Cooperation In Defense, Agriculture, Energy, And People‑To‑People Exchanges, And Ramaphosa Attended A Business Forum To Identify Concrete Ways To Deepen Economic Collaboration.

title: Indonesia Launches Clean Indonesia National Movement To Tackle Waste By 2029
body: The Home Affairs Ministry And Environment Ministry Have Issued A Joint Decree To Implement The Clean Indonesia National Movement (Gnib), Aiming To Achieve Universal Household Waste Collection And Proper Handling Of 90% Of The Nation's Waste By 2029. The Initiative, Endorsed By President Prabowo Subianto, Will Mobilize Local Governments, Establish A National Task Force, And Develop An Action Plan With Regional Monitoring To Promote Cleanliness, Sanitation, And Visual Pollution Reduction.

title: Indonesia To Impose Penalties And Prison Sentences On Illegal Secondhand Clothing Importers To Protect Local Textile Industry
body: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa Announced That Indonesia Will Levy Financial Penalties And Prison Sentences On Illegal Secondhand Clothing And Bag Importers, Aiming To Curb Smuggling And Support Domestic Textile Production. The Government Also Plans To Deploy An Ai‑Based Customs Monitoring System And Reported Customs Excise Revenue Of Rp221.3 Trillion, Reaching 73.4% Of Its Annual Target.

title: Young Indonesian Farmers Earn Up To Rp20 Million Monthly As Government Promotes Tech-Driven Agriculture
body: Agriculture Minister Andi Amran Sulaiman Announced That Roughly 27,000 Young Farmers Are Now Earning Between Rp15 Million And Rp20 Million Per Month, A Figure Well Above The National Average, Thanks To Government Grants And Modern Farming Equipment. The Ministry Plans To Expand This Trend By Developing Three Million Hectares Of New Rice Fields Using Advanced Technology And Cluster-Based Farming Systems.

title: Indonesia'S Transportation Minister Announces 13‑14% Airfare Reduction For Christmas And New Year Holidays
body: Minister Dudy Purwagandhi Announced A 13‑14% Cut In Domestic Economy‑Class Airfares From December 22, 2025 To January 10, 2026, Supported By A Ministerial Decree And Finance Regulation That Lower Fuel Surcharges, Vat, And Airport Service Fees. The Reduction Aims To Boost Household Consumption And Maintain Interregional Connectivity During The Holiday Season.

title: Ihsg Weakens 1.04% To 8,152.55 As Analysts Forecast Further Decline
body: The Jakarta Composite Index Fell 85.53 Points To 8,152.55 On Wednesday, With Analysts Predicting A Continued Slide Toward 7,950–8,100 On Thursday. Investors Are Advised To Accumulate Shares Of Mbma, Mdka, And Medc, While Other Stocks Such As Adro, Klbf, And Tbla Are Highlighted For Potential Gains.

title: PT Tiga Inti Digital Launches Dynamic Leverage Feature On Triv Futures
body: PT Tiga Inti Digital Has Introduced A Dynamic Leverage Option On Its Triv Futures Platform, Allowing Traders To Adjust Leverage From 1X To 25X In Real Time Without Opening New Positions, Thereby Enhancing Risk Control And Flexibility. Founder And Ceo Gabriel Rey Highlighted That The Feature Empowers Traders To Adapt Quickly To Market Dynamics And Optimize Profit Potential While Maintaining Risk Tolerance.

title: Bursa Efek Indonesia Suspends Trading Of PT Puri Global Sukses Tbk Amid Rapid Share Price Surge
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange Has Suspended Trading Of PT Puri Global Sukses Tbk Starting The Next Trading Session To Curb An Aggressive Price Spike, With The Company’s Shares Having Risen 32.12% (848 Points) To Rp362 And A 89.13% Increase Over The Past Month. The Move Aims To Protect Investors And Allow Market Participants To Reassess Their Investment Decisions.

title: Bni Integrates Umkm Stalls And Qris Digital Payments At The Wondr Bni Indonesia Masters 2025 Badminton Tournament
body: PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. (Bni) Used Its Sponsorship Of The Wondr Bni Indonesia Masters 2025 To Host A Culinary And Handicraft Area For Local Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises, Featuring Vendors Such As Bakso Makiji, Cireng Raos, Café Tenank, Medan Bah, And Zulaika. The Umkm Zone Operated Entirely On Bni Qris Through The Wondr Bni App, Highlighting The Bank's Role In Promoting Regional Economic Empowerment And Digitalization.

title: Nusantara Sawit Reports 309.3% Increase In Net Profit To Rp554.12 Billion For Q3 2025
body: For The Period Ending 30 September 2025, Nusantara Sawit Posted Net Profit Of Rp554.12 Billion, Up 309.3% From Rp135.38 Billion A Year Earlier, While Revenue Rose 56.84% To Rp1.49 Trillion. Total Equity Climbed To Rp1.91 Trillion, Total Assets Increased To Rp4.12 Trillion, And Liabilities Fell To Rp2.2 Trillion.

title: Unilever Indonesia Reports Q3 2025 Earnings Of Rp3.33 Trillion, Up 11% Yoy
body: The Company Posted A Net Profit Of Rp3.33 Trillion For The Quarter, An 11% Increase From The Same Period Last Year, While Net Sales Grew Modestly To Rp27.61 Trillion. Earnings Per Share Rose To Rp87 From Rp79, And Total Assets Climbed To Rp17.49 Trillion Against Liabilities Of Rp14.13 Trillion, Boosting Equity To Rp3.35 Trillion.

title: Impack Pratama Industri, Marubeni Indonesia, And Dnp Indonesia Partner To Convert Plastic Waste Into Sustainable Building Materials
body: Impack Pratama Industri Has Teamed With Marubeni Indonesia And Dnp Indonesia Through Its Subsidiary Sirkular Karya Indonesia To Convert Plastic Waste From Dnp’s Facilities Into Durable, Recyclable Building Products Under The Alduro Roof And Alduro Board Brands, Aiming To Reduce Plastic Pollution And Support Indonesia’s 2019 Waste Reduction Roadmap. The Partnership Also Opens Opportunities For Exporting Green Building Materials To Global Markets.

title: Pp Presisi Reports Net Profit Of Rp104.97 Billion For Jan‑Sep 2025, Up 1,266% From Same Period Last Year
body: Pp Presisi Posted A Net Profit Of Rp104.97 Billion For The First Nine Months Of 2025, A 1,266% Jump From Rp7.68 Billion In The Same Period Last Year, While Earnings Per Share Rose To Rp10.27 From Rp0.75. Total Revenue Reached Rp2.77 Trillion, Up 2.21% From Rp2.71 Trillion, And The Company’s Equity Increased To Rp3.66 Trillion Against Assets Of Rp7.93 Trillion.

title: Emiten Boy Thohir Reports 36.53% Decline In Net Profit To Usd 21.3 Million For Q3 2025, While Maintaining Strong Operational Safety And Pursuing Low‑Carbon Ammonia Transformation
body: Emiten Boy Thohir Posted A 36.53% Decline In Net Profit To Usd 21.3 Million For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, With Revenue Falling 12.93% To Usd 200.35 Million And Eps Dropping To Usd 1.237. Despite The Downturn, The Company Maintained A 99.7% Plant Availability, Achieved 113% Ammonia Utilisation, Remains Debt‑Free, And Is Advancing A Low‑Carbon Ammonia Transformation Targeting 1 Million Tonnes Of Co₂ Capture Annually.

title: Petrosea Reports 142% Increase In Net Profit To Usd 6.93M For Q3 2025
body: Petrosea Reported A Net Profit Of Usd 6.93 Million For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, Up 142.3% From Usd 2.86 Million A Year Earlier, While Revenue Rose 18.42% To Usd 603.84 Million. Despite Higher Cost Of Goods Sold And Interest Expenses, Gross Profit Climbed To Usd 73.75 Million, Accumulated Equity Reached Usd 270.1 Million, And Earnings Per Share Fell To Usd 0.0007.

title: Henan Putihrai Sekuritas Raises PT Petrosea Tbk Target Price To Rp10,000, Citing Acquisition-Driven Growth And Expanding Epc Margins
body: The Broker Lifted Its Price Target From Rp4,500 To Rp10,000 (Buy) With A 45.5% Upside, Highlighting Recent Acquisitions Of 100% Of Hbs Limited, 51% Of Hafar Group And The Pending Majority Stake In Scan-Bilt Pte Ltd, And Projecting Epc Contribution To Rise To 7% Of Revenue By 2026‑2030; PT Petrosea Reported H1‑2025 Revenue Up 10.4% To $351.1 Million, Operating Profit Up 114.5% To $30.2 Million, But Net Profit Fell 18.6% To $1.1 Million Due To Higher Interest And Tax Expenses.

title: PT Astra Otoparts Tbk Appoints Djangkep Budhi Santoso As Independent Commissioner At Extraordinary Shareholders Meeting
body: At An Extraordinary General Meeting On 20 October 2025, Attended By Shareholders Holding 88.75% Of Voting Rights, PT Astra Otoparts Tbk Approved The Appointment Of Djangkep Budhi Santoso As An Independent Commissioner Until The 2027 Annual Shareholders Meeting. The Board Of Directors Remains Unchanged, With Hamdani Dzulkarnaen Salim Continuing As President Director.

title: PT Dci Indonesia Tbk Reports 83% Jump In Nine‑Month Net Profit To Rp825.09 Bn, Driven By Revenue Surge
body: PT Dci Indonesia Tbk Posted Net Profit Of Rp825.09 Billion For The Nine Months Ended 30 September 2025, Up 83.4% Year‑On‑Year, On Revenue Of Rp1.92 Trillion (‑74.4% Increase) And Operating Profit Of Rp999.35 Billion. Total Assets Rose 18.1% To Rp5.69 Trillion, Equity To Rp3.83 Trillion, Eps To Rp346, And The Shares Traded At Rp279,650, Up 0.63% On The Day.

title: Hasmoro Buy Shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 22, 2025 (WIB), Hasmoro bought shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk (HEAL.JK) at approximately IDR 1,500, increasing holdings from 743,197,089 to 743,297,089. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Yentoro Buy Shares of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 23, 2025 (WIB), Yentoro bought shares of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk (JAST.JK) at approximately IDR 83, increasing holdings from 44,733,300 to 44,783,300. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia'S Mineral And Coal Directorate General Emphasizes Integrity And Systemic Reform In Mining Governance
body: Siti Sumilah Rita Susilo, Secretary Of The Directorate General Of Mineral And Coal, Highlighted The Need For Integrity And Systemic Reforms To Restore Public Trust In The Mining Sector, Outlining Steps Such As Digitalizing Licensing And Reporting, Strengthening Internal Audits With Independent Oversight, And Fostering Anti-Corruption Training For Staff. She Called For Cross‑Agency Collaboration, Including With The Corruption Eradication Commission And Financial Oversight Bodies, To Build A Sustainable, Transparent Governance Framework Aligned With Article 33 Of The 1945 Constitution.

title: Bank Indonesia Holds Benchmark Interest Rate At 4.75% – Lowest Since October 2022
body: Bank Indonesia, Under Governor Perry Warjiyo, Kept Its Benchmark Interest Rate (Bi Rate) At 4.75%, The Lowest Level Since October 2022, After Six Cuts Totaling 150 Basis Points Since September 2024. The Central Bank Also Reinforced Rupiah Stability Through Market Interventions, Expanded Liquidity, And Government Securities Purchases Totaling Rp268.36 Trillion As Part Of Its Policy Mix.

title: Indonesia To Build Seven New Fertilizer Plants With Rp50 Trillion Budget To Boost Self‑Sufficiency
body: The Indonesian Government Will Construct Seven Modern Fertilizer Factories Over The Next Five Years, With A Development Budget Of About Rp50 Trillion, Aiming To Cut Production Costs And Increase Subsidized Output To 700,000 Tons By 2029. PT Pupuk Indonesia Is Expected To See Profits Rise To Rp2.5 Trillion In 2026, With Total Revenue Projected At Rp7.5 Trillion, As Part Of Broader Reforms That Have Already Saved Rp10 Trillion And Reduced Fertilizer Production Costs By 26%.

title: Indonesia Deputy Minister Calls For Tobacco Regulation To Prioritize Workers' Welfare Amid Industry Changes
body: Deputy Minister Manpower Afriansyah Noor Urged That New Tobacco Industry Regulations Must Protect Workers And Farmers, Ensuring Benefits And Social Protection For Those Potentially Laid Off, And Suggested Allocating Cigarette Excise Tax Funds To Support Affected Workers. He Also Emphasized The Need For Coordinated Policy Across Ministries To Safeguard Labor‑Intensive Sectors As The Industry Shifts Toward Electric Cigarettes.

title: Indonesia Launches Garuda Spark To Cultivate 2 Million Tech Entrepreneurs
body: The Ministry Of Communication And Digital Affairs Announced Garuda Spark, A Digital Innovation Ecosystem Aimed At Nurturing 2 Million Technology-Based Entrepreneurs Nationwide, With Hubs In Bandung, Jakarta, Aceh, And Medan To Provide Co‑Working Spaces, Training, Mentorship, And Financing. The Program Seeks To Boost Local Economies, Create Jobs, And Expand Indonesia’s Digital Ecosystem Beyond Java.

title: Martin Suharlie Buy Shares of PT M Cash Integrasi Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 22, 2025 (WIB), Martin Suharlie bought shares of PT M Cash Integrasi Tbk (MCAS.JK) at approximately IDR 827, increasing holdings from 69,460,300 to 69,753,600. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Yentoro Buy Shares of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 23, 2025 (WIB), Yentoro bought shares of PT Jasnita Telekomindo Tbk (JAST.JK) at approximately IDR 83, increasing holdings from 44,733,300 to 44,783,300. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Adhi Karya Tbk Addresses Dki Jakarta Monorail Pole Dismantling Amid Legal And Financial Review
body: PT Adhi Karya Tbk’s Corporate Secretary Rozi Sparta Confirmed That The Company Is In Talks With The Dki Jakarta Provincial Government To Legally Support The Planned Cleaning And Dismantling Of A 20‑Year‑Old Monorail Pole In The Rasuna Said And Senayan Area, With The Final Scheme Still Under Discussion With Stakeholders. The Company Reports A Q3 2025 Contract Value Of Rp 6.5 Trillion, Long‑Term Inventory Of Rp 52.68 Billion, And Is Reviewing Impairment Of The Ex‑Monorail Pole Assets, Noting That The Dismantling Will Not Materially Affect Its Business Or Share Price, While Ptpp Is Expected To Become An Existing Entity After A Merger With Adhi By 2026.

title: Garuda Indonesia To Issue 124.26 Billion Shares And Receive Rp5.66 Trillion Asset Injection From Api
body: Garuda Indonesia Will Conduct A Right Issue Of Up To 124.26 Billion Shares With A Nominal Value Of Rp25, To Be Priced Later, And Will Receive A Non‑Cash Capital Injection Of Rp5.66 Trillion In Land Assets From Api, Which Will Be Used To Strengthen Operations And Equity. The Extraordinary General Meeting Is Scheduled For 24 October 2025, And The Transaction Is Expected To Improve The Company’s Financial Position While Maintaining Garuda’s Control.

title: Adhi Karya Reports 93.62% Decline In Net Income To Rp4.42 Billion For The Period Ending 30 September 2025
body: Adhi Karya Posted A Net Loss Of Rp4.42 Billion For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, A 93.62% Decline From Rp69.32 Billion A Year Earlier, While Revenue Fell 38.31% To Rp5.65 Trillion. The Company’s Equity Rose To Rp9.7 Trillion, But Total Assets And Liabilities Decreased To Rp33.62 Trillion And Rp23.92 Trillion, Respectively.

title: Darmawan Suryadi Increases Stake In Jaya To 19.8% After Buying 2.22 Million Shares
body: On 20‑21 Oct 2025, Darmawan Suryadi, Controlling Shareholder And Director Of PT Armada Berjaya Trans Tbk, Bought 2,222,800 Shares Of Jaya At Rp99‑101 Per Share, Valued At Roughly Rp222.28 Million, Raising His Holding To 158,088,530 Shares (19.8%). Management Said The Purchase Is A Direct‑Ownership Investment, And Jaya’s Share Price Rose 1.96% To Rp104.

title: Indonesia Cuts Subsidized Fertilizer Prices By 20% To Boost Farmer Welfare
body: The Indonesian Government Announced A 20% Reduction In Subsidized Fertilizer Prices, Effective Wednesday, And Plans To Increase The Volume Of Subsidized Fertilizer By 700,000 Tons Through 2029. Pupuk Indonesia Has Prepared 1,127,919 Tons Of Subsidized Fertilizer, And The Move, Supported By Streamlined Distribution And Administrative Reforms, Aims To Improve Farmer Productivity And Welfare As Part Of President Prabowo Subianto’s Food Self‑Sufficiency Strategy.

title: Indonesia Accelerates Green Investment With New Biomethane Policies
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Energy Mineral Resources Has Issued New Regulations To Strengthen The National Biomethane Sector, Including A Standard Industrial Classification And Investment Guidelines Developed In Partnership With Germany’s Explore Project. The Policies Align With The Indonesia‑European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, Aiming To Boost Green Investment And Position Indonesia As A Key Player In The Regional Green Economy.

title: PT Adhi Karya Tbk Reports 93.62% Yoy Decline In Q3 2025 Profit To Rp 4.42 Billion
body: PT Adhi Karya Tbk’s Q3 2025 Profit Fell 93.62% Year‑Over‑Year To Rp 4.42 Billion, After A 38.28% Yoy Revenue Decline To Rp 5.65 Trillion. The Company’s Gross Profit Dropped 3.46% To Rp 833.65 Billion, While Its Equity Rose Slightly To Rp 9.7 Trillion And Cash Fell To Rp 1.46 Trillion.

title: PT Infiniti Wahana Sell Shares of Steady Safe Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 23, 2025 (WIB), PT Infiniti Wahana sold shares of Steady Safe Tbk (SAFE.JK) at approximately IDR 185, decreasing holdings from 247,466,713 to 246,556,613. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia'S Esdm Implements Digital Rka/B System For Mining Sector Via New Regulations
body: The Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources (Esdm) Has Enacted Permen Esdm No. 17/2025 And Kepmen Esdm No. 341/2025 To Mandate That All Mining Permits Submit Their Rka/B Through The Integrated Digital Platform Minerbaone, Tightening Production Controls And Streamlining Approvals With An Automated 8‑Day Decision Window. These Measures Aim To Enhance Transparency, Efficiency, And State Revenue In The Mining Sector.

title: PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (Bni) Reports Solid Q3 2025 Performance With Strong Capital, Asset Quality, And Digital Growth
body: PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (Bni) Posted A Solid Q3 2025 With A 21.1% Capital Adequacy Ratio, 2.0% Non‑Performing Loan Ratio, And A 10.5% Credit Growth To Rp812.2 Trillion. Its Digital Transaction Banking And Fee‑Based Income Grew 11% Yoy, Supported By A 21.4% Rise In Third‑Party Deposits And A 13.3% Increase In Casa.

title: Mohamad Jusuf Hamka Acquires Over 5% Stake In Citra Marga, Reaching 8.90% Ownership
body: Hamka, Assisted By Profindo Sekuritas Indonesia And Bank Hsbc Indonesia, Accumulated 564,967,100 Shares Of Citra Marga As Of 22 October 2025, Raising His Ownership To 8.90% And Valuing The Transaction At Roughly Rp757.05 Billion Based On A Share Price Of Rp1,340. Bp2S Sg/Bnp Paribas And The Public Hold 59.68% And 40.32% Of The Company, Respectively.

title: Bintraco Dharma Reports A Slight Decline In Net Profit To Rp135.01 Billion For Q3 2025, With Revenue Falling 23.95% To Rp3.46 Trillion.
body: Net Profit Decreased 1.35% To Rp135.01 Billion, And Basic Earnings Per Share Were Adjusted To Rp9 From Rp9.13. Total Revenue Fell 23.95% To Rp3.46 Trillion, Largely Due To A Drop In Automotive Sales To Rp3.41 Trillion And Consumer Financing To Rp941.41 Thousand, While Other Income Surged To Rp110.79 Billion.

title: Medikaloka Hermina Reports 23.95% Decline In Net Profit To Rp356.01 Billion For Q3 2025
body: Medikaloka Hermina’s Net Profit For The Period Ending 30 September 2025 Dropped 23.95% To Rp356.01 Billion, With Earnings Per Share Falling To Rp23.67 From Rp31.58. Revenue Rose To Rp5.28 Trillion, But Gross Profit And Operating Profit Fell, While Total Equity Climbed To Rp7.13 Trillion And Total Assets Increased To Rp11.8 Trillion.

title: Fore Kopi Indonesia Reports 41.94% Rise In Net Profit To Rp60.1 Billion For Q3 2025, Driven By Expanded Store Network.
body: For The Period Ending 30 September 2025, Fore Kopi Indonesia Posted Net Profit Of Rp60.1 Billion, Up 41.94% From Rp42.34 Billion A Year Earlier, While Net Sales Rose 44.44% To Rp1.04 Trillion. Operating Profit Increased To Rp65.25 Billion, And Total Equity Surged To Rp651.46 Billion, Reflecting The Company’s Growth Amid Dynamic Economic Conditions.

title: Diamond Citra Reports Record Q3 2025 Earnings, Net Profit Soars 1,133% To Rp853.03 Million, While Shares Plunge 71.9% To Rp50
body: Diamond Citra Posted A Q3 2025 Net Profit Of Rp853.03 Million, A 1,133% Jump From Rp69.15 Million In The Same Period Last Year, With Revenue Reaching Rp9.05 Billion, Up 137.53%. Despite The Earnings Surge, The Stock Fell 71.91% To Rp50 After An Auto‑Reject, Following A 128‑Point Drop From The October 8 Close Of Rp178.

title: Indonesia Reinstates Annual Rkbk And Digitalizes Mining Permits Via Minerbaone To Strengthen Oversight
body: The Directorate General Of Mineral And Coal, Led By Tri Winarno, Announced That The Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Will Return To An Annual Rencana Kerja Dan Anggaran Biaya (Rkbk) Cycle, Supported By The Fully Integrated Digital Service Minerbaone, To Improve Data Accuracy, Risk Management, And Transparency. The New System Introduces A Simplified Evaluation Matrix, Automatic Approvals After Eight Working Days, And A Transition Period Until March 31, 2026, While Stakeholders Praise The Streamlined Process And Enhanced Investor Confidence.

title: PT Antareja Mahada Makmur Sell Shares of Darma Henwa Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 23, 2025 (WIB), PT Antareja Mahada Makmur sold shares of Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA.JK) at approximately IDR 75, decreasing holdings from 3,954,823,266 to 3,000,000,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Bambang Subagio Wiyono Buy Shares of Paragon Karya Perkasa Tbk
body: Bambang Subagio Wiyono acquired 134800 shares of Paragon Karya Perkasa Tbk, increasing ownership from 2285000 to 2419800 shares. The buy transaction was made for investment purposes, with prices ranging from 540 to 545.

title: Indonesia Launches Access Boost Program To Expand Financing For Medium Enterprises
body: Indonesia's Ministry Of Micro, Small, And Medium Enterprises Has Launched The Access Boost Program To Expand Financing Opportunities For Medium Enterprises, Aiming To Boost Competitiveness And Support Economic Growth. The Program Will Provide Up To Rp20 Billion In Financing Through Banks, Fintech, Crowdfunding, And Capital Markets Via Accescapital.Id, And Will Involve Collaboration With The Financial Services Authority, Financial Institutions, Consultants, Msme Associations, Communities, And Business Networks.

title: Mark Dynamics Reports Q3 2025 Net Profit Of Rp204.12 Billion
body: Mark Dynamics Posted A Net Profit Of Rp204.12 Billion For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, A 7.69% Decline From Rp221.13 Billion In The Same Period Last Year, While Earnings Per Share Fell To Rp53.72 From Rp58.19. Revenue Slid 14.81% To Rp594.67 Billion, And Operating Profit Dropped To Rp253.22 Billion From Rp285.08 Billion, Though Total Assets Rose To Rp980.32 Billion.

title: Sari Kreasi Boga Projects Stronger 2025 Growth As Government Nutrition Program Boosts Food And Beverage Raw Material Demand
body: Sari Kreasi Boga (Skb) Announced A 5–10% Industry Growth Target For 2025, Expanding Distribution Hubs In Java, Sumatra, And Kalimantan And Launching Fresh Fish Under The Eskabeh Food Brand, While Its 2024 Revenue Rose 43.03% To Rp582.84 Billion, Though A Rp15.66 Billion Net Loss Was Reported. The Company Remains Optimistic That Its Aggressive Expansion, Partnership With PT Sumber Asri Sejahtera And PT Lazizaa Rahmat Semesta, And Focus On Triple‑Bottom‑Line Sustainability Will Support A Positive 2025 Performance And Contribute To National Food Security.

title: PT Arwana Citramulia Tbk Announces Up To Rp50 Billion Share Buyback From Oct 24, 2025 To Jan 23, 2026
body: PT Arwana Citramulia Tbk (Arna) Plans A Buyback Of Up To Rp50 Billion, To Be Executed On The Indonesia Stock Exchange Without Rups Approval, With A Maximum Transaction Cost Of 0.2057 % Per Trade. The Buyback Is Expected To Reduce Total Assets From Rp2.586 Trillion To Rp2.536 Trillion And Equity From Rp1.755 Trillion To Rp1.705 Trillion, While Eps Is Projected To Rise From Rp28.94 To Rp29.29, With No Significant Impact On Revenue Or Operations.

title: Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk. Reports 10.6% Yoy Net Profit Growth To Rp2.3 Trillion In Q3 2025
body: Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk. (Btn) Posted A Net Profit Of Rp2.3 Trillion For The First Nine Months Of 2025, Up 10.6% Year‑On‑Year, Driven By An 18.8% Rise In Credit Interest Income To Rp26.57 Trillion And A 43.5% Increase In Net Interest Income To Rp12.76 Trillion, While Maintaining A 3.9% Net Interest Margin And Reducing The Cost‑To‑Income Ratio To 47.8%. The Bank Also Achieved An 11.18% Yoy Growth In Total Deposits, Supported By Low‑Cost Retail Deposits And Increased Third‑Party Funding, And Its App‑Based Transactions Helped Strengthen Liquidity.

title: PT Optima Prima Metal Sinergi Tbk Expands Into Food And Beverage Sector With Strong Feasibility And Financial Outlook
body: PT Optima Prima Metal Sinergi Tbk (Opms) Has Announced A Diversification Into The Fast‑Moving Consumer Goods Sector, Backed By A Feasibility Study That Rates The Project As Market, Technical, Business, Management, And Financial Viable. The Study Projects An Irr Of 69 %, Npv Of Rp43.02 Billion, A Payback Period Of 2 Years 10 Months, And An Investment Of Rp3 Billion Funded Entirely From Internal Cash, While Opms Will Source Products From Major Producers Such As Indofood, Primsfood, And Emina Cheese.

title: Bambang Subagio Wiyono Buy Shares of PT Paragon Karya Perkasa Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Bambang Subagio Wiyono bought shares of PT Paragon Karya Perkasa Tbk (PKPK.JK) at approximately IDR 545, increasing holdings from 2,285,000 to 2,419,800. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Akr Corporindo Reports Q3 2025 Net Profit Of Rp1.65 Trillion, Up 13% From The Same Period Last Year
body: Akr Corporindo Posted A Q3 2025 Net Profit Of Rp1.65 Trillion, A 13% Increase From Rp1.46 Trillion In The Same Quarter Last Year, While Total Revenue Rose To Rp32.39 Trillion From Rp28.61 Trillion. The Company’s Basic Earnings Per Share Climbed To Rp83.50 From Rp74.39, And Total Assets Grew To Rp33.72 Trillion, Though Total Liabilities Increased To Rp19.16 Trillion.

title: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk Partners With Huawei Indonesia To Roll Out 5G Fixed Wireless Access
body: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk Announced A Strategic Collaboration With Huawei Indonesia To Deliver 5G Fixed Wireless Access Solutions On The 1.4 Ghz Band, Part Of Surge’s Two‑Year‑Old Initiative. The Partnership Aims To Build An End‑To‑End Ecosystem—Including Core Network, Radio, And Cpe—To Accelerate High‑Speed Broadband Availability And Reach Up To 5 Million Households Per Year.

title: Experts Warn Indonesia’S B50 Biodiesel Mandate Could Undermine Palm Oil Industry And Trade Balance
body: Prof. Bayu Krisnamurthi Of Bogor University And Researchers From Pranata Pembangunan Warn That Raising The Mandatory Biodiesel Blend From B40 To B50 Would Require An Additional 59 Million Tonnes Of Crude Palm Oil Per Year, Exceeding The 49.5 Million‑Tonne Production Forecast For 2025. This Could Reduce Exports, Raise Cooking‑Oil Prices By About 9 % And Erode Indonesia’s Trade Balance By Up To Rp190.5 Trillion In Lost Cpo Exports.

title: Indonesia’S 2025 Mineral And Coal Subsector Achieves Record Value‑Addition, Job Creation, And Regulatory Reforms
body: Under The Energy And Mineral Resources Ministry, Indonesia’s Mineral And Coal Subsector Recorded A 71.9% Contribution To The Sector’s Annual Target With Pnbp Of Rp100.2 Trillion, While The Inauguration Of PT Freeport Indonesia’s Gresik Gold Smelter And A 15 Gwh Electric‑Vehicle Battery Hub In Karawang Accelerated Domestic Value‑Addition. The Government Also Issued 18 Pre‑Feasibility Studies Worth Rp618 Trillion, Created 276,000 Direct Jobs (67% Outside Java), And Prioritized Mining Permits For Cooperatives, Smes, And Religious Organizations Under Regulation No. 39/2025, Alongside Enforcement Actions To Secure Reclamation Guarantees For 190 Permits.

title: Indonesia And Brazil Sign Mou To Expand Energy And Mining Cooperation
body: Indonesia’s Energy Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia And Brazil’s Mines Energy Minister Alexandre Silveira Signed A Memorandum Of Understanding In Jakarta, With Presidents Prabowo Subianto And Luiz Inácio Lula Da Silva In Attendance, To Deepen Collaboration Across Oil, Gas, Renewable Energy, Bioenergy, And Mineral Resource Management. The Agreement Aims To Promote Technology Transfer, Joint Projects, And Human‑Resource Development, Leveraging Indonesia’s Nickel And Brazil’s Niobium Production And Brazil’s Leading Ethanol Industry.

title: Indonesia Designates Seven Geothermal Zones On Flores Island With 120 Mw Potential
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Has Earmarked Seven Geothermal Working Areas On Flores Island—Ulumbu, Wae Sano, Mataloko, Sokoria, Oka Ile Ange, Atadei, And Nage—Totaling An Estimated 120 Mw Of Capacity, With Pln Directly Overseeing 60 Mw Of That Output. The Move Aims To Boost Local Electricity Supply And Advance The Country’s Clean Energy Transition.

title: Energi Mega Persada Completes Usd4.3 Million Transaction With Emp Energi Gendawa, Bina Mitra Artha Consortium, And Energi Drilling Utama
body: On 23 October 2025, Energi Mega Persada Finalized A Usd4.3 Million Transaction Involving Emp Energi Gendawa, The Bina Mitra Artha Consortium, And Energi Drilling Utama, With Gdw Acting As The Employer And The Bma - Edu Consortium Providing 350 Hp Land Rigs For 24 Months. The Deal, Which Includes A 99 % Stake In Gdw And Edu And Is Fully Owned By The Bakrie Group, Is Said To Have No Adverse Effect On The Company’s Operations, Legal Standing, Financial Condition, Or Continuity As A Public Company, According To Edoardus Ardianto, Energi Mega’s Deputy Ceo.

title: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Seeks Shareholder Approval For $100M Offshore Vessel Purchase, Including A Convertible Promissory Note To Hilong Shipping Holding Limited
body: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk Plans To Buy The Offshore Vessel Hai Long 106 For Usd 100 Million, Financing Part Of The Deal With A Usd 55 Million Promissory Note That Includes A 3 % Annual Interest Rate And A 60‑Month Conversion Option To Hilong Shipping Holding Limited. The Deal Has Sparked Speculation That Hilong Could Become A New Shareholder Through A Backdoor Listing, Potentially Coinciding With A Planned Rights Issue, While The Transaction Is Expected To Lift The Company’s Assets From Rp317.56 Billion To Rp1.947 Trillion.

title: Puri Sentul Permai Expands Business Line With Launch Of Fu Padel Sports And Lifestyle Hub
body: Puri Sentul Permai Has Unveiled Fu Padel, A Modern Padel And Lifestyle Facility Designed To Complement Its Kedaton 8 Sentul Hotel And Enhance Its Hospitality, Recreation, And Lifestyle Portfolio, Aiming To Boost Visitor Traffic And Create Added Value For Stakeholders. The Initiative, Highlighted By Director Irene Nursalim, Is Part Of The Company’s Diversification Strategy To Strengthen Fundamentals And Deliver Sustainable Returns To Investors.

title: Rudi Reksa Sutantra Transaction Shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Rudi Reksa Sutantra transaction shares of PT Atlantis Subsea Indonesia Tbk (ATLA.JK) at approximately IDR 75, increasing holdings from 3,077,511,400 to 3,078,011,400. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk Signs Agreement To Acquire Exxonmobil'S Esso Retail Fuel Network In Singapore
body: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk Announced The Signing Of A Sale And Purchase Agreement To Acquire Exxonmobil's Esso-Branded Retail Fuel Stations In Singapore Through A Special Purpose Vehicle, While Retaining The Esso Brand, Loyalty Program And Staff. The Company Reported A Net Profit Of Usd1.6 Billion And Revenue Of Usd2.9 Billion In The First Half Of 2025, And The Acquisition Is Pending Regulator Approval With Completion Targeted For The End Of 2025.

title: Bakrie Metalindustries, PT Buy Shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Bakrie Metalindustries, PT bought shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk (VKTR.JK) at approximately IDR 270, increasing holdings from 6,763,027,600 to 6,786,046,100. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Bakrie Metalindustries, PT Buy Shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Bakrie Metalindustries, PT bought shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk (VKTR.JK) at approximately IDR 270, increasing holdings from 6,786,046,100 to 6,796,628,500. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buy Shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Patrick Rudolf Dannacher bought shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) at approximately IDR 1,265, increasing holdings from 176,956,620 to 180,212,120. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Director Bambang Subagio Increases Stake In PT Paragon Karya Perkasa Tbk
body: On October 22-23, 2025, Bambang Subagio Purchased 134,800 Pkpk Shares At Roughly Rp540‑Rp545 Each, Raising His Total Holding To 2.41 Million Shares (0.20% Of The Float) From 2.28 Million (0.19%). The Pkpk Share Price Fell 1.8% To Rp540 On The Same Day.

title: PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa Sell Shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa sold shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk (IMPC.JK) at approximately IDR 500, decreasing holdings from 24,274,395,000 to 23,120,395,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Nio Ing Tjung Buy Shares of Tifico Fiber Indonesia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Nio Ing Tjung bought shares of Tifico Fiber Indonesia Tbk (TFCO.JK) at approximately IDR 500, increasing holdings from 1,156,082 to 1,216,082. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya Buy Shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya bought shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK) at approximately IDR 1,320, increasing holdings from 99,777,900 to 99,834,800. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Sumber Garam Pratama Sell Shares of PT Sumber Garam Pratama
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), PT Sumber Garam Pratama sold shares of PT Sumber Garam Pratama (FOLK.JK) at approximately IDR 170, decreasing holdings from 1,246,180,419 to 1,048,773,345. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Bank Indonesia Launches Forward‑Looking Credit Incentives To Boost Key Sectors Effective December 1, 2025
body: Bank Indonesia Will Implement A Forward‑Looking Macroprudential Liquidity Incentive Policy On December 1, 2025, Offering Up To 5% Of Third‑Party Funds To Banks That Meet Lending Commitments In Priority Sectors Such As Agriculture, Industry, Services, Construction, Real Estate, And Smes, While Also Providing Up To 0.5% Dpk Incentives For Banks That Quickly Adjust New Lending Rates. The Incentive Is Performance‑Based, Tied To Lending Growth Targets, And Will Be Adjusted If Banks Fail To Meet Commitments, With A Continued Emphasis On Maintaining Prudent Lending Practices.

title: Indonesia Intensifies Kpp Loan Program To Accelerate 3 Million House Construction
body: Indonesia 's Ministry Housing Settlements Announced That The Kpp Credit Program Will Be Expanded To Support Micro, Small, And Medium Enterprises In Building Or Renovating Homes, With Eligibility Requiring Indonesian Citizenship, A Minimum Six‑Month Business Operation, And No Negative Credit Records. The Program Targets 3 Million Houses And Offers Loans Secured By The Property Being Financed, With Additional Collateral Allowed Per Lender Policy.

title: Indonesia’S Environment Minister Announces January 2026 Start Of First Waste‑To‑Energy Plant Construction At Jatiwaringin Landfill
body: Environment Minister Hanif Faisol Nurofiq Said The Government Will Begin Construction Of Its First Waste‑To‑Energy Plant In January 2026 After Completing All Permits By Year‑End, With The Sovereign Wealth Fund Danantara Currently Qualifying Developers And Financing Each Plant At An Estimated Rp2‑3 Trillion. The Jatiwaringin Landfill In Greater Tangerang Meets Project Requirements, Providing At Least 1,000 Tons Of Waste, Water Supply, And Daily Electricity Generation.

title: Indonesia And Brazil Sign Memorandum To Strengthen Sanitary Phytosanitary Cooperation And Expand Farm Trade
body: The Indonesian Quarantine Agency And Brazil's Ministry Of Agriculture Livestock Signed A Memorandum Of Understanding At Jakarta's State Palace, Aiming To Enhance Sanitary And Phytosanitary Measures, Speed Up Product Certification, And Broaden Market Access For Agricultural, Livestock, And Seafood Products. The Agreement Also Seeks To Boost Bilateral Relations, Strengthen Biosafety Systems, And Align With Wto Sps Standards, With A Joint Working Group To Implement The Plan.

title: PT Jsi Sinergi Expands Into Silica Sand Production And Pursues 51% Acquisition Of PT Leyand Internasional Tbk
body: PT Jsi Sinergi Obtained A Mining Licence For Silica Sand On Pulau Singkep And Expects Full Production By Early 2027, Planning To Export 70% Of Output To China, India And South Korea While Also Processing The Sand In‑House. The Company Currently Holds 513,750,900 Shares (About 12.953%) Of PT Leyand Internasional Tbk And Aims To Increase Its Stake To 51%, After Which It Will Launch A Mandatory Tender Offer Under Ojk Regulation No. 9/2018.

title: PT Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia Tbk Approves Large Rights Issue And Charter Amendment, Receiving Rp5.66 Trillion Land Contribution From PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia
body: At Its Extraordinary Shareholders Meeting, PT Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia Tbk Approved A Rights Issue Of Up To 124.27 Billion B‑Shares At Rp25 Each And Amended Its Charter To Adjust The Capital Structure. The Proceeds And A Non‑Cash Contribution Of 972,123 M² Of Land At Soekarno‑Hatta Airport Valued At Rp5.66 Trillion From PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia Will Be Used As Working Capital, Projecting Equity To Shift From A Usd‑248.99 Million Deficit To A Usd 102.87 Million Surplus.

title: Australian Investor Shows Interest In PT Nusatama Berkah Tbk., Spurring Sharp Stock Rally
body: An Australian Entity Has Sent A Non‑Disclosure Agreement To PT Nusatama Berkah Tbk. To Explore Cooperation In Energy, Migas And Infrastructure, Adding To Earlier Interest From A Chinese Firm. The News Coincided With A 146.67% Weekly Surge In Ntbk Shares To About Rp148 (Up 34% In One Day With Over 190 Million Shares Bid), Which Analysts View As A Positive Signal But Caution That Continued Rally Depends On Transparency And Strong Financial Performance.

title: Bni Reports Strong Growth In Agen46 Transaction Volume And Fee Income In Q3 2025
body: PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. Atau Bni Recorded 79.81 Million Agen46 Transactions In The Third Quarter Of 2025, A 37.2% Year‑On‑Year Increase, While Fee‑Based Income Rose 18.9% Yoy And Casa Balances Grew 39.3% To Idr 5.5 Trillion. The Bank Also Expanded Its Agent Network To 226,143 Agents (Up 9.1% Yoy) And Announced A Self‑Registration Feature To Further Broaden Outreach.

title: Indonesia'S Umkm Export Program Generates $108.8 Million In Transactions In Jan‑Sep 2025
body: The Ministry Of Trade Reported That The Umkm Bisa Ekspor Program Recorded Usd 108.82 Million In Transactions (Usd 55.95 Million In Confirmed Purchase Orders And Usd 52.86 Million In Potential Deals) From 501 Business‑Matching Events Involving 1,013 Smes Between January And September 2025. The Program Showcased Products From Companies Such As PT Bio Konversi Indonesia, Cv Wellgroo Dinamika, PT Brana Wira Mandiri, Mamasoul Indonesia And PT Cerita Kreatif Kita At The 40Th Trade Expo, While The Trade Minister Highlighted New Export Market Agreements With The Eu, Eurasian Region And Tunisia.

title: PT Pp Reports 97.9% Drop In Net Profit For The First Nine Months Of 2025
body: PT Pp Posted A Net Profit Of Rp5.55 Billion For The First Nine Months Of 2025, A 97.92% Decline From Rp267.28 Billion A Year Earlier, With Earnings Per Share Falling To Rp1 From Rp43. Revenue Decreased 23% To Rp10.73 Trillion, While Total Assets Slipped To Rp55.52 Trillion And Equity Modestly Rose To Rp15.29 Trillion.

title: Gajah Tunggal Q3 2025 Net Profit Falls 20% To Idr 789.69 Bn Amid Slight Sales Decline And Higher Costs
body: In Q3 2025, Gajah Tunggal Reported Net Profit Of Idr 789.69 Billion, A 20% Decline From The Prior Year, With Earnings Per Share Dropping To Idr 226.6. Net Sales Slipped 2.38% To Idr 13.12 Trillion While Cost Of Goods Sold Rose, Reducing Gross Profit To Idr 2.49 Trillion, And Total Assets Increased To Idr 22.31 Trillion With Equity Reaching Idr 10.1 Trillion.

title: PT Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa Tbk. To Conduct Share Buyback Up To 10% Of Paid‑Up Capital Using Rp153.6 Billion Of Retained Earnings
body: The Company Will Repurchase Up To 10% Of Its Outstanding Shares, Not Exceeding The 7.5% Minimum Free Float, Using Rp153.6 Billion Of Retained Earnings From A Previous Buyback, With The Program Running From 23 Oct 2025 To 16 Mar 2026. Management Says The Buyback Will Not Materially Affect Pro‑Forma Eps Or Financing Costs, And The Stock Fell 0.71% To Rp140 On The Announcement Day.

title: PT Asuransi Tugu Pratama Indonesia Tbk Shares Rise 9.5% Amid Foreign Buying And Strong Fundamentals
body: The Stock Closed At Rp1,095 Per Share On Friday With A Transaction Value Of Rp15.2 Billion, Up From Rp5.2 Billion The Day Before, While Foreign Investors Accumulated About Rp1.5 Billion Of Shares. Research Analyst Nurwachidah Of Phintraco Sekuritas Highlighted The Company's Independence From PT. Pertamina, Diversified Premium Base (Only ~30% From Pertamina Group), Solid Offshore Energy Insurance Revenue (11.4% Of H1 2025 Earnings), Robust Capital Ratios And A Decade-Long A- Rating From Am Best.

title: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk. To Acquire Exxonmobil'S Esso Fuel Station Network In Singapore
body: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk., Owned By Taipan Prajogo Pangestu, Signed A Purchase Agreement Through A Special Purpose Vehicle Under Its Wholly‑Owned Subsidiary To Acquire Roughly 60 Exxonmobil‑Owned Esso Stations In Singapore, With Completion Expected By The End Of 2025 After Regulatory Approvals. The Deal, Whose Value Was Not Disclosed, Will Keep The Esso Brand, Continue Fuel Supply From Exxonmobil And Retain Existing Loyalty Points And Cards.

title: PT Bima Sakti Pertiwi Tbk. Reports 49.4% Increase In Net Profit For Year To September 30, 2025
body: The Company Posted A Net Profit Of Rp965.13 Million, Up 49.4% Year‑On‑Year, While Revenue Fell 3.4% To Rp37.77 Billion. Operating Expenses Were Cut 8.4%, Boosting Pre‑Tax Profit 29.8% To Rp1.08 Billion, And Total Assets Rose 1.1% To Rp594.62 Billion.

title: PT Jembo Cable Company Tbk Announces Rp29.48 Bn Share Buyback Targeting 6.5% Of Fujikura Asia Limited Stake
body: The Company Will Repurchase Up To 49.05 Million Shares (About 6.488% Of Its Fujikura Asia Limited Holding) Using Internal Cash Of Rp29.48 Billion Between 23 Oct And 5 Dec 2025, Stating The Transaction Will Not Materially Affect Operations Or Cash Flow. Following The Announcement, Jecc Shares Rose 6.82% On The Day, Up 9.3% Month‑To‑Date And 96.1% Year‑To‑Date.

title: PT Digital Mediatama Maxima Tbk Reports 28.7 Billion Rupiah Net Profit For First Nine Months Of 2025, Driven By Strong Hardware And Advertising Growth
body: The Company Posted A Net Profit Of Rp28.7 Billion For Jan‑Sep 2025, Reversing A Rp46.4 Billion Loss A Year Earlier, With Revenue Of Rp492.0 Billion Boosted By 48.7% Yoy Growth In Hardware Sales, 21.7% In Infrastructure‑As‑A‑Service, And 304.4% In Advertising Exchange. Gross Profit Rose 15% To Rp69.0 Billion (Margin 14%), Operating Profit Reached Rp28.6 Billion Up 38.9% Yoy, And It Now Operates 28,780 Digital Screens At 15,435 Locations.

title: PT Organon Pharma Indonesia Tbk Appoints New Independent Commissioner After Removing Gideon Adi Siallagan
body: At An Extraordinary General Meeting On 21 October 2025, Shareholders Representing 3,556,336 Shares (98.78% Of Voting Rights) Approved The Termination Of Gideon Adi Siallagan As An Independent Commissioner And His Full Settlement. The Meeting Also Appointed Edward As The New Independent Commissioner, Effective Until The Next Annual Meeting In 2026.

title: PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya Buy Shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya bought shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK) at approximately IDR 1,320, increasing holdings from 99,834,800 to 99,901,400. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Edi Yoga Prasetyo Sell Shares of PT Asuransi Tugu Pratama Indonesia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 24, 2025 (WIB), Edi Yoga Prasetyo sold shares of PT Asuransi Tugu Pratama Indonesia Tbk (TUGU.JK) at approximately IDR 1,130, decreasing holdings from 580,600 to 413,400. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia And Brazil Sign Mou To Explore Nuclear Cooperation And Broaden Bilateral Energy And Mineral Partnerships
body: Indonesia And Brazil Signed A Comprehensive Memorandum Of Understanding At The Indonesia-Brazil Forum In Jakarta, With Energy Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Announcing Plans To Explore Nuclear Cooperation And To Deepen Collaboration In Oil, Gas, Renewable Energy, Grid Modernization, Bioenergy, And Mineral Resources. The Agreement Highlights Brazil’s Uranium Resources And Existing Nuclear Power Plants, As Well As Its Large Reserves Of Bauxite, Iron Ore, Lithium, And Niobium, Positioning The Partnership To Support Indonesia’s Energy Transition And Mining Development Goals.

title: Indonesia To Offer Incentives For Ethanol Plant Development Ahead Of 2027 E10 Mandate
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Announced Tax‑Holiday Incentives For Companies Building Ethanol Plants To Meet The 1.4 Million Kiloliters Annual Demand Of The 10 % Bioethanol Blend (E10) Slated For 2027, With President Prabowo Subianto Approving The Policy And Brazil’s Ministry Of Mines And Energy Signing An Mou To Share Expertise. The Plan Aims To Secure Domestic Production From Raw Materials Such As Cassava, Corn, Or Sugarcane, Create Jobs, And Reduce Reliance On Fuel Imports.

title: Indonesia To Mandate 10% Bioethanol Blend In Gasoline Starting 2027 To Cut Fuel Imports
body: Indonesia’s Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Announced That From 2027 The Country Will Require Gasoline To Contain 10% Bioethanol, A Move Aimed At Boosting Energy Independence And Reducing The 330 Million Barrel Oil Import Bill Of 2024. The Policy Follows The Success Of The Biodiesel B40 Program, Which Saved About $40.71 Billion In Foreign Exchange, And Has Received Backing From President Prabowo Subianto And State‑Owned Oil Company Pertamina.

title: Indonesia Unveils Six-Phase Occupational Safety Initiative To Reduce Workplace Accidents By 10% Annually
body: Manpower Minister Yassierli Announced A Series Of Reforms, Including Digital Transformation Of Training And Licensing, Updated Regulations, And A New Integrated Accident Reporting System, As Part Of Indonesia’s 2024‑2029 National Occupational Safety Health Program. The Program Aims To Cut Workplace Accidents By At Least 10% Each Year From The 298,137 Cases Recorded In 2022, Aligning Safety Standards With Global Benchmarks.

title: All Private Gas Station Operators In Indonesia Agree To Negotiate Fuel Supply With Pertamina, Advancing Efforts To Resolve Supply Disruptions
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Of Energy And Mineral Resources Announced That All Private Gas Station Operators Have Entered Negotiations With State‑Owned Oil Company Pertamina Over Fuel Purchases, Following Earlier Talks By PT Vivo Energy Indonesia, PT Anek Petroindo Raya –Akr Corporindo Tbk, And Bp Stations. The Negotiations Have Resolved The Fuel Quality Inspection Issue At The Loading Port, And The Government Is Urging Continued Cooperation As The Process Aligns Cargo Shipments Into A Single Procurement Cycle.

title: Indonesia And Brazil Seek Leadership In Energy Transition And Climate Cooperation
body: At The Indonesia‑Brazil Business Forum In Jakarta, Chairman Anindya Novyan Bakrie Highlighted Both Countries’ Rich Critical‑Mineral Resources And Brazil’s Biofuel Leadership, While Indonesia Announced A Presidential Envoy To The 30Th Un Climate Change Conference In Belém. President Prabowo Subianto Also Met With President Lula To Strengthen Defense Ties, Including Pln’s Partnership With Brazil’s J & F S.A., And To Advance The Indonesia‑Mercosur Economic Agreement.

title: PT Petrosea Tbk Announces Internal Transfer Of Ptro Shares To PT Petrosea Engineering Procurement Construction
body: On 23 October 2025, Petrosea Services Solutions Pte. Ltd. Transferred 100 % Of Ptro’s 50,001 Ordinary Shares (Paid‑Up Capital Sgd 50,001) To PT Petrosea Engineering Procurement Construction As An Affiliation Transaction. The Transfer Is Intended To Align Subsidiary Portfolios, Strengthen The Group’s Engineering, Procurement & Construction Line, And Support Diversification Into The Asia‑Pacific Market While Upholding Good Corporate Governance.

title: PT Superkrane Mitra Utama Tbk Receives $6.5 Million Promissory Note To Fund Purchase Of Hai Long 106 Offshore Vessel
body: The Company Disclosed That It Has Been Issued A Usd 6.5 Million (Approximately Idr 105 Billion) Promissory Note By PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk As Part Of A Strategic Transaction To Acquire The Hai Long 106 Pipe‑Laying And Lifting Vessel From Hilong Shipping Holding Limited. This Move Aligns With PT Superkrane Mitra Utama Tbk’s Plan To Expand Its Role In Offshore Energy, Marine Construction And Related Financing.

title: Ramadhona Sell Shares of PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 25, 2025 (WIB), Ramadhona sold shares of PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk (TOSK.JK) at approximately IDR 82. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Resources Alam Indonesia Reports 97% Decline In Net Income To Usd 1.03 Million For Fy 2025
body: The Company Posted Net Income Of Usd 1.03 Million, Down 97.28% From Usd 37.91 Million A Year Earlier, While Revenue Fell 57.36% To Usd 109.64 Million. Total Assets Dropped To Usd 183.71 Million And Liabilities Fell To Usd 28.23 Million, Reflecting A Sharp Contraction In Earnings And Balance Sheet Size.

title: Red Planet Reports 7.96 Billion Rupiah Net Loss For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, Up 43% From The Same Period Last Year.
body: Red Planet Posted A Net Loss Of Rp7.96 Billion For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, A 43% Increase From Rp5.56 Billion In The Same Period Last Year. Revenue Fell 4.14% To Rp37.69 Billion, Operating Loss Rose To Rp7.81 Billion, And Total Assets Declined To Rp384.61 Billion From Rp393.1 Billion, While Equity Fell To Rp325.32 Billion.

title: Kemenparekraf Launches Game Seed 2025 To Boost Indonesia’S Local Gaming Industry
body: Kemenparekraf Has Unveiled The Game Seed 2025 Program, Offering Emerging Developers Initial Funding, Technical Training, Mentorship, And Marketing Support To Create Globally Competitive Games, With Selected Winners Already Drawing Interest From International Publishers. The Initiative Is Partnered With Unipin And Includes The #Banggamainlokal Campaign To Raise Awareness Of Locally Made Games And Expand The Domestic Gaming Market.

title: Indonesia Accelerates Village Warehouse Outlet Construction Under Kdmp Program, Targeting March 2026 Completion
body: The Indonesian Government, Led By Minister Of Cooperatives Ferry Juliantono, Is Speeding Up The Construction Of Village Warehouses And Outlets Under The Kdmp Program, With About 5,000 Sites Already Under Development And A Daily Inventory Of 1,000 Land Plots. The Initiative Aims To Strengthen Rural Economies, Improve Market Access, And Stabilize Commodity Prices By March 2026.

title: Teguk To Expand Into Frozen Meat And Food Processing, Seeking Shareholder Approval For New Business Activities
body: Teguk Announced Plans To Add Frozen Meat And Food Processing To Its Business, Allocating Rp42.93 Billion From Ipo Proceeds And Seeking Shareholder Approval At A December 2, 2025 Meeting, While Visionary Capital Global Is Set To Acquire A 59.34% Stake In The Company. The Shares, Which Had Fallen To A March Low, Rebounded More Than 100% To About Rp87 Per Share In Early May.

title: Harimas Tunggal Perkasa Divests 1.15 Billion Shares Of Impack Pratama Industri To Increase Free Float
body: Harimas Tunggal Perkasa Sold 1,154,000,000 Shares Of Impack Pratama Industri In Three Simultaneous Transactions On October 23, 2025, At An Average Price Of Rp686.66 Per Share, A 75.03% Discount From The Closing Price Of Rp2,750. The Divestment Generated Rp849.8 Billion, Reducing Harimas's Stake To 42.14% Of The 23.12 Billion Shares Outstanding.

title: PT Sentra Investa Maksima Buy Shares of PT Lavender Bina Cendikia Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 25, 2025 (WIB), PT Sentra Investa Maksima bought shares of PT Lavender Bina Cendikia Tbk (BMBL.JK) at approximately IDR 45, increasing holdings from 11,480,100 to 111,495,100. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Berkah Prima Perkasa Tbk Reports Ongoing Operations Amid Stock Surge And Dividend Announcement
body: PT Berkah Prima Perkasa Tbk’s Ceo Herman Tansri Confirmed The Company Is Still Operating Normally And Has No Significant New Projects, While It Plans To Diversify Into Printing Consumables And Related Services. The Stock Has Surged 98.7% In The Last Month, Leading To A Suspension On 20 October 2025 At Rp1,640 Per Share, And The Company Announced A Cash Dividend For 2024 Despite A Decline In Net Profit, Attributing The Price Rise To Speculative Short‑Term Trading.

title: Indonesia Raises Subsidized Fertilizer Quota To 9.5 Million Tons While Seeking Tighter Distribution Oversight
body: Coordinating Minister Food Zulkifli Hasan Announced That Indonesia Will Increase Its Annual Subsidized Fertilizer Allocation From 4 Million To 9.5 Million Tons And Cut Prices By 20%, Yet Only 6.3 Million Tons Have Been Distributed Nationwide, Prompting Calls For Stricter Monitoring To Prevent Middlemen And Address Farmers’ Demand For Higher Individual Quotas.

title: Indonesia And Turkey Expand Civil Aviation Cooperation, Adding New Direct Routes And Increasing Passenger Rights
body: Indonesia And Turkey Signed Agreements To Broaden Their Bilateral Aviation Network, Adding Direct Flights From Several Indonesian Cities—Including Yogyakarta, Majalengka, Manado, Medan, Balikpapan, Sorong, Kediri, And Lombok—To Turkey And Opening New Turkish Routes To Izmir And Bodrum. The Pact Also Increases Weekly Flight Quotas, Enhances Codeshare Arrangements, And Encourages Utilization Of Unused Entitlements, Aiming To Boost Tourism And Trade Between The Two Nations.

title: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima To Acquire 53.57% Of Personel Alih Daya Shares From Koperasi Pegawai Indosat
body: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Has Entered Into An Indicative Agreement To Acquire 53.57% Of Personel Alih Daya Shares, Amounting To 1,687,455,000 Shares, From Koperasi Pegawai Indosat, With Negotiations Finalized On 23 October 2025. The Transaction Will Be Contingent On Meeting The Conditions Outlined In The Indicative Terms And May Be Terminated If Those Conditions Are Not Satisfied, And Completion Will Result In Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Becoming The New Controlling Shareholder Of Personel Alih Daya.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 53, decreasing holdings from 1,774,881,900 to 1,754,881,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 52, decreasing holdings from 1,792,620,000 to 1,774,881,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 55, decreasing holdings from 1,659,619,900 to 1,644,781,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 52, decreasing holdings from 2,378,620,000 to 2,360,881,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Intan Baru Prana Reports Net Loss Of Rp30.62 Billion For First Nine Months Of 2025, 60.68% Improvement Yoy
body: Intan Baru Prana Posted A Net Loss Of Rp30.62 Billion For The First Nine Months Of 2025, Down 60.68% From The Same Period Last Year, While Revenue Fell To Rp1.01 Billion From Rp2.95 Billion. Service Revenue Surged 1,007% To Rp142.77 Billion And Operating Revenue Jumped 807% To Rp143.78 Billion, But The Company Recorded A Gross Profit Of Rp49.38 Billion And A Total Deficit Of Rp1.63 Trillion, With Assets Rising To Rp500.35 Billion.

title: PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk Nears Acquisition Of PT Mah Sing Indonesia To Expand Automotive Component Portfolio
body: PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk Is Finalizing A Deal To Acquire PT Mah Sing Indonesia, A Manufacturer Of Plastic Automotive Components, With The Transaction Valued Below The 20% Equity Threshold For Material Transactions. The Acquisition Is Expected To Boost Operational Performance And Revenue, And The Company’s Shares Rose 7.92% To Rp1,090 On Monday, Marking A 10.4% Monthly Gain And A 24.4% Year‑To‑Date Increase.

title: Pimsf Pulogadung Becomes New Controlling Shareholder Of Geoprima Solusi After Acquiring 45.45% From Karnadi Margaka
body: Pimsf Pulogadung Purchased 303,033,800 Shares (45.45%) Of Geoprima Solusi From Karnadi Margaka And Will Launch A Mandatory Tender Offer For The Remaining Public Shares At Rp436 Per Share, Allocating Up To Rp158.57 Billion From Internal Cash. The Tender Will Be Announced On 10 Nov 2025, Run From 11 Nov To 11 Dec 2025, With Settlement By 15 Dec 2025, And Pimsf Pulogadung Has No Plans To Delist Or Alter Dividend Policy.

title: Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Divests 1.09 Billion Diamond Citra Shares In 12 Simultaneous Trades, Raising Rp57.03 Billion
body: On 23 October 2025, Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sold 1.09 Billion Diamond Citra Shares At An Average Price Of Rp55.66 Per Share, Above The Closing Price Of Rp50, Generating Total Proceeds Of Rp57.03 Billion. After The Transactions, Its Holding Fell To 1.62 Billion Shares (21.86% Of Total), A Dilution Of About 16.04% From The Pre‑Sale Level Of 2.81 Billion Shares (37.9%).

title: PT Multi Makmur Lemindo Tbk Embarks On A Major Transformation To The Energy Sector After PT Morris Capital Indonesia Acquires A 48.88% Stake And Plans A Rp3 Trillion Asset Injection
body: PT Morris Capital Indonesia Has Taken A 48.88% Share Of PT Multi Makmur Lemindo Tbk And Announced A Rp3 Trillion Asset Injection To Shift The Company From Plastic Pipe Manufacturing To A Vertically Integrated Energy‑Logistics Business Covering Oil‑Gas, Fuel Distribution, And Storage. The Stock Is Trading Around Rp338‑Rp394 Per Share, Far Above The Rp21 Tender Price But Below Its Earlier Peak Of Rp625, Reflecting Market Uncertainty Over The Execution Of The New Strategy.

title: Pertamina Geothermal Energy Reports 22% Decline In Net Profit For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025
body: Pertamina Geothermal Energy Posted A Net Profit Of Usd104.27 Million For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, A 22.18% Decline From Usd133.99 Million A Year Earlier, With Earnings Per Share Falling To Usd0.0025. Revenue Rose 4.19% To Usd318.86 Million, While Total Assets Decreased To Usd2.96 Billion And Liabilities To Usd957.39 Million.

title: Clipan Finance Reports Q3 2025 Profit Of Rp135.65 Billion, Down 15.6% Year‑On‑Year
body: For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, Clipan Finance Posted A Net Profit Of Rp135.65 Billion, A 15.56% Decline From Rp160.66 Billion A Year Earlier, With Earnings Per Share Falling To Rp34.05 From Rp40.32. Total Revenue Slipped 10.29% To Rp1.22 Trillion, While Equity Fell To Rp5.7 Trillion And Assets Contracted To Rp9.74 Trillion.

title: Director Ramadhona Divests Entire 5.16% Stake In PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk, Selling 225.82 Million Shares For Approx. Rp17.5 Billion
body: Between 21 And 24 October 2025, Ramadhona Sold 225.82 Million Shares Of PT Topindo Solusi Komunika Tbk At Prices Ranging From Rp74 To Rp81.5, Totaling About Rp17.5 Billion And Leaving Him With 0% Ownership; The Stock Closed 2.67% Lower At Rp73, Having Fallen 27.7% From Its Late‑September Peak While Gaining 32.7% Year‑To‑Date.

title: PT Cakra Buana Resources Energi Tbk. Announces Addition Of International Shipping And Offshore Support Services, Seeking Shareholder Approval At An Extraordinary Meeting
body: The Company Will Add Two New Indonesian Business Classifications (Kbli 50141 And 52229) To Enter International Shipping And Offshore Support, With A Strategic Partnership With An International Epc And Offshore Oil‑Gas Operator, And Will Seek Approval At A Shareholders’ Meeting On 27 Oct 2025. At Friday’s Close, Cbre’s Shares Rose 18.49% (245 Points) To Rp1,570.

title: PT Barito Pacific Tbk’S Rp215.5 Bn Of Bonds Set To Mature In 2025‑2026, Repayment To Be Funded By New Issuance
body: Indonesia’s Rating Agency Pefindo Reports That PT Barito Pacific Tbk’s Sustainable Ii (Rp163 Bn, Maturing 8 Dec 2025) And Sustainable Iii (Rp52.52 Bn, Maturing 8 Feb 2026) Bonds, Total Rp215.52 Bn, Will Be Repaid Using Proceeds From A Forthcoming Bond Issue. The Company’s June 2025 Financials Show Usd 3.1 Bn In Cash And Cash Equivalents, Indicating Strong Liquidity To Meet The Obligations.

title: PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. Atau Bni And Subsidiaries Highlight Umkm At Wondr Jrf Expo 2025
body: Through PT Bank Hibank Indonesia, PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk. Atau Bni Showcased Three Umkm Brands (Hi Soto Kudus, Hi Siomay, Hi Coffee) Along With Other Merchants At The Wondr Jrf Expo 2025, Emphasizing Its Commitment To Strengthen Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises And Integrate Digital Payment Solutions. Bni Life Also Provided Protection And Investment Consultations, Reinforcing The Bank's Role In Linking Umkm, The Creative Economy, And Urban Lifestyle.

title: PT Repower Asia Indonesia Tbk Plans Shift To Digital Property With Data Center Development
body: PT Repower Asia Indonesia Tbk Is Preparing A Fundamental Transformation From Conventional Property Development To Digital Property, Targeting Data Center Projects In Strategic Locations Such As Jabodetabek And Other Major Cities. Analysts Note The Indonesian Data Center Market Could Reach Us$2 Billion By 2027, And View The Move As A Potential Positive Catalyst For The Company's Medium- To Long-Term Stock Performance.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 54, decreasing holdings from 2,340,881,900 to 2,245,619,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 51, decreasing holdings from 2,816,281,900 to 2,378,620,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 56, decreasing holdings from 2,230,781,900 to 2,230,281,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 55, decreasing holdings from 2,245,619,900 to 2,230,781,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 51, decreasing holdings from 2,230,281,900 to 1,792,620,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Indonesia Accelerates Fishermen Village Program To Boost Coastal Economy
body: Indonesia’s Ministry Of Marine Affairs And Fisheries, Under President Prabowo Subianto, Is Fast‑Tracking The Knmp Fishermen Village Program, Launching 100 Sites In The First Phase And Planning To Upgrade 1,000 Villages By 2029, While Also Targeting The Construction Of 1,582 Modern Fishing Boats By 2027. The Pilot Project In Merauke Reportedly Doubled Fishermen Incomes, Illustrating The Program’s Potential To Lift Coastal Livelihoods And Stimulate Regional Economic Growth.

title: Fuji Finance Indonesia Reports Strong Asset Growth And Liquidity Surge To Rp182.2 Billion By End-August 2025
body: Fuji Finance Indonesia’s Total Assets Rose To Rp182.20 Billion, Up From Rp176.52 Billion At Year‑End 2024, While Its Current Ratio Jumped To 106× And Cash And Cash Equivalents Grew 15% To Rp95.64 Billion. Earnings Before Tax Increased 15%, And Earnings Per Share Climbed 15% To Rp4.87, Reflecting Disciplined Risk Management And Operational Efficiency, According To Ceo Anita Marta.

title: PT Abadimukti Gunalestari Reduces Its Stake In PT Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk. After Large Share Sale In October 2025
body: Between 15‑21 October 2025, PT Abadimukti Gunalestari Sold 542.81 Million Gpra Shares At Rp125‑Rp129 Each, Generating About Rp68.05 Billion, While Buying Back 59.52 Million Shares For Roughly Rp7.55 Billion, Resulting In A Net Sale Of About 483 Million Shares And A Decline In Ownership From 54.59% To 43.29% (1.85 Billion Shares). After The Transactions, Gpra’s Stock Was Flat At Rp127 Per Share On The Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 56, decreasing holdings from 1,644,781,900 to 1,644,281,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 54, decreasing holdings from 1,754,881,900 to 1,659,619,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 80, decreasing holdings from 1,644,281,900 to 1,624,281,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia Sell Shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 26, 2025 (WIB), PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia sold shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk. (DADA.JK) at approximately IDR 53, decreasing holdings from 2,360,881,900 to 2,340,881,900. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Jhonlin Agro Reports 44.19% Profit Increase To Rp224 Billion For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025
body: Jhonlin Agro Posted A Net Profit Of Rp224 Billion For The Quarter Ended 30 September 2025, A 44.19% Increase Year‑On‑Year, With Earnings Per Share Rising To Rp24.27. Revenue Grew 17.11% To Rp3.08 Trillion, While Total Assets Fell To Rp3.99 Trillion, Equity Rose To Rp1.87 Trillion And Liabilities Declined To Rp2.11 Trillion.

title: Antam Posts 197% Jump In Net Profit To Idr 6.61 Trillion In The First Nine Months Of 2025
body: The Company Recorded Net Profit Of Idr 6.61 Trillion, Ebitda Of Idr 9.33 Trillion And Eps Of Idr 248.62, Driven By A 67% Rise In Revenue To Idr 72.03 Trillion And A 2455% Increase In Operating Cash Flow To Idr 4.06 Trillion. Sales Were Led By Gold (81% Of Total, Up 64% Yoy) While Nickel, Bauxite And Alumina Also Posted Strong Growth In Production And Sales.

title: PT Jaya Sukses Makmur Sentosa Tbk Announces A Right‑Issue To Fund Land‑Bank Expansion To 890 Ha By 2026
body: The Company Plans To Raise Capital Through A Right Issue To Increase Its Land Reserve From 713 To 890 Hectares, Adding Projects In Java And Kalimantan Such As Tanrise City Bandung, Tanrise City Sidoarjo, Taman Dayu Property & Golf, And Tanrise Industrial Estate Banjarbaru. Its Shares Fell 14.8% To Rp10,750, After Having Risen 209% Year‑To‑Date Since September 2025.

title: Green Power Posts Rp5.51 Billion Net Profit For Fy 2025, Up 209.96% From Same Period Last Year
body: Green Power's Net Profit Rose To Rp5.51 Billion For The Year Ended 30 September 2025, A 209.96% Increase From The Previous Year’s Loss Of Rp5.92 Billion. Revenue Surged 549.37% To Rp31.3 Billion, While Operating Profit Turned Positive At Rp6.75 Billion, And Total Assets Climbed To Rp157.49 Billion Against Rp93.05 Billion Last Year.

title: Real Shares Surge As Foreign Investors Back Digital Property Transformation
body: On Monday, 27 October 2025, Real's Shares Jumped To An Auto Reject Level After A Net Foreign Buy Of 11.16 Million Shares, While The Broader Market Fell 1.87%. The Company’s Shift From Conventional Real Estate To Digital Property, Especially Data Centers, Is Seen As A Fundamental Transformation That Could Lead To A Re‑Rating And Long‑Term Growth, With Analysts Noting Strong Investor Interest And Potential Upside To Rp140‑150 If The Price Breaks Rp100.

title: Indonesia Declares Nuclear Power A Strategic Pillar Of Its Long‑Term Energy Transition
body: Deputy Energy Minister Yuliot Tanjung Announced That Indonesia Will Make Nuclear Power Central To Its Energy Mix, Targeting 5% Share By 2030 And 11% By 2060, With The First Plant Expected By 2032 And A 44 Gw Capacity Goal By 2060. He Noted The $3.8 Billion Cost Per Plant, A Four‑To‑Five‑Year Construction Timeline, And The Need For Rigorous Safety Oversight.

title: PT Hillcon Equity Management Sell Shares of PT Hillcon Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 27, 2025 (WIB), PT Hillcon Equity Management sold shares of PT Hillcon Tbk (HILL.JK) at approximately IDR 220, decreasing holdings from 7,134,313,000 to 6,555,413,000. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buy Shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: According to the published announcement on October 27, 2025 (WIB), Patrick Rudolf Dannacher bought shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) at approximately IDR 1,310, increasing holdings from 180,212,120 to 181,722,120. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Kundy Wijaya Sell Shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa Tbk
body: According to the published announcement on October 27, 2025 (WIB), Kundy Wijaya sold shares of PT Kusuma Kemindo Sentosa Tbk (KKES.JK) at approximately IDR 30, decreasing holdings from 85,124,600 to 84,567,800. This filing was disclosed by the exchange.

title: Sentul City Reports 96% Revenue Growth And 186% Profit Surge In Q3 2025
body: In Q3 2025, Sentul City Posted Revenue Of Idr 836.97 Billion, Up 96.28% Yoy, And Net Profit Of Idr 74.15 Billion, Up 186.22%, Driven By Strong Land Sales And Diversified Segments Including Hotel, Restaurant, Amusement Park, And City Management. The Company Highlighted Continued Demand From Younger Buyers And Announced Plans To Launch Two New Projects, Spring Hill And Spring Garden Phase 2, Along With A Commercial Retail Development In 2026.

title: Sarimelati Kencana Reports Q3 2025 Profit Of Rp15.91 Billion, Reversing Prior Loss
body: Sarimelati Kencana Posted A Net Profit Of Rp15.91 Billion In Q3 2025, A 116.45% Increase From A Loss Of Rp96.71 Billion A Year Earlier, With Basic Diluted Eps Turning Positive To Rp5.29. Net Sales Rose 11.33% To Rp2.26 Trillion, Profit Before Tax Reached Rp20.77 Billion, Equity Grew To Rp1.03 Trillion While Liabilities Fell To Rp917.57 Billion And Total Assets Decreased To Rp1.95 Trillion.

title: Martin Suharlie Buy Shares of PT M Cash Integrasi Tbk
